candidates.why_stand: Whanganui is a uniquely beautiful city that I've had the privilege to bring my four daughters up in. Whanganui is such a fantastic and affordable place to live life in a full and healthy manner and I'm passionate about ensuring people make good healthy lifestyle choices to maximise their wellbeing.

candidates.name: Judith MacDonald
candidates.why_elect: My day job is a senior manager/clinician in the health sector. I am informed and educated about health systems locally and nationally. I am a courageous leader, and advocate for those that do not have a voice and I care about our communities and committed to positive change.
candidates.why_stand: Health is complex and I am an experienced governor and leader in the health sector and we need this skill set at the board table. I am local and I am rural. I care about access for those living in rural communities and I care about inequalities that exist.

candidates.name: Rebecca Tayler
candidates.why_elect: I'm a big believer in patient-centric healthcare, and think about the impact of governance decisions on patients. I'm a community builder, and an effective and articulate communicator. I have lots of experience working with boards, having served on a range of groups and committees. I'm a capable, qualified working parent.
candidates.why_stand: I'm experienced in complex public policy issues, and can use these skills to help sensibly navigate some of the pressing challenges we're facing—ageing population, increased demand for healthcare and finite resources—alongside the rapid advances in technology and increasing community expectations. And I like a challenge.

candidates.name: John Waldon
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in our community for 25 years, volunteered for several community-based organisations and have developed a wealth of experience in their effective governance.
candidates.why_stand: The Manawatu, Horowhenua and Tararua deserve the bestcare we can provide and I have the skills, experience and knowledge provide the governance support to do this.

candidates.name: Jenny Warren
candidates.why_elect: Having worked in a range of maternal health roles and governance groups over the last decade I have had great insight into the many demands which exist. This experience, along with my pragmatic and professional approach, will make me an ideal candidate. I genuinely care for our communities wellbeing.
candidates.why_stand: I am concerned about the inequities existing within the health system. I have lived and worked in this community for most of my life and am deeply connected to it. I want to ensure increased quality of living and wellbeing for all, from conception through to caring for our elderly.

candidates.name: Shelly Warwick
candidates.why_elect: I care about my community, the people in it, but also people within other MidCentral DHB communities struggling with the same issues in accessing health care, cost, availability, transport and accessibility. Somehow we need our health services to be more user friendly, listen to our consumers, while sticking to budgets.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because I believe Otaki, on the South Western boundary of the DHB needs a voice at the Board table. My nursing background stands me in good stead to understand the needs of patients and the pressure on services. Wellbeing for Otaki people is the Goal.

candidates.name: Astarte
candidates.why_elect: During the past 21 years I have provided quality soft-tissue massage and life coaching services to Manawatu residents and visitors. I recognise the excellent services provided by the MDHB and also perceive shortcomings in the system. I am ready to address these issues and offer support to remediate them.
candidates.why_stand: A former MDHB Member suggested I stand. After due consideration I submitted my nominations because I'd like to make a difference in the health sector.

candidates.name: Heather Browning
candidates.why_elect: I worked with the Ministry of Health and within the MidCentral District Health Board for many years. I know how the systems work and know how they can falter. I have years of senior management and governance experience. I have also had repeated personal/family experiences with health services.
candidates.why_stand: The MidCentral Region is one filled with great diversity and cultural wealth. I want to ensure that our health and disability services are designed and delivered to reflect the wonderful diversity of our rural and urban communities and ensure that services are culturally safe, responsive and accessible.

candidates.name: Lew Findlay
candidates.why_elect: My record shows I listen to people and will always represent them to the very best of my ability. Always seeing that everyone gets a fair hearing.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see fair and equitable access for everyone throughout the whole Mid Central Health District. I believe our Health District can be the best in NZ with good leadership.

candidates.name: Adrian Gregory
candidates.why_elect: In my community, Otaki, I represented Birthright during the DHB's Locality Planning and for a year I have been Chair of the local Health Advisory Group. I proposed a new 'complaints' process in the recent MOU with CCDHB. I have extensive experience in governance in health, charity and education sectors.
candidates.why_stand: I have worked with health organisations here and in the UK for almost 20 years and health is at the core of my fee-paying and voluntary work. I am totally committed to shaping innovative solutions for future health services while maintaining a financially viable DHB with a great staff team.

candidates.name: Dorothy Lock
candidates.why_elect: This community has supported me for 45 years, so I want to use the experience and learning that I have gained here to support the future health and well being of the whole of the region. It will be a pleasure to have the opportunity.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived in the Tararua area for 45 years. I was in farming for 23 years and in nursing for 22 years. Dannevirke is my home now and I think it is a wonderful place to live.

candidates.name: Karen Naylor
candidates.why_elect: I have significant governance experience, which includes 9 years on Midcentral DHB, 8 years on the New Zealand Nurses Organisation Board of Directors, and 3 years as a Palmerston North City Councillor. I currently chair the Health and Disability Advisory Committee. I advocate for transparency and accountability of board decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I am a Registered Nurse with 24 years experience working at the Palmerston North Hospital, so I bring an important clinical perspective to the DHB board table. I understand the needs of patients and the challenges that health care professionals face on a daily basis.

candidates.name: Cat Pause
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Palmerston North since moving to NZ in 2008. I have postgraduate degrees in public health, sociology, and human development. And I have served on local and National boards. I bring a unique set of skills in my combination of academic qualifications and governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: I am committed to ensuring appropriate delivery of services and ensuring that people receive evidenced based quality healthcare, regardless of their size.

candidates.name: Leslie Pillow
candidates.why_elect: I am a comparative newcomer to the region and have been impressed by the facilities. I am keen to ensure that they continue to improve. It is important that we elect a Board that is culturally and ethnically diverse, representative of our community.
candidates.why_stand: For my grandchildren and to help ensure that we continue to have world class health facilities available.

candidates.before_politics: MD as well as NGO Chairman
candidates.name: Richard Stein
candidates.why_elect: I will bring years of governance experience to the Board. Among other roles, I was Chief of Staff and a board member of a major U.S. medical centre. As current Chairman of Crohn's and Colitis NZ, I have regular dealings with the Health Ministry, Pharmac, and other policy makers.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we need a doctor on the Board. We need someone who has worked within the system and knows first-hand its strengths and weaknesses. Provider and patient concerns are not being addressed. I want to give these concerns a voice.

candidates.name: Kamiria Mid Thomas-Savelio
candidates.why_elect: I have been in business for myself and managed other organisations for over 20 years. Align this to an MBA from Victoria University and a strong appetite for governance and I believe I have the skill set required to be a fully functioning member of the DHB.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for the DHB because I have a deep passion for health and wellbeing. As a person who has been on the frontline of health for over 25 years I would love the opportunity to help the community with which I live in.

candidates.name: Josh Briggs
candidates.why_elect: I have a strong background in health. I worked as part of a primary health care multidisciplinary team. I have achieved widespread governance experience on national and local boards, including in my previous role as Chairperson of Vibe and my current role as a Hutt City Councillor.
candidates.why_stand: I want more effective healthcare for our community. I'm passionate about healthcare equality, mental health support in our communities, a thriving primary care system and valuing our healthcare workforce. I understand the factors that contribute towards health and wellbeing and I want to advocate for my community.

candidates.name: Keri Brown
candidates.why_elect: The Hutt is my home. I've got the right mix of experience. I've worked in government in advisory roles, in the community where I rolled my sleeves up and worked on policy. I've seen the need for better health services and I know I can be that strong voice.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our community deserves a top quality, equal health service and at the moment, we don't have that. I lost close family to cancer and saw first-hand the lack of consistent health services. I don't want other families feeling confused about what is happening to their loved ones.

candidates.name: Cheryl Davies
candidates.why_elect: I bring extensive knowledge and I understand the need to address health inequities for Māori and communities in need. I have 20 years experience working on a number of research studies that have given voice to our communities to talk about the health and aspirations they have for their whānau.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived in Wainuiomata for most of my life and I am passionate about the Hutt Valley community. I have had the privilege of providing health services to whānau/families in the Hut Valley over the past 30 years.

candidates.name: Wayne Guppy
candidates.why_elect: I am a former pharmacist so I understand the health system and have good governance experience as the Mayor of Upper Hutt, Deputy Chair of the District HB and Chair of the Hutt Valley Finance and Audit Committee (FRAC) and Co-chair of the CCHB/HVDHB FRAC.
candidates.why_stand: As Deputy Chair of the HVDHB I see the approach that is being taken now with close calibration with Capital Coast very exciting as we deliver a world class health service to the people of the region, in particular the Hutt Valley.

candidates.name: David Ogden
candidates.why_elect: I have lived a professional life in finance and chartered accountancy, and have served as a corporate treasurer, and financial controller. As well I have served as an elected person to make sure that the board or body I serve on is one of the best in New Zealand.
candidates.why_stand: I have to come to love the work that we do on the health board, due to people involved, the importance of it in our community and region. I wish to continue to devote myself to serving on this board.

candidates.name: Kathryn Adams
candidates.why_elect: My Public Health Nurse experience defines my commitment to protecting health outcomes of people in our region. We must achieve equity for our communities, especially Māori and Pacific People, those with disabilities and lower socioeconomic status or enduring mental illness—through integrating primary and secondary services.
candidates.why_stand: As a registered nurse with a PhD, experienced in nursing leadership and management roles in clinical practice, hospital management, nursing education and clinical research, I seek re-election to CCDHB.

candidates.name: Letitia O'Dwyer
candidates.why_elect: My experience includes; NGOs, introducing new health technologies, improving access to medicines, initiating trials, and establishing strong national and international healthcare networks. I hold a Bachelor of Science, a Post Grad Diploma in Business, and a Masters in Health Management. I've sat on international and national advisory boards.
candidates.why_stand: 25 years dedicated to the NZ healthcare sector has given me a wide breadth of knowledge into understanding the challenges. It's about embracing them and working together to improve healthcare outcomes. I'd like to be part of the next generation of improvements; developing people, processes, partnerships, technology, and funding.

candidates.name: Chris Kalderimis
candidates.why_elect: I am good at listening and thinking laterally. I think that I can also work with people from different walks of life.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that I have something to offer in the area of healthcare especially after 40 years of general practice and involvement in Hospice and Ambulance governance.

candidates.name: Nathan Clark
candidates.why_elect: I have worked in the health sector for 11 years, including different roles at the Ministry of Health and as the health private secretary to the Minister of Health. I am the strategy and planning manager at Hutt Valley DHB. I live in Porirua with my wife and two children.
candidates.why_stand: I want my health sector expertise and knowledge to contribute to the Board's decisions. I want to help ensure that the decisions are first and foremost based on achieving equity and improving people's health and wellbeing—now and into the future.

candidates.name: Sue Kedgley
candidates.why_elect: I'm an elected Health Board member and an effective and experienced health advocate. As a former MP and parliamentary Health spokesperson, I've led campaigns for better nutrition, aged care and over-use of antibiotics. I have extensive governance experience, experience in the health sector and a passion to improve healthcare.
candidates.why_stand: Our DHB faces big challenges—financial pressures, increasing demand for health services, inequity in healthcare. As a long-term champion of good health, I want to be a voice for our community, an advocate for the vulnerable, and I want to improve the quality and equity of healthcare in our region.

candidates.name: John Apanowicz
candidates.why_elect: I've worked in the health sector for the last 12 years at the Capital and Coast DHB and other health entities. I know the systems, the people and what it takes to deliver results.
candidates.why_stand: I'm a born and bred Wellingtonian, I know our community, and I have the skills and experience to make a real difference. I can do that on the Capital and Coast District Health Board.

candidates.name: Susan Turner
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Wellington for over 25 years, been involved in healthcare in NZ and Australia. Travelled extensively understanding other international health systems. Involved in health governance. I have tackled really complex issues in health with real success. Courageous, fight for justice, possess integrity and I listen/act.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about our healthcare and our community. I want to ensure that the health system is working for us all and making a difference. Our local health system is struggling because of the bureaucracy—we can do better. Listen to our staff and communities.

candidates.name: Marion Clark
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Wellington for over 30 years. I have over fifty years experience working in the health sector. My experience includes nursing, health services management and board governance, health policy development and management (Ministry of Health), and health workforce regulation in NZ and also overseas.
candidates.why_stand: I am keen to use my considerable health expertise to make a difference to the healthcare services provided to the people of Wellington and ensure that the population is as healthy as it can be. I believe that my knowledge and experience of health can ensure good decision-making.

candidates.name: Letitia Isa
candidates.why_elect: I am a working mum (until my son fell ill). I have literally lived at the Hospital and know the gaps from living it. I am not political or politically correct and have worked for much larger and smaller organisations than CCDHB and bring with me the voice of families.
candidates.why_stand: I am an MBA qualified mother of a chronically ill child with a background in HR and Finance who wants to take the politics out of healthcare. That's why I am standing as a truly independent voice for patients and parents based on real life experience of CCDHB.

candidates.name: Vanessa Simpson
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the CCDHB region for most of my life. 16 years frontline experience with Wellington Free Ambulance (WFA) has connected me with the real issues in our communities. As a WFA executive, I have strong and productive relationships with primary, secondary and specialist services across the CCDHB.
candidates.why_stand: I feel passionately that healthcare should be patient centred. I'm driven to improve patient outcomes by ensuring those who need healthcare get the highest quality care and support.

candidates.name: Roger Blakeley
candidates.why_elect: I have enjoyed a career in the public service, including being Chief Executive of Ministry for the Environment, Department of Internal Affairs and Porirua City Council. My experience in public policy and public management is directly relevant to the governance challenges for CCDHB and improving health for the region.
candidates.why_stand: I am committed to serving at a governance level to improve healthcare in the CCDHB region. I like working in an area where there are huge challenges and opportunities, like the health system. I am motivated by the chance to make a difference to improve health in the region.

candidates.name: Simon Marsh
candidates.why_elect: This job is about governance, (I heard you yawn) it is is about putting in place policies and strategies that give our amazing medical professionals the tools to provide the best healthcare in NZ. I've been a broadcaster, councillor, board director with considerable governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: I have spent nine years as a Wellington City Councillor in what is regarded as one of the world's most liveable cities. Yet I've seen and experienced gaps in our health care that let people down. I believe we can do better by working more closely within our communities.

candidates.name: Ayesha Verrall
candidates.why_elect: As a specialist doctor I know our health services from the ground up. I know a lot of the people I care for in hospital could have had their illness prevented if only we invested in basic things like vaccination, cancer screening and more accessible general practice.
candidates.why_stand: As a doctor I want you to get the care you need, when you need it. But each year DHBs are asked to do more with less. We need to invest in keeping people healthy and collaborate with local doctors so hospital is available for you when you need it.

candidates.name: David Shand
candidates.why_elect: I have a strong commitment to our public sector. I have a hard head (being realistic, looking at facts and being analytical) but a soft heart (a real concern for the underdog and those in need), which I have applied throughout my extensive governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: I want to contribute to improving the performance of our public health system. While Government determines funding, good DHB governance through sound planning, prioritization, contracting with service providers, rigorous monitoring of financial and service performance and holding senior management accountable is also key to improving performance.

candidates.name: John Peters
candidates.why_elect: Have many doctors in my family who advise me from time to time how DHB should be running.
candidates.why_stand: Migrant voices also need to be heard.

candidates.name: Eileen Brown
candidates.why_elect: I have a track record of accountability to the people in the region that this DHB serves through being responsive, developing and building relationships and reporting back on issues that have been raised. I am proud to be an endorsed Labour Party candidate and this ensures additional accountability.
candidates.why_stand: I'm ambitious for our DHB to be delivering the best health services in Wellington, Porirua and Kāpiti so people get the health services they need and deserve. My strengths on the Board are my nursing background, experience on the DHB Board, understanding of health issues and my strong community connections.

candidates.name: Ana Coffey
candidates.why_elect: I have nine years local government experience as a city councillor, three years as deputy mayor. I am currently a DHB board member. I have been a strong advocate for my community, reflecting the challenges and opportunities that we face.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the DHB should reflect the diversity of the community. I have been a strong advocate for equity. My community is most affected by underinvestment in our health outcomes. The health dollar is stretched, so I'm focussed on investing in a health system that delivers quality services for everyone.

candidates.name: Glenda Hughes
candidates.why_elect: I worked in government the private sector and health. I have been a Chair of a major commercial organisation, I also sit on philanthropic boards and charities that address NZ's social issues. I am currently on the Parole Board, Kids Can and Pet Refuge.
candidates.why_stand: I have supported the leadership of Canterbury and Capital Coast District Health Boards executives in the management of difficult challenges including the overseeing of the CCDHB lab implementation. And I am committed to ensuring that everyone has access to the health care they need in a fair society.

candidates.name: Ryan Soriano
candidates.why_elect: As the DHB is embarking to provide its vision and values to be embedded by 2024. With the full participation of its leaders, staff and the community, It is a high time for me to represent what the people wanted the DHB would look like moving forward.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived my whole NZ life in the Wairarapa and I have strongly believed from the start that this is the best place to raise a family. If we have a strong regional health system, more and more people will love to live and stay here.

candidates.name: Jill Stringer
candidates.why_elect: I've live in the Wairarapa for 27 years, worked in health for 40, and now run my own business. I have a track record of working with people, groups, agencies and government for good outcomes. I want better results from the money we spend on health.
candidates.why_stand: I think we have good health services in the Wairarapa, but some of our health outcomes are not so great for Māori, children, those living with disability, disease or mental distress. I want Wairarapa people to live well, age well and have access to health services they understand and trust.

candidates.name: Don Baskerville
candidates.why_elect: I have worked in the procurement team in the Ministry of Health and I am a patient at Whaiora medical practice so I am connected to the local community while having professional financial skills.
candidates.why_stand: I will use my procurement and risk management experience to help manage the finances.

candidates.name: Stephen Butcher
candidates.why_elect: I have a background in architecture, contract management and cancer research. I believe I have the skills for fiscal responsibility at Board level and an appreciation of the changes we must make as a community to restore our quality of life.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion for supporting enlightened health care for both our well-being and to secure the long term viability of our hospital and community health services.

candidates.name: Joy Cooper
candidates.why_elect: I have had many years experience in senior management roles across the health sector, including at Wairarapa DHB, ACC and the Ministry of Health, plus governance experience in the not-for-profit sector. I have the business acumen, knowledge and skills to make a strong contribution to Board decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I believe fervently that everyone should have easy access to good health care and I want to help Wairarapa DHB ensure you are able to receive the best care possible from the resources available, when, how and where you need it.

candidates.name: Norman Gray
candidates.why_elect: I am devoted and loyal to the Wairarapa and its Health Services. I have decades of front line experience in health. I also have experience in planning and implementation through a secondary career in the army reserve. This experience has been gained locally and overseas.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we are in a crisis with loss of services from the Wairarapa because of loss of autonomy to the larger health boards in the Hutt and Wellington. We need board members with an awareness of what is happening at ground level.

candidates.name: Peter McCardle
candidates.why_elect: My over 15 years of experience in health at a Government and board level have provided me with real insight into how health services are planned and resourced at a high and district level. With a budget of over 140 million, there are many priorities to balance.
candidates.why_stand: I have gained knowledge and experience as a Cabinet Minister, on the Hutt Health Board, and Senior Advisor to two Health Ministers. Having had my life saved by the public health system, I want to give something back.

candidates.name: Helen Pocknall
candidates.why_elect: I am a registered nurse with extensive experience having worked in community and hospital settings and with NGOs, and in a senior leadership role. I believe I have a very good understanding of the challenges that face our population and our health system's ability to meet the growing need.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the people of the Wairarapa deserve to receive the best quality health care with the ability to access services as close to home as possible. I can add value to the governance of our health system as a registered nurse and with my extensive experiential health system knowledge.

candidates.name: Leigh Manson
candidates.why_elect: I believe healthcare services have traditionally not been designed to support people to be who they value being and do what the value doing. I want to see this change so that what really matters to people drives the design and delivery of services.
candidates.why_stand: Since I was a girl I have wanted to make the world a better place and have spent most of my adult life improving the experience of, access to and quality of healthcare services. I want to use my experience and skills to improve the services our DHB offers.

candidates.name: Paul Matheson
candidates.why_elect: I have a history of community engagement from rotary to school boards, commerce and conservation. I believe I know my community well.
candidates.why_stand: I have extensive governance experience running Nelson city and wish to share this in the health sector.

candidates.name: Garth Munro
candidates.why_elect: My clinical background and health management experience in strategic governance will enable me to quickly understand and guide the NMDHB towards a more efficient and clinically appropriate direction for the people of the region.
candidates.why_stand: I have over thirty years of clinical and health management experience in both the Private and Public/Hospital Health sector and seek to utilise this experience and energy to improve the health services in the Nelson/Tasman/Marlborough region.

candidates.name: Jacinta Newport
candidates.why_elect: I am a long term Nelson resident and experienced PHC nurse. I have extensive experience working in this region and also have extended my practice to embrace indigenous healthcare in Australia in remote settings. I have a special interest in chronic pain.
candidates.why_stand: I see flaws in the current delivery of health care services in our region and with my background as a rural Nurse Specialist and Primary health care nurse would like to contribute to the discussion on how to improve better health services for all and especially those with significant disability.

candidates.name: Allan Panting
candidates.why_elect: Although having practised as a surgeon, I have a very good understanding of the wider issues of healthcare. I don't have any particular agendas other than ensuring we base our health care upon sound supporting evidence.
candidates.why_stand: With a background strong in clinical and leadership experience, and having served one term as a Board member, I believe I can contribute to the Nelson Marlborough District Health Board.

candidates.name: Ian Pirie
candidates.why_elect: I am honest and diligent and have a track record of achievement. I make commonsense decisions and believe we have a great health system that needs improvement and structural tweaking. I am particularly interested in the outcomes of the government review currently being undertaken. I have leadership and governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: I have a background in emergency air ambulance services, leadership and board experience is these areas and would like to put my knowledge and experience to work for our Marlborough and Nelson/Tasman communities.

candidates.name: Stephen Vallance
candidates.why_elect: Having worked in health care all my working life I understand the difficulties of providing health services. I have extensive experience on professional and other committees and boards. I know how strongly the Marlborough community feels about it's local health services.
candidates.why_stand: I love Marlborough. I worked as a surgeon at the Hospital for 24 years. I am passionate to ensure high quality services are maintained locally.

candidates.name: Brigid Forrest
candidates.why_elect: Experience and reality as I am still working on the health system.
candidates.why_stand: I feel that I have significant experience and understanding of the health system to be able to offer good feedback and governance. Health provision will always be a financial balancing act between modern advances in diagnosis and treatment so we need to encourage better health literacy and equity for all.

candidates.name: Bernie Goldsmith
candidates.why_elect: I was raised by my grandparents. I was the moko that looked after my sick nanny when everyone else went out to play. Caring is in my heart and soul. I bring to the table honesty, integrity, frugal spending and practical common sense approach to problem solving.
candidates.why_stand: Kia ora, I stood because I'd heard that there were two compulsory Māori positions for the NMDHB and I thought the 'odds' were in my favour. I then heard no Māori have been elected from community votes and government elects their Māori mates in the area. NOOOO $200 deposit lost.

candidates.name: John Hutton
candidates.why_elect: The level of oversight for a half-billion $ budget requires experience in policy and organisational development, governance, and strategic visioning. Having worked in many international, multi-billion $ companies, I have that level of experience. My MBA (economics) and consulting background give me an excellent background for the DHB governance.
candidates.why_stand: Running a $530 million DHB budget is big business requiring executive management oversight and future strategic development skills and capability in large organisations. I want to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of our health-care system to ensure that our money is used wisely, delivering the best outcomes possible for all.

candidates.name: Garry Howard
candidates.why_elect: As Mayor of Buller District Council I have learnt of the numerous health issues and challenges our residents have. Services or lack off, long waiting lists, affordability of travel to hospitals and the lack of consistency in health providers are issues across the West Coast.
candidates.why_stand: Currently trustee of the O'Conor Home, Buller Health Trust (Westport Dental) and council representative on the IFHC design team. Advocated for residents with health care challenges and the Ngakawau Rural Clinic and Reefton Health Centre. Past volunteer Red Cross driver, transporting residents from Westport to Greymouth Hospital. I care.

candidates.name: Keith Rusholme
candidates.why_elect: I am a registered comprehensive nurse and qualified mediator. 40+ years in health services twenty plus years in roles as service/general manager and Chief Operating Officer. Good knowledge of all aspects of health services. Been responsible for all DHB provider services including rural health services, Integration of all health services.
candidates.why_stand: I have a strong interest in health services on the West-coast and the its complexities. To me the provision of rural health services is just as complex as large population health services. I believe I have the skills/knowledge to be an effective Board member.

candidates.name: Jodie Treanor
candidates.why_elect: I've been on the coast since I was a child and am now raising my own children here, one of which has a disability. My past work in the public sector helps me to understand the government system and how to strongly advocate within that system.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the West Coast is the most beautiful, naturally diverse places in the world and I'm passionate about providing a world class health service in order to maintain current members and attract new members to our community.

candidates.name: John Vaile
candidates.why_elect: As a previous board member I have the knowledge and experience.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the West Coast to be a special place.

candidates.name: Paula Cutbush
candidates.why_elect: Working currently within the Consumer Council and the WCDHB Advisory Board prepares me to have a major role focusing in health needs in Coast communities. I bring 25+ years experience, and with my ongoing effort, and interest in encouraging constant focus on the best health service possible, I am ready.
candidates.why_stand: I am ready to represent my community around the West Coast DHB table. People like myself are essential in providing the balance in a group of people who may have more of a business focus. I am always concerned for the consumer and the community.

candidates.name: Chris Auchinvole
candidates.why_elect: Corporate career in export management, plus twenty years living in a rural environment on the Coast with a strong community interest in local people's well-being. Nine of those years I served as as a Member of Parliament. Coast healthcare and finance for the new hospital were major pieces of work.
candidates.why_stand: DHB Services are important to every person in the community. As an elected Member of the DHB for the past three years, I wish to be re-elected to continue working to ensure the services are available, accessible and equitable throughout the West Coast DHB territory to all.

candidates.name: James Gough
candidates.why_elect: I am a third term City Councillor; I bring a business lens with a people-focus that puts you and your family's health at the heart of decision making. Representing your views on the CDHB would be a privilege and a pleasure so I am seeking your backing to achieve this.
candidates.why_stand: I care deeply about the success of our region and the CDHB. What sets me apart is I am not interested in why things can't happen; I am committed to finding ways they can.

candidates.name: Jo Kane
candidates.why_elect: I have been on the CDHB for 4 terms I have a very good understanding of the health drivers of Canterbury's diverse, ethnic and ageing population and the pressing problem areas I live semi rural and work with and for the community with passion and a sense of fairness.
candidates.why_stand: Until Canterbury's funding is fair and equitable with the rest of New Zealand I will continue to offer myself as a forthright strong community voice. Canterburys dedicated and hardworking health professionals need representation that strives to deliver better transparency, clear communication, accountability and will challenge mediocrity—That's me.

candidates.name: Aaron Keown
candidates.why_elect: I have nine years experience in the role of a CDHB board member and a good relationship with management and staff. Good relationships and understanding of the complex system in which we operate are essential to deliver on a health system that we need in our current environment.
candidates.why_stand: As an experienced board member I feel it's important to keep some existing board members to deliver on the current redevelopment programs as well as keep advocating for the correct funding from central government that the people of Canterbury deserve.

candidates.name: Naomi Marshall
candidates.why_elect: Having a wide range of medical experience in CDHB gives me a compassionate, knowledgeable perspective. A person with intimate knowledge of the health system is lacking in the current board. This needs to change. I'm invested in improving the health of Cantabrians, especially the disadvantaged—children, elderly and vulnerable populations.
candidates.why_stand: I am an experienced nurse who genuinely cares about improving health outcomes for Cantabrians. My experience in both hospital (Surgical, Medical, Paediatrics, Emergency Department) and community nursing helps me to understand how decisions made in the boardroom affect individuals and ensure the limited funding can have the greatest evidence-based impact.

candidates.name: Debbie Mora
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Christchurch all of my life and bring with me a wealth of experience from Finance and Tax, to Employment and ACC negotiations and board experience. I am also a voluntary member of Birthright NZ assisting single parents in our communities.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our city has a lot to offer, including our health system, however there is always room to make effective change and I am not afraid to ask the hard questions.

candidates.name: Vicki Tahau Paton
candidates.why_elect: Although I have a governance and management background, I still strongly believe it is important to value our community and support those that take care of our wellbeing. Health is about people, not politics. I am a huge advocate for equality geographically and demographically.
candidates.why_stand: I believe your Health and Safety matter.

candidates.name: Geoff Booth
candidates.why_elect: I want to make a positive difference to our suicide stats, Canterbury is over represented in NZ's stats.
candidates.why_stand: I want to be part of the conversation about Mental health and Suicide prevention in the CDHB after losing my Son to Suicide, I have a lived experience that I would like to share with the Board.

candidates.name: Rochelle Phipps
candidates.why_elect: I've worked throughout Canterbury as a GP and I understand the health sector. I care about this community and want all of us to have access to good health services. I have an MBA and governance experience, and I take the responsibility of being an elected public representative seriously.
candidates.why_stand: Canterbury has faced enormous challenges over the last decade and the demands on our health service continue to grow. I believe it is important for medical practitioners to be involved with guiding the future direction of our health service and I want to use my skills to support my community.

candidates.name: Sally Buck
candidates.why_elect: Nobody cares how much you know until they know how much you care. I care about people and want to make sure they get the best health care possible. I also understand how the health system works and how we can achieve the best outcomes for the most people.

candidates.name: Robert Read
candidates.why_elect: I have volunteered around mental health and suicide prevention for the past 6 years and through using my own lived experience have made huge impact internationally. I love our city and believe our health system can do better.
candidates.why_stand: I believe it is time for those with lived first hand experience to have a voice on the board so that the issues everyday cantabs face can be appropriately addressed without the bureaucracy.

candidates.name: Brian Salisbury
candidates.why_elect: I currently work as a registered nurse at Hillmorton Hospital. I will bring an informed voice to the board, representing my colleagues and my patients. I also have prior experience in governance having served as the vice-chair of a school board.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion for healthcare and a desire to see the services here in Canterbury work for everyone. I believe that everyone should have equal access to quality and timely care. I want to serve the people of Canterbury and work to achieve this vision.

candidates.name: Gray Crawford
candidates.why_elect: A successful career in the health and disability sector involving 24/7 crisis intervention services to people battling cancer, addictions and poor mental health. Ministerial consultancy appointments have also included being Chair of the Health and Disability Ethics Committee and a member of a Lottery Welfare grants committee.
candidates.why_stand: Our health system is strong. But is it sustainable? What is needed is a more integrated community-based model for early intervention. With my extensive senior management experience in primary, secondary and not for profit health and disability services, I feel that I can make this happen.

candidates.name: Steve Wakefield
candidates.why_elect: I have six years experience serving on the CDHB board and board committees. I also have experience as a director of the NZ Health Innovation Hub, and Brackenridge Services, that cares for intellectually disabled residents. I bring strong financial and accounting skills, information technology, and construction and property knowledge.
candidates.why_stand: I have been involved in serving the Canterbury health system for 6 years and wish to continue to serve our community by being elected to the Health Board. Many Cantabrians take our health system for granted until they have a critical need. I recognise the importance of our health system.

candidates.name: Anna Crighton
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Christchurch and Canterbury for most of my life. As a former Christchurch City Councillor and community board member and a current Canterbury District Health Board member I have represented the area for over 20 years and have gained useful knowledge of its population.
candidates.why_stand: I am seeking re-election because, as Chair of Community Public Health Advisory Committee and member of the Hospital Advisory Committee, I believe I have the knowledge and governance experience to contribute in a meaningful way in all aspects of public health.

candidates.name: Peter Wakeman
candidates.why_elect: Businessman investor/retired airline pilot 59 years old wanting put back into Canterbury as someone born in Christchurch. They say that 80% of chronic diseases have an environmental cause and we simply cannot continue to gamble with our children's health and the future of all life on earth. Mayor, Council DHB.
candidates.why_stand: Manager/Chief Pilot in NZ that included Ambulance flights. Airline Jet Pilot contractor to Singapore Airlines Currently retired . Have submitted to Christchurch City Council/ECAN/Parliament on water and health issues before and passionate about Canterbury. Enjoyed spending days with Dr. Caldwell Esselstyn diet plan on a course on health.

candidates.name: Andrew Dickerson
candidates.why_elect: I am prepared to commit fully to this role and have the energy, health sector experience and work ethic to represent you in improving public health services in our region. I have no links to any political party—my interest is in healthcare, not politics.
candidates.why_stand: I have more than 30 years hospital and health sector experience and am deeply committed to improving and growing public health services in our region.

candidates.name: John Edie
candidates.why_elect: As a new face on the Board, I would bring communication, analytical and problem solving skills that are required of this position. I am currently a lay member on the NZ Law Society's Complaint Service, have chaired a school's Board of Trustees and had a career in education.
candidates.why_stand: With a daughter diagnosed with Leukaemia eight years ago, requiring 30 months of chemotherapy treatment in Christchurch Hospital and is now in remission, I believe we have one of the best Public Health systems. However, the $1.4 billion budget of the CDHB still needs to be accountable and transparent.

candidates.name: Jo Goodhew
candidates.why_elect: I have a reputation as a caring and accessible person and am well connected into community organisations in the district. I trained at Timaru Hospital and worked as a Registered Nurse there and in general practice. I have considerable experience in health related governance roles and volunteering within the sector.
candidates.why_stand: My whole working life has brought me into contact with healthcare provision. Our DHB has been a fiscally sound provider of health care unlike other DHBs. I do not support our DHB being merged and I will be a strong advocate for continuing this strong history of healthcare.

candidates.name: Sue Harrex
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the area for 29 years and have a background in farming, construction and general business and Director of several family companies. I have a good sense for business and I think I can offer a lot to the South Canterbury District Health Board.
candidates.why_stand: I feel I have a lot to offer the people of South Canterbury. I am on the Disability Support Advisory Committee and am heavily involved with volunteering at The Timaru Senior Citizens. I would like our elderly to be able to live well and age well in our community.

candidates.name: Gerrie Ligtenberg
candidates.why_elect: I have experience as member of a nursing advisory board, worker's council, experience with hospital amalgamation, build of a new hospital and I was a board member of a professional nursing organisation. I will bring many years of nursing experience and knowledge of our communities to this role.
candidates.why_stand: I have worked in the community mainly working with the elderly but giving equal support to their families. I have been passionate about improving health services in the communities as a nurse and now that I am recently retired I wish to continue to promote excellent health care for everyone.

candidates.name: Peter Binns
candidates.why_elect: My medical work included general practice and various specialities, with fifteen years as an Orthopaedic Surgeon at Timaru Hospital. With service of five terms on South Canterbury District Health Board, I have a clear understanding of the personnel and resources necessary for a safe, effective and inclusive Public Health Service.
candidates.why_stand: As a Medical Doctor and having lived in South Canterbury for 35 years, I am determined to continue challenging any plans that may threaten our Services locally or regionally. I seek to ensure that we have the best possible Public Health Services, here at the centre of the South Island.

candidates.name: Sam Callander
candidates.why_elect: I have the perspective needed for bold decision making; having worked throughout South Canterbury with health teams as 'Primary Health Manager' at SCDHB from 2015-2018 and with businesses while working for the economic development agency. I've served on region's YMCA and Community Trust boards. I hold a BCom in Economics.
candidates.why_stand: South Canterbury is a remarkable corner of the planet and I'm lucky to be part of the community; lucky also have worked supporting health professionals from Timaru to Twizel, from Waimate to Geraldine. They are passionate and skilled. Yet, there are huge opportunities to help their work be more effective.

candidates.name: Barbara Gilchrist
candidates.why_elect: A vote for me is a vote for a fresh voice—a voice that's backed by years of nursing in our region, an optimistic yet realistic outlook, and a deeply personal interest in the health of South Canterbury.
candidates.why_stand: From our first breath to our last, we all want to live a happy and healthy life. This means having healthcare that's close to home. I want to help our DHB provide this by promoting a healthy environment for all and making the most of every dollar.

candidates.name: Tania Mcinnes
candidates.why_elect: 40 of my 50 years living in the Far North. Almost six years as deputy mayor, a previous five years working within LG. I know its challenges and I know its potential. Highly experienced governance individual, renowned as a strategic thinker, with a strong background in community development.
candidates.why_stand: I am daring greatly, putting a stake in the ground for our people and our place. I hold a clear vision and believe my inclusive leadership style, knowledge and courageous approach will make a genuine difference now and in the future. Na tatou to wa—it's our time!

candidates.name: Harko Brown
candidates.why_elect: I have a vast governance experience working on national organisation boards and local club boards and with international organisations and iwi runanga. I am a team player who can motivate and enthuse management/governance teams and have a proven track record of innovation.
candidates.why_stand: Our region has generous open-hearted people, beautiful scenery and extraordinarily rich histories but needs an in-tune council to capitalise on that aroha, beauty and richness to develop our region into one that is unified, vibrant, safe to live, work and play in, and resilient. I can lead that movement.

candidates.name: Dave Bear Hookway
candidates.why_elect: University educated, street smart and previous business owner, I've achieved results at all levels. I've confronted issues, working locally and nationally to promote, develop and implement policies that place community first, both in community public health for and as your councillor.
candidates.why_stand: Martin Luther King once said "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." Voted onto council to fight for accountability and transparency, I've given voice to the serious concerns you've raised about council and its increasing disconnect with community. Let's fix our council.

candidates.name: Monty Knight
candidates.why_elect: I have lived and worked in the district my whole life—and I am one of it's greatest supporters. It is growing fast—and I would like all our residents to benefit from this growth. My life has been about leading projects both in business and governance.
candidates.why_stand: I have business and governance leadership skills and experience that I would like to use for the betterment of our district. We have discontent and dysfunction within council—with good leadership I would like to restore citizens faith in our council, let's put things right.

candidates.name: Sheryl
candidates.why_elect: My experience as a Councillor and Mayor has ensured a deep understanding of local government and its processes. I am committed to continuing to engage with and support our community in its aspirations. I am proud of our achievements to date, and deserve more investment in the district we love.
candidates.why_stand: I have been Whangarei Mayor for 2 terms. Our community is creative, caring and progressive. We are preparing for continued development, while ensuring what makes us unique is preserved. We are creating superb amenities, hosting international sporting events, and celebrating our rich culture and heritage, Whangarei, Love it Here!

candidates.name: Tony John
candidates.why_elect: I have a long successful track record in business including as a Director, CEO of national organisations. I have been involved as Trustee, President and Chair of numerous community groups including turning around other dysfunctional organisations. I can do so again with this Council.
candidates.why_stand: I have a clear vision about how we can move Whangarei forward and make it thrive. I am committed to revitalising Councils culture from "can't do " into one focused on achievement. It's about engaging with the public and changing Council's culture to reflect the wishes of the community.

candidates.name: Moemoea Mohoawhenua
candidates.why_elect: I am Tangata Whenua. My Tupuna have been here since the beginning of time. I was brought up on my Marae and at Omamari and as such will do all I can for my Māori and Pākehā people, and everyone else here, from the principals and values of Tikanga Māori.
candidates.why_stand: The main reason I am running for the Mayoralty is to say to my Māori people, especially our Rangatahi (Youth), that we are just as good as anyone else. We have the same mana (dignity). We can achieve our dreams and become all we are capable of becoming.

candidates.name: Jason Smith
candidates.why_elect: Being 5th generation local helps me understand the history and context of where we are and where we're headed. As the only current mayor in all NZ with an economic development doctorate, I am qualified to help take Kaipara to the next level. Already being mayor, I know the ropes.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about Kaipara and want this place to thrive and prosper.

candidates.name: Ben Parsons
candidates.why_elect: I am now a self-employed Architectural Technician working out of a solar-powered studio in Northern Coromandel, but I have worked for many years in primary industries and also in corporate events production. I also maintain an organic garden in Kopu and have a deep family connection to the Coromandel Peninsula.
candidates.why_stand: I want Coromandel to be a place that our kids can be proud of; an enjoyable piece of paradise for generations to come and an example of an enlightened society.

candidates.name: Len Salt
candidates.why_elect: I have more than 40 years business experience and a proven track record of using innovation and creative thinking to find better and more cost-effective solutions. I have a deep commitment to community service, integrity and to the financial, social, environmental and economic well-being of the community I live in.
candidates.why_stand: The Coromandel needs an independent, non-aligned mayor who is prepared to listen to the people and make balanced decisions for the benefit of the whole community.

candidates.name: Josie Anderson
candidates.why_elect: I bring to the table a new voice, fresh approach and representation reflecting the community. My professional skills are broad-based, ranging from governance, executive and finance management, commercial and community development, to resource management, conservation, strategic planning and crown negotiation. I add in my natural instinct, common sense and integrity.
candidates.why_stand: My family has lived here for centuries. Hauraki is my home. I am committed to a thriving sustainable Hauraki future for coming generations. Council faces some key issues for which local solutions from a broader spectrum of voices are required. That's why I'm stepping forward.

candidates.name: Korikori Hawkins
candidates.why_elect: I'm proud to be seventh generation Waikato Tainui and I have a natural ability to engage with a broad range of people, both culturally and professionally.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I have the skills and experience to lead Council vision to create thriving, connected and liveable communities and I am passionate about change.

candidates.name: Simon Thomson
candidates.why_elect: I am a fourth generation farmer running 260 hectares of beef and dairy support animals. Additional experience I bring includes engineering in the agriculture, aquaculture, bio-plastics, yachting and drone industries, I have worked for Xtreme Zero Waste in materials ecology and electronics recycling, and with DoC in the Chatham Islands.
candidates.why_stand: I declare a climate emergency, and that farming is the solution to this emergency through analysing our landscapes and supporting the goal of every farm having 20% of their income from non-animal-protein sources within five years, and 50% in 10 years. Make the 'Waikato' a world recognised brand.

candidates.name: Jan Barnes
candidates.why_elect: I've been part of LG for 15 years having run a successful engineering company for 40 years and prior to that being a school dental nurse in the health field. I have taken positions of committee chair, deputy mayor and the past 6 years as a passionate full time mayor.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion for Matamata Piako, diligently worked hard for the last 6 years as a full time mayor and bought business acumen and social heart to the table. I have been successful in gaining two PGF feasibility studies and we are on the cusp on implementing the findings.

candidates.name: Ash Tanner
candidates.why_elect: I was born and raised in the Matamata Piako and i have a background in business. I am straight talking and to the point. I listen I am down to earth, and realise with the cost of living rising, families and people on fixed incomes are finding life challenging.
candidates.why_stand: After nine years representing the Matamata Piako district as councillor, having six years experience on the audit and risk committee, three years on the volunteer youth ambassadors committee and three years as Chair of the corporate and operations committee (council's second formal meeting per month) it is time for Mayor.

candidates.name: James Casson
candidates.why_elect: 28yrs Police (20yrs in Hamilton) experience makes me a pragmatic thinker and a to the point person. I know injustice when I see it and there are a lot of areas where HCC can improve its service to residents. I am local and I have skin in the game.
candidates.why_stand: I am currently a first term councillor with experience under my belt and believe I have the leadership qualities to serve as your Mayor of Hamilton with a city safety stance. I am passionate about serving Hamilton as I did for 20yrs as a Police Officer.

candidates.name: Jack Gielen
candidates.why_elect: I stand for family4justice and suicide prevention promoting the preciousness of life.
candidates.why_stand: Because i am a truther and a socialist believing in the jubilee principle of equality and justice.

candidates.name: Louise Hutt
candidates.why_elect: Being the CEO of an electricity company, I understand the responsibility that comes with providing core services. As a board member of Go Eco, I understand the role of governance and the importance of sustainability. I'm passionate about collaboration and ensuring we understand our decisions and how they affect everyone.
candidates.why_stand: I've always been frustrated at how little energy is put into making local body politics understandable for most people (but especially young people) and how few politicians actually centre climate change or wellbeing in their decisions. So kia ora, here I am.

candidates.name: Angela O'Leary
candidates.why_elect: I have served Hamilton as a dedicated City Councillor for 12 years and have the experience to be the best Mayor. I work hard to promote honesty, integrity and genuine transparency. I've served my apprenticeship and I am asking you to trust me with your vote.
candidates.why_stand: It's time you had a Mayor you can trust. I have the courage and integrity to get council and Hamilton back on track. I am the most experienced candidate in this election and as Mayor will put you and our city above all else.

candidates.name: Paula Southgate
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Hamilton for 40 years. I was educated, and raised my family here. I have passionately represented Hamilton for over 20 years, 18 years as a local government leader holding key roles at a local regional and national level. I'm fair, work hard and I care.
candidates.why_stand: I love our city. I want to lead a more respectful, positive council that actively listens and values your views. Better community engagement is vital to me. I want to support a strong team of city leaders who are all invited to share ideas and shape the business of council.

candidates.name: Max Baxter
candidates.why_elect: I am a good elected representative because I have significant governance experience, I am pragmatic and incredibly proud of where I live. My honesty, integrity and welcoming personality are great attributes in the governance role I hold as mayor.
candidates.why_stand: I love our district and having been our mayor for the last 6 years I have learnt an incredible amount, through experience, contacts made and the passion I have I am the best person to lead our district in the next term.

candidates.name: Doreen de Haan
candidates.why_elect: I have a heart and soul for the community. I am a good listener and respect what people have to say. I am an organiser of events. I was Rural councillor for Otorohanga District Council 1998-2007.
candidates.why_stand: Otorohanga wants a central Mayor. I live 12 kms west of Otorohanga, in Honikiwi and I call that central. Shopping is done in Otorohanga, from farm supplies, animal supplies, clothing, food and nearly everything else. I have lived in this district for 34 years. I am a local candidate for Mayor.

candidates.name: Brian Hanna
candidates.why_elect: I have been running my own business for 34 years, am very engaged with the community, and believe I am very approachable. I am at ease in most company, and stand by my record of service as your Mayor over past nine years.
candidates.why_stand: Having served 3 terms as Mayor, I wish to continue to deliver positive, forward looking , passionate leadership as I have done in the past. I don't want to see the progress we have made be undone , we need consistency and stable leadership.

candidates.name: John Robertson
candidates.why_elect: I was raised in Waitomo, in Piopio. I know the area and in particular know the people. I have been a Mayor and MP in Papakura, and know what it takes to both represent and be a good representative of a community.
candidates.why_stand: The Waitomo District Council is financially troubled. It has very high rates and very high debt. Its governance also needs improving and it needs to become more transparent. As the former chair of Commissioners at the Kaipara District Council, I have the experience to address these matters.

candidates.name: Zane Cozens
candidates.why_elect: I am a long-time Taupō District resident, a known advocate for encouraging community prosperity. An experienced councillor, a successful businessman, a relationship builder. I am a people-person and a person of the people. A challenger, a goal setter. Fit, hardworking, I will lead a proud team that get things done.
candidates.why_stand: Change. We need to change the way we engage with and value our people and we must change our debt situation—manage our finances better. We need to change the way we treat our environment. Let's discover our real districts potential—together.

candidates.name: Kim Eyles
candidates.why_elect: Because I am interested in hearing from everybody, and because I bring fresh thinking.
candidates.why_stand: Because I believe that I have innovative ideas to share and because I love Taupō and want to make it a better place.

candidates.name: David Trewavas
candidates.why_elect: I have the experience, been in Taupō nearly 40 years, governance is a passion. I will be the mayor for all.
candidates.why_stand: It has been a absolute honour and privilege to be the mayor of Taupō District for the last six years. We must continue on the growth path with clear and concise leadership in harmony with the environment. Our industries of tourism, agriculture, geothermal and forestry fully supported.

candidates.lives_in: Te Puke, Western Bay of Plenty
candidates.name: Steve Fawcett
candidates.why_elect: My fresh perspective and new ideas will be refreshing and welcome change. I have proven time again that I will deliver on promises with action. I have a wide diversity of skills to contribute to this position of advocacy and representation. I am the perfect candidate to represent the community.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion to see WBOP thrive alongside healthy representation and unified strategies. I have held many leadership positions. I am a passionate candidate who truly cares for positive change, constantly advocating, and pushing for inclusion of a diverse range of people in our community.

candidates.name: Margaret Murray-Benge
candidates.why_elect: When people have an issue I like to visit them to understand it first hand, and then work with them to resolve the issue. I work with people and together we have and do make a difference.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because I believe we can do better than we are at the present. With the years of experience I have had in leadership roles in local government in Waimairi District Council, United council, Christchurch City and 15 years in Western Bay as Councillor. I am ready.

candidates.name: Greg Brownless
candidates.why_elect: The advantage I have is my connectedness to the community. I'm involved at all levels and most days and nights I'm out visiting organisations and events. I've been successful in business and I've given back. With proven community service and commitment, I lead by example.
candidates.why_stand: I've lived and been active here for 33 years. Community, temperate climate and wonderful beaches make it the best place to live. I established a successful business here and then established a charitable trust to give back. I know the people and want to represent their best interests.

candidates.affiliation: Let's Build a Better City.  Together.
candidates.name: Kelvin Clout
candidates.why_elect: I have faithfully served as Deputy Mayor under two mayors and am ready to take on the top job. Nothing beats the experience and energy I will bring to the Mayoralty. I am a champion and advocate for Tauranga, and will work collaboratively with councillors and our beloved community.
candidates.why_stand: I love Tauranga and believe I already make an excellent contribution to our city's governance. I want to help Tauranga achieve it's amazing potential and be a 'magnet city' to the world's best talent. I want my mokopuna to study, and build a career or business, in this beautiful rohe.

candidates.affiliation: Your choice for your voice - Stop the waste
candidates.name: Murray Guy

candidates.affiliation: Fix the Council, vote for positive change
candidates.name: Andrew Hollis
candidates.why_elect: I have enormous experience working with diverse cultures across the world including every continent bringing people together to get the job done. Finance, systemising huge complex datasets and bringing teams together is what I do and have done for decades. I'm looking forward to helping to bring us together.
candidates.why_stand: I believe voters need a choice that isn't a councillor, previous councillor or an new comer with only a passing interest in Tauranga. I offer a skilled team player with international finance and infrastructure and management experience covering multiple cultures. I have also worked closely with 100s of small businesses.

candidates.name: RangiMarie TeAmopiu-Kaa Kingi
candidates.why_elect: What I have decided is that this is another dirty white society survey by the same stake cronies who keep these dictators in office. I would like a copy of this survey and all details of who the mind games questionnaires are. It's the season of Claims, British False Claims.
candidates.why_stand: To use it as a platform to enforce Māori Lore of The Land and Justice system under King Tawhiao's Declaration of Independence 1835 to the present. A Māori Government to identify British false claims of ownership to Tauranga and NZ. As a Māori woman for the Mayoral role. Because Tauranga is dying.

candidates.name: Jos Nagels
candidates.why_elect: I have a knowledge, experience, foresight, innovative ability, diplomacy and desire to set the future direction so Tauranga can be an example for other regions. I have been resident in Tauranga for 42 years.
candidates.why_stand: I have an overall vision for the city and its environs to lead into the next 50 years and avoid repeat of past mistakes of other cities.

candidates.name: Tenby Powell
candidates.why_elect: I have considerable senior leadership experience at CEO, board director and chairman level spanning the private business sector, government entities, not-for-profit and the military. I am a compassionate leader and team builder who seeks to transform TCC into a responsive, efficient and trusted organization which serves Tauranga city.
candidates.why_stand: I am hard wired to make a difference. It has driven much of what I've done in life, from military service, charitable boards for service organizations, fifteen years advocacy for small business owners. I believe Tauranga deserves better leadership and I can deliver that for the future of our city.

candidates.name: Les Wallen
candidates.why_elect: As a Pastor, I care about people and I care about what affects you. I am a businessman and know how to make one dollar do the work of two. I don't waste money and will consider all information being presented by staff before acting on it.
candidates.why_stand: Tauranga is my home city, where I grew up upon leaving school. When I look at the city now, I see a broken, clogged city with very little additional infrastructure compared to what was here when I left in 1971. I am well experienced at fixing broken things.

candidates.name: Stephanie (Steve) Anne Chadwick
candidates.why_elect: I have a track record, I know how government works as a previous Cabinet Minister. I get things done and stick with a Vision set by our community. I love our place, people and culture and together we are achieving great things for our District. Partnerships are key.
candidates.why_stand: I want to finish the projects underway through partnership with Government, iwi and other funders. I have lead a great team and there is more to do together. We have restored a belief in ourselves and our community is thriving. We have a plan. Tatau Tatau.

candidates.name: Dennis Curtis
candidates.why_elect: I believe in balance, opportunity, growth and drive I care about all communities and their voice and not the singular, committing and promising protection, sustainability and equality a Rotorua lad with executive international business experience leading iwi organisations, trusts and incorporations. I will not promise what cannot be delivered.
candidates.why_stand: I stand for basic fundamentals. I believe that these three principles are what will drive the change we need in Rotorua: protection, sustainability, and equality.

candidates.name: Reynold Macpherson
candidates.why_elect: I have international, research-based and practical leadership experience in turning around large organisations and systems by reforming governance and corporate management services. If elected, I will help residents, ratepayers and working families prosper, listen to everyone, including advice from Te Arawa, Rural and Lakes policy advisory boards and expert officials.
candidates.why_stand: Like others endorsed by Residents and Ratepayers, I want to make Rotorua a better place for everyone.

candidates.name: Lesley Immink
candidates.why_elect: I'm keen to help effect positive change and employment growth in our community. I am an experienced professional with a demonstrated history of working in the tourism industry and corporate leadership—skilled in strategic business planning, product development and marketing, governance and transformative organisation change.
candidates.why_stand: Whakatane District and I are both ready for a change. I'm not running as Mayor for the money, I'm not running for the title. The right timing has presented itself and I am ready to help navigate the community and its economic development initiatives as we look to the future.

candidates.name: Julie Jukes
candidates.why_elect: Experience already as a politician. I'm a two term councillor, a local business owner, a Chartered Accountant and I have held senior local government management positions. I am also involved in the community as the Chairperson Pou Whakaaro. I also have a very outgoing personality.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about our unique district, it needs to grow whilst retaining what we love most about our urban and rural towns, our communities, our beautiful natural environment and relaxed lifestyle. I want to lead us through the upcoming exciting challenges and issues.

candidates.name: Victor Luca
candidates.why_elect: I was one of Whakatane High School's top graduates and deputy head boy. I have subsequently excelled in my career of choice which requires creativity, discipline, tenacity, intellect, scholarship, analytical capabilities and the ability to work with and lead people. I have been leading scientific research teams for 20 years.
candidates.why_stand: My science career has been geared toward working for the public good. I now want to use my competencies do something of benefit for the community in which I was born and raised and with which I have a strong emotional attachment. I want to make it even better!

candidates.name: Pouroto Ngaropo
candidates.why_elect: I bring a diverse skill base with many years of governance and leadership experience and have a solution focused approach to solving problems. I am bilingual, bicultural and able to confidently and competently engage in both worlds and I have lived my life in service to our community.
candidates.why_stand: I have spent my whole life building and strengthening connections and developing leadership skills that will enable me to lead our communities and make contributions to their future growth and development. I believe in unity across our communities and the importance of community voice in council. I care about people.

candidates.name: Judy Turner
candidates.why_elect: My working background includes primary teaching, community work, small business ownership, six years in Parliament, nine years as Deputy Mayor and as an Environment Commissioner, plus six years of the BOP District Health Board. I believe that I have the governance and relationship skills needed to be Mayor.
candidates.why_stand: For our family, Whakatane has been the best place to live, work and raise our children. I am motivated to see the next generation of young families enjoy the same benefits. I want our town to offer an inter-generational life-style, that caters for retirees as well.

candidates.name: Alex Dobie
candidates.why_elect: Having served three terms as an Opotiki District Councillor from 2001-2010. I have the skills and experience necessary to be the next mayor. Married to Kararaina for 38 years, we have successfully raised three children in Opotiki. Community interests and networks and a commitment to engage and consult with all.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about Opotiki, and the people who live here. I see huge potential within our district. Untapped potential the challenge is about making the positive changes to enrich our lives, while ensuring the future is brighter for us all. Making Opotiki a better safer place is my goal.

candidates.name: Peter Irving
candidates.why_elect: My pakeha family have been in Opotiki since 1865, with my children and two of my mokopuna also born here. My wife's tipuna trace back to Mataatua. I intend to utilise my banking and international business experience for the betterment of the ratepayers.
candidates.why_stand: My work experience gives me a clear knowledge of this communities needs and requirements. I look forward to using this experience for the betterment of our people. It's time someone with business sense leads the council.

candidates.name: Louis Rāpihana
candidates.why_elect: I am a person who loves communicating with people, I want the people to have more of a voice in local policies and plans moving forward.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing as a candidate at the request of the people, the people want a change and I am honoured to help make that happen.

candidates.name: Lyn Riesterer
candidates.why_elect: Integrity, honesty, a good listener, a good team leader and the ability to ask the hard questions or make the tough decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I am the best person for the job of leading the council moving into the next triennium. Experienced and well trained in local government procedures, rules and regulations. Ability to lead people well in a team and wanting to lead with positivity in partnership with our community.

candidates.name: Meredith Akuhata-Brown
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community all my life and as a local understand many of the challenges that people face. I have a wealth of experience in local governance and believe I have more to offer in the role as a Gisborne District Councillor.
candidates.why_stand: Positive change does take time, I've loved my role in Council and many people have said I am helping create good change. So I'm seeking re election in the local body elections. Much of my efforts have focused on making Council more accountable and inclusive for everybody.

candidates.name: Rehette Stoltz
candidates.why_elect: I have a fresh, strategic approach and will lead Council to focus on doing the basics well.
candidates.why_stand: I love our place! I see huge potential in our region and want to support and enable the changes, innovation and possibilities that will allow everyone to thrive.

candidates.name: Jennifer Takuta-Moses
candidates.why_elect: I have been in governance most of my life and have a governance qualification, I am strongly committed and can demonstrate transparency and skilled leadership for the future development of the Wairoa region.
candidates.why_stand: I am a candidate for Mayor of Wairoa and have a profile with Wairoa District Council should you wish to read what my passion is all about in this lead up to the Mayoralty.

candidates.name: Damon Harvey
candidates.why_elect: I have strong governance experience, a can do attitude and have strong connections across all walks of life. I am action orientated and will look for solutions and positive outcomes that aren't confined to a bureaucratic position but one that is focussed on serving the people.
candidates.why_stand: I want to help change up our future. I will create an inclusive community where career opportunities and growth are in and gang intimidation is out! We'll focus on housing for all, chlorine-free water, and improved sports and cultural amenities for a Hastings that's healthy in mind, body and spirit.
