candidates.name: Sandra Hazlehurst
candidates.why_elect: I am a proud Hastings girl. I love our people and our place. I bring business management, governance and council experience to the role. I have a genuine ability to listen to the needs and aspirations of our communities, and a desire to improve the lives of our people.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about Hastings and about making sure our people have a say in all the plans and projects we put in place. As mayor, at the heart of what I do every day is a desire to ensure everyone can thrive. I want better lives for our people.

candidates.name: David Hannay
candidates.why_elect: I have been working within community groups against council for 24 years, this experience has taught me that things desperately need to change in our council to ensure authentic consultation with our community. Grassroots groups need to be cherished not destroyed. Council control of management must be addressed.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing to try and change the management and ethos at council, from a neoliberalist model back to one which values community at its heart.

candidates.name: Chris Tremain
candidates.why_elect: I bring experience, energy and empathy to the table. I have significant experience as a Cabinet Minister, Board Chair, and business owner. I have excellent links to central government, across the House, and around the country. I provide new leadership capable of taking our city forward to a bright future.
candidates.why_stand: I love Napier City more than any other. I want to continue to give back to her by leading the city to a vibrant future where our children and grandchildren want to stay or return. The city needs strong leadership to unify the council and to move forward.

candidates.name: Kirsten Wise
candidates.why_elect: I have many years experience in leadership roles and I understand local council processes. I've Chaired the Finance Committee but most importantly I've been listening to the community, I know what the issues are and I'm not afraid to make a stand on behalf of the community.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for Mayor because our people need their voice back. I am constantly being told by people they do not feel listened to and there is a massive disconnect between the community and council. Representing the community is at the heart of everything I do.

candidates.name: Max Brough
candidates.why_elect: I have no local business interest of significance, henceforth zero agenda. My practical down to earth style delivers results that we can all understand. I am a rare male that can multitask, (and am ambidextrous) so can wield a pen and sword simultaneously. I will defend your rate money.
candidates.why_stand: I am encouraged by recent progress of our city, however I feel we are lacking perspective in decision making. We currently have management rather than leadership at the Council table. I can deliver a dynamic and focused Council to make practical decisions that will reflect well for our futures.

candidates.name: Irene Godkin
candidates.why_elect: Building stronger connections. I've lived in Westown in early adult life. Our property was retained 36 years. My early work experiences include hospitality, rural accident insurance, Tegel Poultry process worker, retail, and later, communications call centre, aged care. My 26 year accountancy career spanned NZ and Australia. Passion+Compassion.
candidates.why_stand: Growing up in our progressive and vibrant district community in my early years, I now have the opportunity to take the lead into unchartered waters. It is my privilege and honour. Serving our community into an era of forward thinking to manage our resources and finances. Building stronger connections.

candidates.name: Neil Holdom
candidates.why_elect: My wife Melissa and I have three children Xavier (13), Savanna (11) and Alyssa (7). Our parents also live here so we represent three generations of Taranaki people who are totally committed to the future of Taranaki. My professional background is in energy, infrastructure, strategic planning and Government relations.
candidates.why_stand: My vision for New Plymouth District is to build the lifestyle capital of NZ where people of all ages can live, work, learn and play in a connected and thriving community focused on supporting our people, caring for our environment and sustainably growing our economy.

candidates.name: Joanne Kuvarji
candidates.why_elect: I have a uniquely genuine, down-to-earth leadership style and a "know who you are, be who you are philosophy" This is demonstrated in my journey as a Māori, Indian and European Mother of fourteen, Musician, Business Owner, Trustee of MCT, TGBCT, Marfell School Board, Pride Taranaki and Active Community Leader.
candidates.why_stand: Our district is one of the most welcoming and vibrant in the world, this comes from our people and I believe our council should be a reflection of our community as a whole.

candidates.name: Greg Mackay
candidates.why_elect: I was born and have lived in our community for all of my life, I bring with me a wealth of experience in business and employment. It is in my beliefs that local people are involved in matters and decisions within our community.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our city is beautiful. Our parks and walkways let us enjoy the outside atmosphere with peace and quiet. I believe being able to go from the mountain to the sea in just minutes makes New Plymouth a very unique place.

candidates.name: Bill Simpson
candidates.why_elect: I was raised in New Plymouth District (Waitara) went school, raised, worked there until the freezing work closed in 1985. I have come back to Waitara, have my own business, work as a security officer, safety and hot watch professional. I bring executive, management, legal, educational and people skills.
candidates.why_stand: I am campaigning on democracy is not just a word... your vision, my commitment and our future, lets dream and do it together. It is time that we as the rate payer believed in ourselves and took back control of our community.

candidates.name: Jacques Windell
candidates.why_elect: I am very tenacious, as my 3 year fight with the lines issue at central government level proves. I am also not scared to take on Ministers if I have to. Our voice will be heard and I will not be denied. That's my promise to you.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for Mayor because I believe we need a fearless leader who will not accept the lunacy of some of the compliance laws central government is forcing on us. Robust push-back is critical, as a matter of urgency to save our towns!

candidates.name: Hamish McDouall
candidates.why_elect: I will continue to represent Whanganui with energy, fairness, gravitas and passion. I have proven experience, a strong belief in democracy, a track record of generating innovative ideas, the ability to lobby successfully, a history of managing diverse voices around council enabling positive decisions, and I've been Whanganui's loudest cheerleader.
candidates.why_stand: While I have been mayor our district has grown both in terms of population and GDP. We have preserved what we treasure, our reputation has been burnished, and there's a buzz here. However there's unfinished business—major capital projects to be finished and government money to be attracted here.

candidates.name: Andy Watson
candidates.why_elect: Our family has lived in the district nearly all of our lives I have served on numerous community groups. As Mayor I believe that I should be available to everyone right throughout the district.
candidates.why_stand: I want to finish the major programs that we have started. The district is on a roll and I want to be part of it.

candidates.name: Helen Worboys
candidates.why_elect: I bring experience, leadership, energy and advocacy to the Mayor's role having previously led a 20 year revitalisation programme of Feilding. I am an experienced event manager, fundraiser, marriage and funeral celebrant, JP and Rotary member, with a 'can do' attitude and strong work ethics.
candidates.why_stand: I am proud to be contributing to the significant progress in our district and region, which is experiencing substantial growth in both population and business growth. Our economy is the best it has been for a long time and is predicted to continue.

candidates.name: Andy Asquith
candidates.why_elect: Local government is my passion. I bring a wealth of experience and knowledge on local government. I have served as a local body employee, have previously been a candidate and have served on the equivalent of a local board. I also have a wealth of governance experience on community organisations.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about good local government. My career has been spent researching, writing, educating and commenting on local government. I want to use my professional expertise to enhance the good work already being done by Palmerston North City Council in order to take Palmerston North from good to great!

candidates.name: Maruna Engu
candidates.why_elect: Over 20 year of hospitalities customer services. Bricklaying Business; Sanitarium Sales Rep; Senior Kiwisaver consultant for Huljich Wealth Management won two awards; MiCiti Ltd; Highbury Flea-Market; a Papa Engu Donuts stall. Volunteer PARS Treasurer, Pasifika Trust Secretary, COGS Vice Chair, Cook Island Vice Chair and member of interfaith Group.
candidates.why_stand: My concern for the prospect future of my children and understanding my duty of care as a father to my family to stand up and speak which is our highest calling. The grass root problem is council have forgotten their duty of love and care. Vote my city that cares.

candidates.name: Teanau Tuiono
candidates.why_elect: I am used to leading and facilitating diverse perspectives. From working with communities in remote rainforests to working with diplomats at the UN. I am also a familiar face in our local art and activism scene because it is important to me to be also active where I live.
candidates.why_stand: For me Palmerston North is like the Wood Between the Worlds in the Narnia stories. I have made so many different and diverse connections here that I am continuously surprised by the place and people. Magical? Maybe.

candidates.name: Tracey Collis
candidates.why_elect: I have extensive knowledge and experience with our local issues throughout the Tararua District, which provides stability with large projects underway. I offer a balanced and inclusive leadership style that enables our people to work smarter and work together both on council, within the community and the wider region.
candidates.why_stand: I have the experience, skills, energy and connections to keep building a vibrant progressive Tararua District where people choose to live, work, do business and raise families with the same opportunities as our city counterparts.

candidates.name: James Harold
candidates.why_elect: I can secure the technology, processing capabilities and markets that will allow our district to thrive moving forward. Decisions will be made for the communities benefit, I will not stand for corruption of any kind. I will always do the right thing.
candidates.why_stand: I know that I can lead the Tararua district to prosperity whilst protecting, repairing and enhancing our natural environment, leading the way for other districts to follow. I can not watch from the sidelines whilst bad decisions are being made. We can lead the way forward.

candidates.name: Mitch McHardy
candidates.why_elect: I have ambitions to join the political platform. I'm starting at local level before taking it to a national level. My beliefs are if I do good I feel good if I do bad I feel bad.
candidates.why_stand: If not me then who? If not now then when?

candidates.name: Bernie Wanden
candidates.why_elect: My working and community life has been to ensure positive outcomes for all and I would continue to do that if elected as mayor. I have been a conscientious and committed Councillor and would work tirelessly to make this district great.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for Mayor because I genuinely care about this District and its future. We are an undervalued and under appreciated District which has the potential to deliver a wonderful lifestyle to all that live here. I want to ensure that happens.

candidates.name: Gwynn Compton
candidates.why_elect: I'll bring fresh leadership, smart thinking, and a community-led approach, while also being a relentless advocate for Kāpiti. Drawing on my experience in communications, politics, and government relations, I'll make sure council is well run, listens to its community, and that we're top of mind for decision makers in Wellington.
candidates.why_stand: Kāpiti is the best place in NZ to live, work, and raise a family, but growth from Transmission Gully is putting pressure on the relaxed beach lifestyle we all love. We can't stop people moving here, but if we make smart choices we can make growth work for us.

candidates.name: Jackie Elliott
candidates.why_elect: I bring 6 years experience and am already a strident campaigner for Kāpiti's residents on social issues. I am a strong voice on council. I have spoken out against workplace bullying in councils and actively network to provide strengthened governance. A strong and real voice for you in council.
candidates.why_stand: I have enjoyed a fantastic childhood in Kāpiti and want every child to be able to reach their potential here and have every chance I had. I want council to be the enabler of this with safe streets, a roof over their heads, warmth, decent food and a caring community.

candidates.name: K (Guru) Gurunathan
candidates.why_elect: As a member of a minority ethnic community I'm proud of my Kapiti community for recognizing my credentials and qualities to elect me twice as councillor and as mayor. The people have grown to know me through my previous role as a local journalist. I'm easily approachable.
candidates.why_stand: As a local journalist of 16 years, councilor for six and mayor for three years I'm passionate about my community embracing sustainable growth while deepening local character. I want to empower our communities to shape our response to the challenges posed by the opening of the new expressways.

candidates.name: Martin Halliday
candidates.why_elect: I have a background in entrepreneurship, business ownership and management balanced with work in many community groups and interaction with council representing these groups. I have a skill set that is fit for purpose and want to use it for my community to help move it forward.
candidates.why_stand: Through my involvement with many community groups, dealing with council on community issues and my own business interactions, I have become very frustrated and exasperated with council, councillor attitudes and competence. I now feel that I need to step up and get involved in governance to see progress.

candidates.name: Mani Ah Far
candidates.why_elect: My compassion for the people means I'll never give up. I have a simple model that I want to put in place. I believe it's this vision of simplicity that makes it a plan that will work.
candidates.why_stand: I love Porirua. as a village it helped me become the man I am today. I want to see Porirua succeed and be a better place to live for everyone.

candidates.name: Anita Baker
candidates.why_elect: I am born and bred in Porirua I am known for getting things done with a good community profile. I work locally and contribute to the community in a variety of ways and forums. I am experienced in running council committees and have good strategic and financial management skills.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see improved performance from the council and transformation of Porirua into a more attractive and engaging city. We need more progress on improving our natural environment. The city is experiencing solid growth and I want to see our basic services are fit for purpose.

candidates.name: Ana Coffey
candidates.why_elect: As a city councillor for nine years, I'm deeply invested in Porirua. My children were born and raised in the city, initially in Porirua East, and now in Titahi Bay. I had a family retail business, Living HQ, that started at Mana then moved to Palmer's Garden Centre in Plimmerton.
candidates.why_stand: Porirua has one of the highest number of residents per rating units in NZ. There is little room for error. I have proven experience, commitment, and integrity to lead the city I love through the opportunities and challenges facing our young, diverse, and fast growing communities.

candidates.name: Mike Duncan
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Porirua for most of my 69 years and been on council for the past three. I believe I'm approachable and a good listener. I consider I've represented our Western Ward people effectively and our city well. I would love the opportunity to lead from the front.
candidates.why_stand: We're losing sight of the unity part of community. Diversity is great, but not on its own. To truly move forward as a city we need to focus more on the things that bind us together rather than seeking out the things that separate.

candidates.name: Mike Tana
candidates.why_elect: My work as mayor speaks for itself, connecting with communities and businesses across the city, championing Porirua to central government and collaborating with the other mayors to have a regional strategy. I have worked hard to made the conversation about Porirua both positive and proud, both nationally and internationally.
candidates.why_stand: As mayor I am standing for re-election to continue the amazing work we have achieved for this city over my term as mayor. We have kept to the long term plan, committed to delivering a balanced budget and kept our AA+ rating. $1.5 billion for housing and infrastructure is transformational.

candidates.name: Wayne Guppy
candidates.why_elect: I understand our community and the region and have worked for Upper Hutt as Mayor and will continue to develop our city.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing on my record of proven leadership and giving Upper Hutt a voice both locally and nationally. Upper Hutt has progressed to be the leading city in the region under my leadership.

candidates.name: Angela McLeod
candidates.why_elect: The only time I haven't lived in Upper Hutt is when I was studying at Massey University. We can do better with my community, national and international leadership experience in the corporate, parliamentary and NGO sector. Upper Hutt is a great place to live, work and play.
candidates.why_stand: Upper Hutt has a solid foundation from long term leadership and I believe that I can lead the community and economy to the next level.

candidates.name: Steve Taylor
candidates.why_elect: I will be a strong regional voice representing Upper Hutt. With challenges facing the Wellington region including transport, resilience and climate change risk mitigation, now is not the time to rest on our laurels. We need proactive, energetic and strategic leadership to deliver a secure future for the Wellington region.
candidates.why_stand: My motivation is driven by my desire to provide a safe, connected and respected home for our children. A home that they are proud of. An affordable home that is resilient, with great amenities and an abundance of opportunity. Upper Hutt is our home, and our children are our future.

candidates.name: Campbell Barry
candidates.why_elect: Lower Hutt's my home. It's where I grew up, and it's where my wife Laura and I plan to raise our kids. I've been a city councillor for the past 6 years and have a range of public and private sector experience. Most importantly, I'm strongly grounded in my community.
candidates.why_stand: I love our city. Lower Hutt has a lot going for it, but unless we front up to the big challenges we face—Transport, housing, infrastructure and protecting our environment; then we won't reach our full potential. I'm standing because I want to tackle these issues head on.

candidates.name: Ray Wallace
candidates.why_elect: My mayoralty has been about "Putting People First". I am passionate about our city and want to see every resident prosper. I am proud of what my united council has achieved for our people. Let's keep the positive momentum going. Re-elect Mayor Ray Wallace.
candidates.why_stand: Our city has gone through the biggest rejuvenation programme in the city's history. We have built many new community facilities for example Walter Nash and Huia Pool extension. I am excited about our future but there is still much to do. I have the mayoral experience needed.

candidates.name: Norbert Hausberg
candidates.why_elect: I am part of the Wellington community for nearly 30 years. First in Khandallah and now in Kelburn where I build my own house. Yes I build it not a builder. Putting your mind to it you can achieve the seemingly impossible. Great people person and communicator.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Wellington has been underperforming for many election cycles. We can do better, be more sustainable, greener and work towards the future not the past. Wellington Carbon Neutral by 2022 is an achievable goal. Let's aim at the stars not a hole in the ground.

candidates.affiliation: Plain Talk – Growth Is Bad 4 WGT Mayor
candidates.name: Don Newt McDonald
Jenny Condie
candidates.why_elect: We need a mayor with the skills to future proof Wellington. I have a PhD in accounting and entrepreneurship. I worked at The Treasury and taught at Victoria University. I'm on the boards of Tawa School and Maanaki Montessori Education Trust. I'm a member of the Institute of Directors.
candidates.why_stand: 2100 is not science fiction—my boys will be in their 80s. I'm standing for mayor to future proof Wellington so that our kids will have a fair chance to succeed as they grow up. I'm determined to deliver climate action for Wellington, not just promises.

candidates.name: Justin Lester
candidates.why_elect: It's been a privilege to serve as Wellington Mayor for three years. I've led a progressive, people-focused, cohesive council that's looking to the future and getting things done. I'm a dad, a volunteer coach and have the compassion, business experience and legal skills to lead Wellington and resolve our challenges.
candidates.why_stand: I grew up in a state house with a single mother. My community supported me to get where I am today and I owe an enormous debt of gratitude I am seeking to repay. I love Wellington and I want to make it the best and fairest little Capital.

candidates.name: Conor Hill
candidates.why_elect: I work well with a wide range of people, and I know I can make more of a difference than many of the people on the current council. I am young enough to have the energy required for the job.
candidates.why_stand: I love Wellington and want it to be the best city in the world. I'm running because there is a housing crisis Wellington, our transport system is broken and because climate change is real. Our leaders are not moving fast enough to fix the issues facing Wellington.

candidates.name: Ajay Rathod
candidates.why_elect: Despite this being a problem since the 1930s, no one has ever done anything about the constraints. How many years has argument been going on, and things have just got worse. How about some leadership and lets get it done.
candidates.why_stand: The wait is over for me and I want to make change to this city "Let's do this."

candidates.name: Diane Calvert
candidates.why_elect: I have over 25 years senior leadership experience and for the past 3 years have been a city councillor. I know how the system works and understand what good leadership and governance looks like. I have the experience, strength and pragmatism to oversee a strong path forward for the city.
candidates.why_stand: I'm a proud Wellingtonian and love my city. Wellingtonians are saying they want a Mayor who will get the 'big stuff' right—the things that really matter, the things that affect us all—jobs, housing, transport, the environment and our local communities. They are asking me to stand.

candidates.name: Andy Foster
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Wellington most of my life. I'm deeply involved in our community and have an extensive track record of getting things done. I will fight for what is right even when the going is tough. I know how council/the city work, I have a clear integrated vision.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing for Mayor because I believe our beautiful city has lost its way under current leadership. We need clearer vision, restoration of a sense of energy and pride, a focus on the things that matter, and willingness to engage with the community.

candidates.name: Cory Burling
candidates.why_elect: Being born and bred in Masterton, I'm lucky to be known as a 'local'. Being a Tradie with 17 years experience can only benefit all council consultations, and I have a wealth of experience in the hardships of week to week living. Honesty and integrity go a long way.
candidates.why_stand: I'm lucky to call Masterton home, but it's time to change council direction, so that my children and future generations can be happy to call Masterton home. As an active member of our community, and as a leader, I'm passionate about putting my name forward to improve our community.

candidates.name: Graeme Farr
candidates.why_elect: Anyone else is probably better than me but I am better than no-one. And no-one seems to have put their hand up! And I won't give up until I drive through it!
candidates.why_stand: I am running for all three Wairarapa mayoralties to get people focused on building a tunnel through the Rimutakas. Anywhere else in the world would have done this 50 or more years ago. The route is much simpler than you think and the benefits for the region are enormous.

candidates.name: Tina Nixon
candidates.why_elect: I have a strong community and economic development background and governance experience. I have worked for the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority in a senior position so understand the benefits of spatial planning,urban development and meaningful stakeholder engagement.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for Mayor and council as we need a civic leader who won't muck about, who gets things done and refocuses council on core business. It's time to get rates increases under control and work with central govt to develop better funding models for key infrastructure.

candidates.name: Lyn Patterson
candidates.why_elect: I have a finance background as a Chartered Accountant so can ensure that ratepayers receive best value for their rate dollars. Being an accessible Mayor is important to me. I like getting out and about in the community to meet you and listen to your ideas and issues.
candidates.why_stand: I love the region in which I live. Masterton is thriving with many projects on the go and an increasing diverse population. I am a strong and positive leader and want to continue to deliver the best services to all our people.

candidates.name: Bernard Bottrill
candidates.why_elect: I listen well. I have a sense of purpose, and am not easily deterred from a course of action. I particular, I know that Rate Are Too High, and intend to take action to revert the present trend of rate increases.
candidates.why_stand: I am one of the "RATH—Rates Are Too High" team members. We know people whose rents have risen because of ever increasing rates passed on by landlords; also younger mortgage-paying couples having to pay $75 weekly rates and people having to sell their homes due to high rates.

candidates.name: Graeme Farr
candidates.why_elect: Anyone else is probably better than me but I am better than no-one. And no-one seems to have put their hand up! And I won't give up until I drive through it!
candidates.why_stand: I am running for all three Wairarapa mayoralties to get people focused on building a tunnel through the Remutaka's. Anywhere else in the world would have done this 50 or more years ago. The route is much simpler than you think and the benefits for the region are enormous.

candidates.name: Jill Greathead
candidates.why_elect: Our politics will be about what we value together, inspiring hope and creating certainty for everyone in our community. We need to get back to basics to create an affordable Carterton based on integrity, transparency and accountability. Local people making local decisions provide the best outcome—that is localism NZ.
candidates.why_stand: After 18 years as a district councillor, I am running for mayor and councillor to bring a new perspective into council leadership. That means new energy to drive innovation and affordability. I support LGNZ's localism project where Carterton is well-positioned to rollout localism projects to put communities back in charge.

candidates.name: Greg Lang
candidates.why_elect: My understanding of our community and experiences in enhancing our community and my self determination to achieve as an artisan and Ironman triathlete.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I can make a difference by adding value with my enthusiasm and can do attitude. My track record of making things happening by building an enthusiastic and cohesive team plus my 6 years as a councillor puts me in good stead to lead our District.

candidates.name: Alex Beijen
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the South Wairarapa for 20 years, and have raised a family here. Having worked in business management and Council research, as well as living on a farm, I feel I have a good insight into the needs and requirements of our community.
candidates.why_stand: In the South Wairarapa, with a small population maintaining a massive area, we have to be proactive, efficient and forward-thinking in our management of resources and funds. I know I can collaboratively work towards achieving a robust efficient Council over the next 2 terms.

candidates.name: Graeme Farr
candidates.why_elect: Anyone else is probably better than me but I am better than no-one. And no-one seems to have put their hand up! And I won't give up until I drive through it!
candidates.why_stand: I am running for all three Wairarapa mayoralties to get people focused on building a tunnel through the Rimutakas. Anywhere else in the world would have done this 50 or more years ago. The route is much simpler than you think and the benefits for the region are enormous.

candidates.name: Brent Maru
candidates.why_elect: As Mayor I will represent and reflect your aspirations with the utmost of integrity and transparency. My success throughout the region has demanded of me a high level of business acumen, the ability to negotiate significant contracts, understand local and central government complexities, and work with challenging budgets.
candidates.why_stand: Proud to call Motueka home, I am extremely grateful every day for the vast experiences my family, wife—Jody, daughter—Tiegan and son—Brodie have at their fingertips with this district. I have dedicated my life to service and get great satisfaction in working for our community.

candidates.name: Dean McNamara
candidates.why_elect: I have many generations of working class history in Tasman. I would like to see us return to the "good old days" when anyone prepared to work hard could make a go of it. My background in running my own businesses gives me good understanding of how every dollar counts.
candidates.why_stand: I think Tasman is terrific! And everyone wants to live here. But, unfortunately, the Tasman lifestyle is out of most people's budgets. Wages are too low and the cost of living is too high for most young families and retirees. You deserve better representation to address the inequality in Tasman.

candidates.name: Tim King
candidates.why_elect: A willingness to work constructively across a wide range of interests to reach positive outcomes. Governance experience in business, community organisations and council. Strong connections across the region with urban and rural communities. A track record of making the hard decisions when required. Understanding the challenges and opportunities for Tasman.
candidates.why_stand: We love living and raising our family in the Tasman region and I believe the mix of governance experience and community involvement that I have enables me to create a constructive council environment and deliver positive outcomes for our community.

candidates.name: Bill Dahlberg
candidates.why_elect: Over the last 30 years I have a track record in the community, in business and the environment. I'm focused on teams and will lead a council that works together. Anyone who has worked with me knows I'm a straight talker, I have commonsense and I'm honest.
candidates.why_stand: I love Nelson and the opportunities it has provided. It's been home to my family for 35 years. But in the three years I've represented you on council, I've realised we can and must do better and I have the skills to help with this.

candidates.name: Avner Nahmias
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the world's greatest cities and know what makes them tick. I have professional management experience and am versed in the newest approaches to urban living. I have no political affiliation or interest, and intend to inspire and lead Council as a whole towards a common vision.
candidates.why_stand: I love Nelson for it's natural setting and ideal size—large enough to offer all one needs, yet small enough to avoid the problems of larger cities. We must preserve these unique attributes for all future generations. Live the Day is not an acceptable approach.

candidates.name: Rachel Reese
candidates.why_elect: I believe in servant leadership, serving our community with courage, compassion, and dignity. I bring a wealth of knowledge about how to make local government work for our community. I use my engagement skills, business acumen, networking skills, energy and positivity to champion our region.
candidates.why_stand: I feel so privileged to be an advocate for Nelson, a champion for our people and our city, and I want us to achieve much more in the next three years. As Mayor, I love being able to bring people together to find ways of working to achieve positive solutions.

candidates.name: Tim Skinner
candidates.why_elect: I have been passionately active for local business and families at the council table. I have been an independent thinker, asked the tough questions and stood clear on my principles, whilst always showing utmost respect for our staff and fellow councillors. And have no ties to any political party influence.
candidates.why_stand: I want Nelson to be an affordable city, a safe city, a vibrant city. A great place to grow kids. You will have a mayor who is an experienced councillor, has shown prudence, self-control, strategic vision, and governance leadership.

candidates.name: Mike Ward
candidates.why_elect: No one could care more or owe more to Nelson and few have the experience in governance as a councillor, MP and in community organisations from Arts Council to my harrier club. My creativity and optimism will make me a different mayor but such an exceptional city deserves no less.
candidates.why_stand: Our challenges are daunting so I plan to turn Nelson into a lifestyle and sustainability role model and because I believe life could be more fun and a lot less stressful if we spent more time looking after one another and the planet and becoming the gorgeous, thoughtful role model.

candidates.name: John Leggett
candidates.why_elect: The role of Mayor requires strong leadership, exemplary governance, integrity, experience, professionalism and a progressive vision. During my two terms as Councillor and one term as Mayor, I have unfailingly demonstrated that I stand true to those attributes, and that I am someone who Marlborough can trust.
candidates.why_stand: Like so many who live alongside me in our wonderful region, I am driven by a desire to ensure enduring success for Marlborough. What people want from a Mayor is to know they are being heard, and I strive to ensure public engagement is always a priority.

candidates.name: Jamie Arbuckle
candidates.why_elect: I have nine years experience across every facet of Council as a constructive member on a range of committees. I am accessible and have ensured constituents are treated equally, listened to and valued. Marlborough deserves a full time Mayor—vote Jamie Arbuckle.
candidates.why_stand: It is time for decisive action on key regional issues. With a sense of urgency obvious in the community on a range of topics from climate change to the affordability of rates, I will lead this council to implement meaningful policy change before it's too late.

candidates.name: Darlene Morgan
candidates.why_elect: I was born in Kaikoura and have been involved in many community groups and organisations and have gained considerable governance experience including six years as a District Councillor. I am open, honest, approachable, focused and committed to serving the community through authentic leadership, transparency and accountability towards ongoing improvement.
candidates.why_stand: To deliver effective and authentic community leadership through genuine community engagement with the aim of improving council services and community well-being for a better quality of life for all members of the community.

candidates.name: Sharon Rayner
candidates.why_elect: Māori of Ngai Tahu/Pākehā I've lived in Kaikoura for the most part of my life. Kaikoura runs deep in my veins and it's here in this environment and community I truly identify. I am a radical freethinker. My values are honesty, being upfront, dedication, kindness, friendly, strength and I'm approachable.
candidates.why_stand: My motivation comes from our community. I believe we want positive change and a fresh direction. One that enhances us and our environment on a path to becoming self sufficient and so unique that many will want to follow "A fresh start isnt a new place it's a new mindset".

candidates.name: Jamie Cleine
candidates.why_elect: I keep an open mind to options but am willing to assess information and make decisions. I regularly speak at Council meetings and often bring a common sense approach to the topic. I maintain a great working relationship across the organisation and am committed to being transparent and accountable.
candidates.why_stand: I believe BDC has really turned a corner in terms of positive direction of the organisation and this is starting to reflect on the District. This is still in its early stages and I want to be a part of continuing this new way of doing business.

candidates.name: Charlie Bruning
candidates.why_elect: I am Buller born and bred and have lived here all my life, I offer sound leadership skills, with 26 years of experience as Westport's only practising Judicial Justice of the Peace, with good negotiating skills, I have studied Crime, Justice and Society, International Affairs on Globalisation, and Global Tourism.
candidates.why_stand: I have a vision that will take the Buller District forward to 2050 and beyond as a sustainable and vibrant community.

candidates.name: Tania Gibson
candidates.why_elect: My energy and enthusiasm for this role is endless I know I can build and lead a team that can work together for the benefit of our town and it would be a privilege to do so. A fresh new change in leadership.
candidates.why_stand: I have been brought up in Cobden and lived and travelled overseas. From this I have realised how lucky we are to live where we do. Since I have been on council I have found my passion is working with my community.

candidates.name: Andrew Robb
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in my community all but the first 5 years of my life. I have dedicated myself to community roles such as coaching sport and various other roles. I bring a huge amount of leadership experience to the role.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we live in an amazing district that has and still is facing a lot of pressures but also opportunities for the future.

candidates.name: Richard Osmaston
candidates.why_elect: Farm born and raised, with careers as an airline pilot and engineer, worldwide, I bring the analytical discipline and potential of major modern industry to the socioeconomic arena. A socialist, I believe we are obligated us to look beyond convention to the enormous potential that 21st century can now offer.
candidates.why_stand: We now have the potential and the opportunity to truly succeed. Science, technology and awareness provide unprecedented opportunities to live in a truly civilised, sustainable way today. Grey District has unmatched qualities to assure world leading success. Community cohesion, love, stoicism, innovation and energy are abundant. Now we need vision.

candidates.name: Gray Eatwell
candidates.why_elect: I have a clear vision that council must return to basics, so by engaging my proven background of leading people to be cohesive, under extreme conditions, I am confident that a functional honest council is realistically achievable.
candidates.why_stand: As a sitting councillor, observing the underlying culture that is corrupting due process, a pathway has become obvious to me to bring council back into line with community expectations. To be effective the strength of all elected members must be engaged to serve Westland, through inclusive governance and fair practices.

candidates.name: Latham Martin
candidates.why_elect: I am awake at the council table and speak out for what I believe. I research issues in depth and strive to ensure that council decisions are made in the best interests of the community. I debate the issues and not the personalities around the council table.
candidates.why_stand: I am offering you a generational change of leadership, which means a change of leadership style. I want to lead a hard-working, team based and inclusive council that listens, responds respectfully and is accountable to ratepayers. I can help move this district forward, together.

candidates.name: Marie Black
candidates.why_elect: I have worked through the system as as elected member since 2010, and deputy mayor since 2013, and feel well poised to lead the Hurunui District through the next three years and beyond. My real knowledge of the district is extensive, and I bring a trusted co-operative leadership style.
candidates.why_stand: I have a full understanding of the role of mayor and believe I have the time to commit to the role. I have been urged to stand for mayor to provide a calm and considered transition to governance. I want to make a difference to our district.

candidates.name: Peggy Burrows
candidates.why_elect: I am an experienced leader, a Justice of the Peace with a background in Education, Law, Conservation and Animal Welfare. I am just as comfortable at the board table, speaking on the international stage, feeding out on the farm or relieving at one of our local primary school. Supporting you.
candidates.why_stand: The best Leaders are those who are present in the lives of those they serve, who work to enhance the lives of the people they serve, who celebrate diversity and the power of people working together to achieve the impossible. I am that leader. Committed to service before self.

candidates.name: Julia McLean
candidates.why_elect: I have the determination and track record to speak up and hold others to account. I don't shy away from difficult issues and demand full and proper information. I listen and keep community informed about the issues that matter, our direction and why.
candidates.why_stand: I want to offer the Hurunui a fresh approach to leadership and work to unlock new opportunities that benefit our people and strengthens community. My governance is outcome focused and I want to empower and enable locally lead decision making that is inclusive and results driven.

candidates.name: Jay Webb
candidates.why_elect: I have a varied and extensive set of skills that I've obtained over a very long career in project,operations and recruitment management throughout the construction,demolition and civil industries. This means I have the experience and knowledge in many core council functions and can quickly identify problems and cost saving measures.
candidates.why_stand: I've experienced the total disregard for local residents and businesses by current councillors who seem to go about their own agendas without council or community notification. It's simply not good enough. The residents of the Waimakariri district deserve an honest and cost effective council with important environmental and social issues ahead.

candidates.name: Paul Williams
candidates.why_elect: I am a successful businessperson and I am willing to listen and be accountable for my actions. I will stand up for what is right and what is good for our ratepayers. I am not afraid of a good challenge.
candidates.why_stand: I want Waimakariri to be an affordable place to live for our future generations. We cannot continue with the amount of rate increases above inflation. I know that I have the financial ability to address some of the council's financial debts.

candidates.name: Kirstyn Barnett
candidates.why_elect: I have over 10 years local government experience, including as a District Councillor since 2010. I am a trained RMA commissioner, facilitator, project manager, and run my own marketing business. Having lived in both urban and rural locations, and raising a family here, I bring a real-life perspective to council.
candidates.why_stand: I love living in Waimakariri and want to see the consistent, community-led decision-making since the 2010 earthquake continue, to ensure a strong future for our district. We are facing significant challenges with water and rising compliance costs, and need a Mayor who is adaptable, confident and a team player.

candidates.name: Michael Joseph Bate
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community my whole life and am a keen outdoors person, fisherman and hunter. I am saddened and disappointed with the authorities attitude towards our environment and our basic wellbeing. I have the benefit of being tied to no political party.
candidates.why_stand: I can see that our district has severe environmental issues that have been ignored or pushed into the background in past years. I would like our district to be environmentally clean to the benefit of our residents and wildlife.

candidates.name: Robbie Brine
candidates.why_elect: My 38 year professional career has involved crisis management, problem solving and dispute resolution. I am a very good negotiator and believe I supply a strong voice for our district.
candidates.why_stand: At 21 years as Councillor I believe I have the experience and skills to lead our council, by extension our staff and community through the challenges faced not only in our district but across the region. Water quality, natural hazards, Climate change to name a few.

candidates.name: Dan Gordon
candidates.why_elect: I love our District. I know it well. I have extensive experience, energy, an approachable nature and involvement in many community organisations. Combined with my long-term council experience makes me the best choice for mayor.
candidates.why_stand: Waimakariri's population is projected to grow from 60,000 to 75,000. Preparing for this increase requires experienced leadership. We need energetic and enthusiastic leadership; someone who knows our district and our needs. I have 15 years council experience. I'm approachable, friendly and have a strong track record of creating positive change.

candidates.name: Natalie Michelle Leary
candidates.why_elect: My first job was with the district council in the forestry at Woodend beach. Since then I have worked with local primary schools and many sports clubs. I am currently involved in the Civil defence as a volunteer, and a trustee of the Kaiapoi food forest.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our district is beautiful and unique. I feel we also have room to improve.

candidates.name: Oliver Sanderson
candidates.why_elect: I'm 34 years old, grew up in Waikuku and attended Rangiora High School. I served in the New Zealand Army as both a soldier and a commissioned officer. I offer a fresh new leadership approach based on the core values of courage, loyalty, integrity and pursuit of excellence, not politics.
candidates.why_stand: Because I have full confidence in my ability to provide this district with the highest standards of leadership and governance. I desire to make a real positive difference in our community.

candidates.name: Peter Wakeman
candidates.why_elect: Been an airline pilot, manager and grew up on a farm so understand the need for nature.
candidates.why_stand: Council out of control in spending and planning. Funding from Government needed to bail out Christchurch. Mayor Council Fendalton Ward and CDHB. A better way of eating fresh plants needs Council help.

candidates.name: Aaron White
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Christchurch East all my life and have sat on a few committees in various roles. I have been a leader within youth organisations and been involved in organising events with the communities.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because Christchurch is my home and I want to see residents get their voices back and see progress is made in our city for our future generations.

candidates.name: JT Anderson
candidates.why_elect: As an Entrepreneur, I specialize in bouncing back from adversity, it's fun for me—People need to understand that Christchurch is in big trouble, financially, emotionally, psychically, geologically. It is going to take the heart, grit and hustle of a underdog like me to turn this city around.
candidates.why_stand: The Mayor and CCC have let our city down and quite frankly the people of Christchurch have had enough—I am here to sort it out and stand up for the people of Christchurch—I am standing on our biggest issues, because someone needs to.

candidates.name: Lianne Dalziel
candidates.why_elect: My background and experience, together with an inclusive leadership style, engages people from diverse backgrounds to come together, so we can make decisions that are "best for Christchurch".
candidates.why_stand: I want to make sure Christchurch seizes every opportunity to be the best place to live, work and play. I want us to be a city of opportunity for all—no matter who we are, where we are from, or how old we are.

candidates.name: Jim Glass
candidates.why_elect: I have managed my own affairs well.
candidates.why_stand: To improve the city's governance.

candidates.name: Robin McCarthy
candidates.why_elect: As a long time tour operator I interact with thousands of people every year. I am also a long time employer and have worked and travelled extensively throughout the world. I have chaired many meetings.
candidates.why_stand: I have set up many businesses and continue to do so. The Christchurch City Council is difficult, costly and timely to deal with. They do so to protect incumbents from competition. That is not their role. I want to see people given at least a chance.

candidates.name: Stephen McPaike
candidates.why_elect: I am one of the youngest mayoral candidates in this year's election at the age of 34. I work in retail, which shows that I am hard working and I can budget and spend wisely. I am honest, loyal and passionate about the issues that are close to my community.
candidates.why_stand: I was walking through our CBD with my son during school holidays. He asked me "Why is this site empty? And this one?" I came to realise that my son has never seen a fully working city and I wanted to make a change for my son.

candidates.name: John Minto
candidates.why_elect: I have the fortitude to resist pressure from vested interests which traditionally run policy at local council level.
candidates.why_stand: Because Christchurch faces three big challenges which the current council is not dealing with. These are the climate emergency, water quality and crippling economic and social inequality.

candidates.name: Adrian-Cosmin Schönborn
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in this city for almost 15 years now and I have a good understanding of the structure and people's needs.
candidates.why_stand: Christchurch city and his people are part of me. I believe our city is the best in NZ.

candidates.name: Sam Broughton
candidates.why_elect: I love people and enjoy supporting others to be the best they can be. I enjoy strategic thinking and planning for the future by taking a long term view. I like to see things planned well but am passionate about kick starting projects to get them going.
candidates.why_stand: I love Selwyn and live in Darfield with my wife Liz and daughter Elliott. I believe in using my skills and abilities to contribute to our community and enjoy investing my time and relationships with others to build Selwyn for all.

candidates.name: Tony Todd
candidates.why_elect: I have worked in retail for 54 years, on East Street with Todds of Ashburton. Secretary and President of the local Retailers Association. Joined Jaycee Secretary, President and JCI Senator. Rotary President. Board member of Ashburton Licensing Trust for 30 years last 12 years as President. Life Member of NZLTA.
candidates.why_stand: I have great health and plenty of vigour remaining, plus a deep-seated love for this community that has been my whole life, I become driven by a need to offer my experience and collective wisdom to lead this great district through the next few crucial years.

candidates.name: Janie Annear
candidates.why_elect: I am highly experienced in Local Govt. 9 years as your Mayor and 5 years as a local Govt. Commissioner working with councils all around N.Z with efficiency and effectiveness, representation, boundary changes and amalgamations. I'm am also an experienced Director in the public private sector. I offer stable, strong, inclusive, dynamic, caring proven leadership.
candidates.why_stand: I believe in our District, it's people and its future. I am restanding as your Mayor because I believe we are not living up to our potential as a District. We must be more strategic and focused in our planning, economic development and promotion, delivery of services and enhancement of our environment.

candidates.name: Kari (AJ) Mohoao
candidates.why_elect: I was born and bred in this region. Geraldine, Pleasant Point, Arowhenua, Temuka and Timaru have been home to me and I will represent them all. A natural and experienced leader with a hands on approach with common sense and straight talking. My loyalty will be to the people.
candidates.why_stand: I made my decision to stand for Mayor after what I would consider ongoing lapses in judgement by the current council. I feel they have acted without truly listening to the people or recognising upcoming challenges that we are facing, focusing too heavily on industry instead of people.

candidates.name: Shane Wilson
candidates.why_elect: I bring a new perspective to the table, being younger and being "an everyman."
candidates.why_stand: To bring a larger youth voice/direction to the district.

candidates.name: Monique Croon
candidates.why_elect: I have strong Whakapapa connections to Wharekauri and have lived here mostly for the past 30 years. I am an experienced Councillor and am involved in many Island organisations in various leadership roles.
candidates.why_stand: My vision is to create a better Island for our people, we have a beautiful untouched Whenua, and we need to maximise and sustain our natural resources whilst balancing our economic, social and cultural wellbeing.

candidates.name: Katrina Hazelhurst
candidates.why_elect: I am able to encourage debate and discussion on issues and in allowing this ensure that the widest range of community views are represented fairly in the decision making process.
candidates.why_stand: I love living in the Waitaki District but feel it cannot reach its true potential without governance that promotes transparency, accountability, ethical behaviour and inclusiveness.

candidates.name: Gary Kircher
candidates.why_elect: Knowledge of local government is critical to being an effective Mayor. Without it, time and opportunities are lost. My experience as a councillor and institutional knowledge has made me much more effective. I am very accessible, and people from all walks of life know they can contact me with issues.
candidates.why_stand: Waitaki is an amazing district, and I love playing a part in making it even better! There are so many opportunities in front of us! We are lucky to have so many passionate people who want to make Waitaki even better, and I want to help them achieve their aspirations.

candidates.name: Paul Mutch
candidates.why_elect: I have built infrastructure, marketed tourism and accommodation, and spent 25 years promoting spring festivals here and abroad. I was a farmer in the district, while also running land development projects. My broad range of leadership experience and local knowledge qualifies me highly for this position.
candidates.why_stand: I have farmed, kept bees commercially, and owned land in Waitaki for over 30 years. With considerable experience in infrastructure development, marketing, and promotion, I can see the potential of unrealised assets in the area, and I want to create a strong, proud, defined identity for Waitaki's future.

candidates.name: Victoria Bonham
candidates.why_elect: I treat everybody equally I am honest and kind, I'm also a great listener and hard worker—I have a strong ethical compass and values, and will fight passionately for justice, truth and fairness. I believe united we can achieve anything we put our mind to.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing out of a sheer sense of urgency to protect our environment and our wonderful community our identity and way of life—Our health and well being, business, agriculture and tourism absolutely depend on the wellness of our environment.

candidates.name: Tim Cadogan
candidates.why_elect: I am passionate about Central Otago being a great place to live, work, play and raise a family in and fighting to keep it that way. I am a listener first and foremost but also try really hard to communicate sometimes complicated things in a way that people can understand.
candidates.why_stand: I have kept my promises to work hard, be available and to bridge the gap between council and community. I have led this council on its biggest environmental project ever (Clyde wastewater), managing its growth (Cromwell Masterplan) and fighting Wellington when needed (Roxburgh Children's Village).

candidates.name: Jim Boult
candidates.why_elect: I was elected in 2016 to cause progress to happen. I have proved over the past three years well capable of doing that. I have lived here since 1982, and have participated widely and successfully in community matters. I have made progress, but I wish to do more. I'm committed.
candidates.why_stand: I want our district to continue to be the best part of the world to live in and visit. We are special and we need to treat the district in that manner. It is a privilege to be here.

candidates.name: Nik Kiddle
candidates.why_elect: Over 25 years in NZ public service has prepared me to lead the local community with respect, honesty and integrity. I am a trusted consensus builder, drawing on years of negotiating experience for the NZ government.
candidates.why_stand: A culture change is needed in our council—I want to bring it back into a constructive and honest relationship with the community, one where community values and objectives guide council decisions.

candidates.name: Richard Seager
candidates.why_elect: I have a wealth of experience of living elsewhere. I have worked in factories, on farms and small business. I would like to act to make Dunedin the envy of those cities with excellent public transport. I am comfortable in different environments. I am very able in interpreting financial reports.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that Dunedin can show the way in how NZ and the world can point to a future where climate change resilience is a feature and small, rather than large, cities are focused on. I felt that it was a responsibility not to just talk but to act.

candidates.name: Andrew Whiley
candidates.why_elect: Been on council six year and I was the second highest polling councillor at the last election. I have chaired the ByLaws SubCommittee. Councillor on the Saddle Hill and Peninsula Community Boards. Self employed small business owner in Dunedin since 2003 and Chair of Volunteering Otago and Rotarian 10 years.
candidates.why_stand: My Mayoralty campaign is about strong, commonsense leadership that "Gets Dunedin Moving!" Tackling serious issues like the current housing shortage, traffic, parking, climate issues while ensuring Dunedin is business-focused and economically viable in order to be able to afford intelligent solutions plus investing in initiatives for greener technologies and infrastructure.

candidates.name: Scout Barbour-Evans
candidates.why_elect: As one of our youth candidates I have a wealth of life experience that is very different to those of older candidates, and a real personal stake in the decisions we make today. I'll be making decisions for our future, not just today.
candidates.why_stand: I was incredibly lucky to grow up in Dunedin and this city is my home. I have gone on to study here, and have noticed the growing gap between students and Dunedin. I believe that as a student I can bridge this gap.

candidates.name: Robert (Bob) Barlin
candidates.why_elect: I have lived a varied life around the world. My main focus has been assisting in disaster zones and this experience could be useful in Dunedin's future to cope with possible climate change and increased population. I enjoy meeting and listening to people to implement their ideas through teamwork.
candidates.why_stand: Dunedin is the most beautiful city in NZ. We need to develop the city and surrounds in keeping with current ambiance. We need to pay down debt and not take on new debt levels especially since global financial outlooks appear dismal. Future rates increases need thorough investigation to benefit population.

candidates.name: Rachel Elder
candidates.why_elect: As a city councillor I have a background in the health, education, church, community the business and employment sectors and bring a wealth of knowledge and networks to inform decision making. I am good at initiating things and seeing them through to fruition.
candidates.why_stand: I stood for council to make a difference for those who are missing out in our communities. I was concerned about the impact Dunedin's lack of economic growth and the loss of jobs was having on our people. I was also concerned for the people of South Dunedin.

candidates.name: Christine Garey
candidates.why_elect: I have a background in local government, education, tourism, the arts and community advocacy and have experience as an educator, manager, guide, small business owner and community leader. I offer experience, integrity, focus, a collaborative approach and courage to address the challenges ahead.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for Mayor to serve the people of Dunedin as I have done over the past three years as a City Councillor, nine years before that on community board, three as Chair. These are exciting times for Dunedin—I want to carry on the momentum.

candidates.name: Aaron Hawkins
candidates.why_elect: I have proven myself to an effective representative, working positively with staff and building broad political support on the issues that are important to our community. A candidate can promise you the world, but unless they can demonstrate how they'll get the votes they need it's all meaningless.
candidates.why_stand: The city, and council, is heading in the right direction—we just need to move faster. Momentum takes a long to build, but no time to lose. This is why we need strong and effective leadership to tackle our challenges around housing, transport and the natural environment.

candidates.name: Carmen Houlahan
candidates.why_elect: I have strong skills in governance, promotions, media and business that would benefit Dunedin. As a journalist I regularly covered council meetings so have a good understanding of local government. I have managed staff and budgets, have a masters in entrepreneurial business and see problems as opportunities.
candidates.why_stand: I grew up in Dunedin. I am passionate about the city and I want to contribute to a future that is great for my children and yours.

candidates.name: Mandy Mayhem-Bullock
candidates.why_elect: I will provide experienced leadership,striking a balance among various interests of our communities. As Mayor I will be a fair judge on all issues, working with everyone to foster an environment of respect and progress. I know when to seek advice and consult experts to ensure educated decision making.
candidates.why_stand: I am Dunedin and I am your voice I'm going to be a Mayor who always makes sure those who need representation have a voice at the table. I am a parent, a celebrant and an organiser, one who understands how interwoven our challenges and our solutions are.

candidates.name: Malcolm Moncrief-Spittle
candidates.why_elect: I have run my bookselling business "Renaissance Books" since 2000, and am currently in my 10th year of study at the University of Otago. In my spare time, I garden, read, and ride my bicycle. These activities give me a good perspective on Dunedin and its manifold wonders and attractions.
candidates.why_stand: Dunedin is a great city. But we need a council which is not dominated by those who have been influenced by fake news from the apocalyptic doomsday cult of climate alarmism. This is a cult that has made great inroads into both academia and the media in NZ.

candidates.name: Jules Radich
candidates.why_elect: 35 years in business and a science degree from Otago, give me strengths in problem solving, consensus building and strategic thinking. Currently a 15yr Director of the Golden Centre and 12yrs a Professional Business Coach, I bring a wealth of knowledge to work for Dunedin.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we need inclusive leadership and positive action in Dunedin and I'm standing for office to bring it. Tapping into our natural and heritage values, I want a pride of place culture at the heart of our community and driving policy.

candidates.name: Don Byars
candidates.why_elect: I believe the council exists to empower our community rather than to direct it. To properly represent our community, I believe elected representatives need to be in our community, working alongside our people to tackle problems and develop opportunities together. These beliefs provide a good foundation to represent our community.
candidates.why_stand: Our region's efforts to earn income have come at the expense of diversity of employment for our people, economic stability in times of change and environmental costs. I believe we can broaden our approach to growth so that it improves the well-being of our community.

candidates.name: Tim Hanna
candidates.why_elect: Having worked in advertising as a creative director and later becoming a successful author my communication and marketing skills will prove useful as mayor. I have restored an old hotel so that is a thriving social hub for my community and I appreciate the challenges and opportunities for new businesses.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that Southland offers unique opportunities for a growing population of individuals and families seeking a better life. Identifying and encouraging the development of this potential is a key driver in securing a better future for our region and as mayor I would make this a priority.

candidates.name: Becs Amundsen
candidates.why_elect: I have proven I am a good leader in our city both before I was on council and since. I am hard working and dedicated to this city. I have had to work hard and learn a lot to get where I am today.
candidates.why_stand: I want to be Mayor to give back to my community and provide much needed leadership. I believe we all have a role to play in determining the city's future and I want to create an environment where people feel welcome and excited about participating in creating the city's vision.

candidates.name: Steve Chernishov
candidates.why_elect: I am an activator, who can action plans and make things happen. I am upbeat and share contagious enthusiasm to get people excited about what really matters. I am focused and fully able to take a direction, follow through and make the corrections to stay on track.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see the council moving beyond providing just basic facilities and managing people—to believing in the people, empowering them, and providing the resources that they need to live their true identity, in freedom, with significance, feeling the love, belonging and having fun.

candidates.name: Darren Ludlow
candidates.why_elect: I'm experienced, professional, well networked (locally and nationally) and can hit the ground in the Mayoral role feet running. I want to inspire confidence in council staff to strive to provide the service council wants, and to help council to better understand its governance role.
candidates.why_stand: After six terms as a councillor I'm highly experienced with issues and processes, but also feel it is time for a more present and hands-on approach to leadership of our council. The Mayor should set a tone, enable, listen and represent the position of council on issues.

candidates.name: Brendan Bruce Maddern
candidates.why_elect: While I have my views on national politics, I am in no way beholden to them. My singular focus will be, Auckland. Action must be taken now, whether or not the capital is on board. We have outgrown Wellington. Aucklanders understand our city best.
candidates.why_stand: I did not want to run for Mayor. I waited for someone better known than me to promote a future for Auckland that I could believe in. That it has come down to me to offer this vision to a city of 1.5 million people is a scary responsibility.

candidates.name: Thanh Binh Nguyen
candidates.why_elect: I have visions which are as sincere, strong as possible so we can share and realize for ourself, our families, our communities and city I am believing the visions and goals can be realized through willingness, knowledge, creativity and determination. Let's unfurl our resolutions.
candidates.why_stand: To realize my visions, goals and ideals for Auckland city. Consolidate and strengthen the supercity. Unify our regions, cities, people and resources. Strengthen our political structures, economics forces and environmental partners.

candidates.name: Glen Snelgar
candidates.why_elect: I'm an average Aucklander, not a career politician. I grew up on Struggle Street in South Auckland and now I run a school in the Auckland CBD. I use the road and PT network everyday, so I know our communities are hurting from paying new taxes but getting zero improvements.
candidates.why_stand: I came back to Auckland from overseas and I was shocked to find that many promises from 20 years ago still had not been fulfilled. Traffic and congestion have gotten worse and that is putting pedestrians and cyclists in danger. What's more we need to pay more for less.

candidates.name: Tricia Cheel
candidates.why_elect: No one person can solve the crises we face today, but a mandate from voters will mean I can unleash the same energy and commitment I have shown in keeping my neighbourhood as free as possible of toxic chemicals, waste and other pollution, with Friends of Sherwood, since June 1990.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing to give voters the opportunity to take full responsibility for the legacy we are leaving future generations and all life on earth. One million species face extinction, and we cannot continue with the out-of-control, corrupt, corporate, greedy profiteering, that has caused the problems in the first place.

candidates.name: Tadhg Tim Stopford
candidates.why_elect: I'm committed to the big picture, economy, environment, business, citizenship, education, and fun. After 45 years, with 12 years in numerous countries, I believe I have an idea as to what we could be doing better, and how we can do it. My concern is for present and future generations.
candidates.why_stand: Kia ora, and greetings. Aucks is about to change into a medium density city, which means existing problems will get bigger unless addressed. There's no point being 'the world's most liveable city' for 1%. "We don't have money, so we have to think," and that means changing our models. Thoughtfully.

candidates.name: John Tamihere
candidates.why_elect: I have a law and arts degree. Over the past 35 years I have helped those in difficulty. I am the 10th of 12 children born to a staunch Irish Catholic mum and Māori father. I am a father of six and grandfather of eight.
candidates.why_stand: This election is not about Labour or National, right or left. It’s all about Auckland, our city, our people. I want to be the Mayor of Auckland and not a puppet to Wellington. Auckland deserves someone who will champion our city who is not an extension to the bureaucracy.

candidates.name: David John Feist
candidates.why_elect: I have been a lawyer and employment law consultant for over 30 years. I live with my wife and daughter in a house I own in the North Shore. As the director of 0800 SACKED I have seen my generally low income clients suffer with high house costs.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for Mayor as I am very concerned that this city is becoming increasingly ugly and stressful. Housing is to be demolished and turned into apartments. This will not reduce "dwelling" costs. Where this has been tried overseas apartments cost more than the houses originally did.

candidates.name: Peter Vaughan
candidates.why_elect: Born in Auckland, I helped build the City as an electrician. Understanding construction I know City infrastructure and why Auckland is failing. I find solutions to problems, and with my knowledge of how people tick, I'm not easily manipulated and get teams working together as a unit.
candidates.why_stand: I was asked to run for Mayor because I have a technical background in commercial and industrial fields. I've already discovered solutions, both practical and technologically advanced, for putting the City and it's infrastructure back into a stable order.

candidates.name: Genevieve Forde
candidates.why_elect: My heart is with Mother Earth and the people and animals and birds and fish of Auckland. People can rely on me to keep my word and always do my best for them and our city. Thank you if you decide to put your trust in me with your vote!
candidates.why_stand: I am running for Auckland Mayor because I want Auckland to have a strong climate change policy as described by UN scientists last October, namely a 45% reduction in all greenhouse gas emissions by 2030, or better. Also, to protect Auckland's environment and find homes for the homeless.

candidates.name: Annalucia Vermunt
candidates.why_elect: I have joined protests in defence of Māori land at Ihumatao in south Auckland and is active in the fight for women for full family planning rights, including the right to choose abortion. Vermunt has helped organise protests demanding "United States and Allies Hands Off Cuba and Venezuela!".
candidates.why_stand: The Communist League campaign presents a working-class alternative in the city council elections.

candidates.name: Phil Goff
candidates.why_elect: I am a leader who has integrity, honesty and a reliable track record. Auckland deserves leaders who are there to serve the people, not themselves, which is what I have done my whole life. I want to continue delivering for Auckland as I have done for the last three years.
candidates.why_stand: I grew up in Auckland and I love this city. I want this city to be a great place to live: prosperous, diverse and inclusive; vibrant and exciting, with choice and opportunity for all. My vision for Auckland is for it to be world class and NZ's international city.

candidates.name: Alezix Heneti
candidates.why_elect: My personal qualities of decisiveness, persistence and being an action-taker are what I bring to my role as Mayor of Auckland. Family first is vital and Auckland is my family. Thirty eight years in business and community allows me to give back. For Auckland. I love Auckland. Yes.
candidates.why_stand: I love Auckland, it's so sophisticated, fun and versatile. I've enjoyed living here 25 years, Takapuna, Orewa, Devonport, Henderson and Waterview, and it's time for me to give back by serving you the people and show my, appreciation, thankfulness and gratitude. Proud to be Kiwi and an Aucklander.

candidates.name: John Hong
candidates.why_elect: I have a track record of facilitating and promoting New Zealand and Auckland by all means with all my heart and passion.
candidates.why_stand: Auckland City has the potential to be a greater and more livable city as I have the vision and ability to raise Auckland up to international metropolitan city.

candidates.name: Ted Johnston
candidates.why_elect: We need a strong leader with knowledge expertise and wisdom, not a recycled professional politician. Someone from Auckland who knows our city and its potential. I will provide the vision and driving support to make Auckland reach its true potential as a city on the world stage.
candidates.why_stand: I decided to run for Mayor, because of the sheer incompetence, of council. Its money gouging, traffic congestion, lack of efficient public transport, homelessness, and other major issues being ignored or sidelined. Council fails its prime duties, service provision, control of city and growth, protection of environment, and within budget.

candidates.name: Susanna Kruger
candidates.why_elect: I know first-hand how hard it is to get out of the gutter, once you have fallen through the cracks. I also received an international award for cross-cultural relations, studied Māori for 5+ years, and my clients are from all nations: South Africa, Tonga, Samoa, Fiji, India, China, UK, NZ.
candidates.why_stand: To obtain the mandate to negotiate public land and funds for mobilising the dependents to create a strong home economy, from the grassroots up. In particular, we need life-long leased land to build an African inspired campus to host four social enterprising initiatives, helping families trade themselves out of poverty.

candidates.name: Craig Lord
candidates.why_elect: Because Auckland is desperate for leadership. I'm genuine and grass-roots. I've spent the last 32 years in the trenches working, not in the political trough feeding. I'll listen and fight for all of our communities, and provide genuine accountability of the councillors, the council departments and myself to the people.
candidates.why_stand: My hand went up because like most Aucklanders I was disillusioned by the lack of leadership, inane spending on vanity projects and the dropping of standards for our core services. Auckland needs a change of culture and a leader who focuses on the people and actual needs of the city.

candidates.name: Felicity Foy
candidates.why_elect: With my knowledge gained as a councillor last term, and 12 years' experience as a town planner, I understand how to get things done. I listen and offer solutions. I and am not afraid to challenge the status quo.
candidates.why_stand: I love the Far North. I want the best for now, and also the future generations to come. We need to research and lobby central govt to be able to afford sustainable infrastructure and reduce the burden on the ratepayer.
