candidates.name: Lillian Karaka
candidates.why_elect: I bring a wealth of experience having worked within government agencies, academic institutions, iwi boards, marae and community boards to effect positive change for families and communities. I am passionate about fostering and working with strong leadership from all sectors of our community for the well-being of our people.
candidates.why_stand: I have always considered the North to be my home, an extraordinary place to live. The true the value of partnering with, participating alongside and protecting our diverse communities is yet to be fully realized. I am committed to making these values that I grew up with a reality.

candidates.name: Sacha Kearney-Yanke
candidates.why_elect: I will make a good representative for Te Hiku because I've lived in this community with open eyes, witnessed the hardships and the current challenges and love the place. My legal education has given me professionalism, analytical and problem-solving experience and I am motivated to use it for greater good.
candidates.why_stand: My candidacy for FNDC is inspired by my desire to face the challenges to my community with proactive strategy, but also compassion and fairness. Our challenges are unique, but many are also global. I want to better our future by contributing my analytical skill and new ideas now.

candidates.name: Jason Kerrison
candidates.why_elect: I've written music all my life speaking to environmental degradation, the imbalance of energy consumption and waste generation, social injustice, and love of people and the planet. I've been successful in various industries and want to bring my creativity and thirst for a thriving Far North to its council.
candidates.why_stand: We should be exemplar to the country and world as a thriving destination that rivals Queenstown. The social contract between the FNDC and the citizens of Te Hiku has broken down, for too long we've been neglected. With tech, passion and compassion we could turn that around, and quickly.

candidates.name: Lyle Painting
candidates.why_elect: I just want to help make the North a better place for all our people and save our lands from being destroyed.
candidates.why_stand: I didn't want to do this but people kept bugging me to do it.

candidates.name: Hazely Windelborn
candidates.why_elect: I have a great understanding of the entire area and a lot of the concerns in our communities. I have experience in lots of committees and governance roles.
candidates.why_stand: A believe the our Rohe has been undervalued and misrepresented for so long and I want to change that.

candidates.name: Sue Bradford
candidates.why_elect: My family connections to the far north go back generations and I currently live in Taipa. If elected I will use my ten years' experience as a Green MP (1999-2009) and of decades of work with people in poverty to bring a progressive and thoughtful woman's voice to council.
candidates.why_stand: I believe local government has an increasingly critical role to play in dealing with the impacts of the climate, ecological, social, housing and economic crises facing our region and it is important that people who have constructive ideas on how to deal with these put themselves forward for council.

candidates.name: Jane Ellen Johnston
candidates.why_elect: I've been engaged in civic affairs in varied ways over the past 35 years. I bring numerous relevant skills to the table, not least lateral, problem solving and analytical skills, and a high integrity and concern for justice and equity. I am a good listener and an excellent advocate.
candidates.why_stand: I've been an active ratepayer and resident for many years. I'm fully conversant with what our elected reps have done and failed to do, and the concerns of our communities. With my quals and experience, and my honest, deep concern for our communities shared future—I can do better.

candidates.name: Chris Joseph
candidates.why_elect: I have run my own business with staff for many years. I have been employed by FNDC. I have a diploma in Civil Engineering and a good knowledge of water and wastewater. I am interested in what others have to say, get on with others, approachable and a good worker.
candidates.why_stand: With good long term planning, we know where we are going and can continually look out for opportunities as they occur. We also stand a better likelihood of being able to make a case for government assistance. I can promote this and ideas I have to enable this to happen.

candidates.name: Rachel Smith
candidates.why_elect: Living in the Far North for most of my life, I will balance vision and local knowledge with positive, firm governance bringing an open-minded approach to the way outcomes are best achieved for our District. I am a committed learner, with the ability to shut up and listen.
candidates.why_stand: Our District has incredible potential, and diverse challenges that require focused, energetic leadership. I am invested in the future of the Far North, and want to see it thrive for our future generations.

candidates.name: Mike Stevens
candidates.why_elect: I have spent many years in senior management and governance positions in both private and public sectors. My career has involved many years of working with senior local and regional authority and central government officials and with councillors, MPs and government ministers.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived in the Far North District for 15 years and have no intention of living elsewhere. We all have a duty to ensure residents of the whole district are safe, healthy and happy and are fully and fairly represented on council.

candidates.name: Kelly Stratford
candidates.why_elect: I do the reading and extra research to make informed decisions at the council table. I was newly elected in the by-election last year and I've had 100% attendance. I am on every committee, representing our people across all council issues. If I'm concerned about issues I have them addressed.
candidates.why_stand: I want to ensure every voice has a representative that listens to them. I listen. I may not be able to please everyone. But I get answers, and traction. I'm passionate about our region and want it to continue to be a great place to live, work and play.

candidates.name: Steve Wilce
candidates.why_elect: I have the skills and focus to play a vital role as a councillor to drive an environmentally responsible change in our region as we move forward. I want to see council making a real positive impact on infrastructure, business development and community. I believe I can make a difference.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived in Northland for some ten years and am passionate about working with the community to create further sustainable growth and to see our communities and region flourish.

candidates.name: Harko Brown
candidates.why_elect: I have a vast governance experience working on national organisation boards and local club boards and with international organisations and iwi runanga. I am a team player who can motivate and enthuse management/governance teams and have a proven track record of innovation.
candidates.why_stand: Our region has generous open-hearted people, beautiful scenery and extraordinarily rich histories but needs an in-tune council to capitalise on that aroha, beauty and richness to develop our region into one that is unified, vibrant, safe to live, work and play in, and resilient. I can lead that movement.

candidates.name: David Clendon
candidates.why_elect: I have broad and deep experience in sustainable business, the community and voluntary sector, and in politics, including eight years as an MP. My family has been in Northland since 1830, my whakapapa Māori links go back much further. I understand the North, its many challenges and opportunities.
candidates.why_stand: For Northland to achieve its social, economic and environmental goals, we need a unified, high-performing council that makes well-informed decisions, sticks to them and gets things done. Of the 25 councils that have been 'CouncilMark' assessed, all but three score better than FNDC. We can and must do better.

candidates.name: Rodger Corbin
candidates.why_elect: I've been a permanent resident in the Whangaroa ward for twenty five years. My background has been in senior management positions in a variety of roles so have genuine knowledge in process in reaching positive outcomes. This I see this as an asset in council.
candidates.why_stand: We live in a region that has a lot of natural beauty but also has various issues. I want to make a positive contribution in moving the region forward in a sustainable manner.

candidates.name: Sally Macauley
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Kaikohe for 49 years and have a background in commerce, finance and consumer experience. I have worked with the community and led major projects with successful outcomes. I understand Governance which meets the future needs of the people enabling consultation through democratic and local making decision.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I have the experience and skill to continue what we all aspire to achieve in the western ward. I have stood up and represented the community with successful outcomes. It is my policy to consult and listen to the people.

candidates.name: Lily Rawson
candidates.why_elect: I bring a fresh approach to local Government, I am a people person, (Relationship builder) I will represent my communities, advocating on issues and matters that pertain to them. (Integrity) I work creatively with people who know their job (Trusting). I am not familiar with council that is Good.
candidates.why_stand: I live in Kaikohe, Work in Kaikohe, Invest in Kaikohe and I whiri to Kaikohe and Hokianga. I love the heart of the people, the whenua, the awa, it is unique to you and I. Kaitiaki of the whenua and awa, we sustain the land the land will sustain us.

candidates.name: Marara Rogers
candidates.why_elect: I am securely rooted in both cultures and have long experience in the governance role as trustee to various organisations. I am able to gain cooperation from other council members to arrive at consensus.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see change in the way our local government operates. I have achieved success in community-led projects for the last 17 years. My experience and ability can assist the council to be more responsive to community needs.

candidates.name: Moko Tepania
candidates.why_elect: As an educator, I understand the demands and challenges of working together to achieve positive outcomes for our youth and wider whānau. My range of experiences through education, business and community organisations, provide a strong foundation for working collaboratively and knowledge sharing to enhance and preserve our beautiful communities.
candidates.why_stand: I want to work towards council's goal of 'He whenua rangatira—a district of sustainable prosperity and wellbeing and I want our council to represent the diversity of our district. I am passionate about preserving our environment for future generations, whilst building the infrastructure we need.

candidates.name: John Vujcich
candidates.why_elect: I'm a strategic and critical thinker, have governance and business experience, and have been actively involved in business, training and charities. I'm Hokianga-born and understand our culture and challenges. I bring to council experience, a strong voice, time, a heart, and commitment to sustainable and prosperous communities for all.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see better governance, affordable infrastructure, fit for purpose services, innovative solutions and well-performing teams. I want to see a "can do" council serving our people in partnership with all our people, communities and contractors to deliver better quality services that are fair and equitable for all.

candidates.name: Rhonda Zielinski
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Kaikohe for 40 years. Completed my schooling and nursing training in Tai Tokerau. I live local, shop local, support local and love local. I love Northland, our beaches, playing sport and our wide open spaces. I do not want to see Northland overpopulated and sold off.
candidates.why_stand: I was nominated and supported by whānau and friends who believe in me. Community support and feedback from people I trust and respect made me decide to stand up and give this a go. Power to the people, as long as people vote I will accept whatever the outcome is.

candidates.name: Rawhiti Erstich Coles
candidates.why_stand: I believe we can do better. I've lived my life fighting for what should be a basic right. I believe we shouldn't have to struggle for opportunity and social mobility.

candidates.name: Anna Murphy
candidates.why_stand: I love our District and I want to help grow our city by making decisions that look after the well-being of people and our environment.

candidates.name: Don Lake
candidates.why_elect: I have been in leadership and governance roles since I was still in high school, and have worked with leadership teams in non-profit organisations over a long period of time. As a medical graduate (GP) I have worked with individuals and communities and understand what 'healthy' looks like.
candidates.why_stand: I believe strongly in representative government where ordinary people get to have a say in issues that directly affect them. I believe we are in an age where long term planning has got to focus on 'the big' and where businesses need to partner with council to achieve shared outcomes.

candidates.name: Crichton Christie
candidates.why_elect: I can be the voice of reason on Council. I have good ideas, am always thinking and can listen to people. I have a wealth of knowledge and experience and have a willingness to research and speak out on important issues.
candidates.why_stand: I want to continue to contribute to a better Whangarei. I love working for the people of Whangarei and I still have more to contribute.

candidates.name: Tricia Cutforth
candidates.why_elect: I have a good understanding of all parts of the district: rural, urban, retail, industry, community... I've owned businesses, worked in factories, been Northland manager of a govt department, worked for councils. I have an MA in Sociology and a Master of Public Management. I'm effective—I get things done.
candidates.why_stand: I'm Whangarei born and bred; I love this district and am strongly focused on 'putting locals first'; if it works for locals, visitors will love it too. I want Whangarei to be recognised as a progressive district that is actively involved in improving the wellbeing of all its citizens.

candidates.name: Shaquille Shortland
candidates.why_elect: I am dedicated to the people. I bring with me a wealth of knowledge and experience in Te Ao Māori, Governance and Entrepreneurship on all levels, Public sector mechanics, Education, Culture and Arts and Youth Development. I also maintain a vast network of connections locally, nationally and globally.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council to bring diversity in thought and action. I am a young Māori Catholic Male born and bred in Otangarei, Whangarei. I want to advocate for the three biggest groups of the country that do not vote in elections; Māori, Youth and Migrants.

candidates.name: Albie Barr
candidates.why_stand: I stand to make a positive change for a community that I love. Drive, passion, analytical skills and ideas are invaluable qualities gained after years negotiating with political leaders, business executives, achieving great success. Primary being a councillor is a governance and advocacy role, I have a proven track record.

candidates.name: Steve Capper
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Whangarei for all but 2 years of my life, so have a deep understanding of our issues. My experience as a business owner and a senior manager will translate into well researched decision making. My community focused style will create a more inclusive council.
candidates.why_stand: Whangarei has great green spaces, culture, and a unique natural environment. I wish to preserve these while also strategically developing our industry to improve living for all our people. Catering for our growing and aging population is a must and we have to plan for this now.

candidates.name: Vince Cocurullo
candidates.why_elect: Being a successful local business person, I believe in open and transparent communication. Making sure the client pays only what they need to pay. I am accessible and approachable, and I understand governance and leading by example.
candidates.why_stand: I believe in our district, and want our district to grow responsibly. Being a local business person for the past 20 years, I want to make council more proactive not reactive to our clients needs, which means taking ownership when it has done something wrong.

candidates.name: Nicholas Hunter Connop
candidates.why_elect: I have worked with you and served you for most of my life. I am a positive person and always try to find the best opportunity to have a win win situation. Always willing to listen to you and hear what you need to say.
candidates.why_stand: I love our home. I believe we have a lot to offer, many hidden gems waiting to be revealed so that they can be discovered. I believe if we find a way to work together we will shine and create town that is a destination that is full of experience.

candidates.name: Tony Gill
candidates.why_elect: I live for over 17 years in Whangarei and has always been involved many groups and represented others. Been on NGO health board, Helped to improve the Whangarei Public Dog Park. Just trained as a first responder (medic) I'm on the WDC Civil Defence team. I am environmentally aware.
candidates.why_stand: I will work for you because I don't have any ties from others, I'm a very community person where I have the passion to make a better place for you and the future. I wouldn't run if I didn't think I have the ability to make our place better.

candidates.name: Melanie Payne
candidates.why_elect: Though I am proud to stand as a Transwoman I also have a lifetime of worldwide travel, work and skills. I can add value to Council with my wide range of management and governance experience alongside my lifelong passions for Civil and Human Rights, Peace and Security for all.
candidates.why_stand: I see the urgent need for more diverse representation than current Council. This quote from WDC "Stand"campaign. [Council news 12/7/19] "While we have a diverse community in Northland, all ages, cultures, outlooks and perspectives, we don't always see that diversity represented in our Councils."  I rest my case!

candidates.name: Carol Peters
candidates.why_elect: As a candidate, I bring wide experience in community development, housing, welfare, and more. I have a passion to ensure there is enough housing for everyone—elderly, young families, people without a warm place to live. To ensure Whangārei is prepared for climate damage. To make central Whangārei welcoming to all.
candidates.why_stand: On council, I can contribute to building inclusive communities. I will work towards more respectful council relationships with marae and hapu. I want a city friendly to children, elderly; a renewed inner city fostering small business and community enterprises working together. I see us being better prepared for climate change.

candidates.name: Olli Krollmann
candidates.why_elect: I believe in sound decision-making, based on the evidence we have collected and knowledge we have accumulated, open and honest debate, and fairness and respect for one another and the environment that sustains us. Let's forget about political agendas and ideologies—let's rather focus on what works.
candidates.why_stand: We have put ourselves in quite a few economic, environmental, and cultural pickles of our own making. Some have reached a state of crisis, or even emergency, and they seriously impact our wellbeing. I believe that we already have the solutions and answers for most of our problems.

candidates.name: Iain Robertson
candidates.why_elect: I can commit to this appointment as an autonomous Company Director Experience in financial management I'm in my early 30s and have the necessary energy I'm hungry to learn Have honesty and integrity Highly experienced in many different areas of life—the ups and downs.
candidates.why_stand: The district's future lies in the hands of its youth and that is why I am standing as a candidate. Whangarei is a great city and Bream Bay is the jewel of its crown. I want to represent and advocate for all people and their interests.

candidates.name: Ash Nayyar
candidates.why_elect: I am an educated {(Master of Business Administration in Finance (McGill-Canada)} and experienced commercial banker (16 years with three major banks in NZ). I have helped turn around many losing businesses into profitable ones.I am not a Career Politician and will always stand for Integrity/Fairness.
candidates.why_stand: I chose to live in Dargaville three years ago and have since enjoyed every minute of my work/family life. I strongly believe this town has the potential to be bustling again and I have the financial qualifications, business skills and experience to make it happen.

candidates.name: Marni Stewart
candidates.why_elect: I don't have a PHD, I don't know all the policies, but what I lack I have the drive, the passion to make things right. I listen and want to make changes for the better for everyone. I will do the hard yards and also get my hands dirty.
candidates.why_stand: Dargaville is my home town, and I am proud to come from here, just with what has been happening I am worried for my children to so I am running to help make things better for my kids and my community.

candidates.before_politics: Practice Manager of a Law Firm
candidates.name: Eryn Wilson-Collins
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Dargaville all my life and I have been involved with community groups since I was a teenager. I currently serve on the board of the Dargaville Community Cinema Charitable Trust and I am President of the Dargaville Little Theatre. I have a business management background.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for Council because I love the area I live in. I was born and grew up here and I want to represent my community during a time of real change in the world.

candidates.name: Victoria Del La Varis-Woodcock
candidates.why_elect: For more than two decades living in the Kaipara district my academic, community and professional work has focused on sustainability as an economic principle we need to follow. I have proven political experience, which I will put to use to get results for our communities.
candidates.why_stand: I want to put my skills and local government experience into action for our great Kaipara communities.

candidates.name: Joesephine Nathan
candidates.why_elect: I bring would bring a fresh energy focusing on the wellbeing of whānau, communities and the environment. Everything I have done from Gumboot Friday, rode from Rotorua to Wellington an the Pouto Lighthouse Challenge has been for charity, I am passionate and action orientated and focused on community voice.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for election because I am passionate about our community and want to see our region thrive. The voice of the community is a key component in creating a stronger network. When people feel that they are being heard it can create a positive outcome.

candidates.name: David Wills
candidates.why_stand: With my many years of business and management experience I believe I can contribute to a successful future for our Kaipara District while carefully managing our current income we need to look at growing our local economy creating jobs and the pride that with that. David Wills voice of experience.

candidates.name: Anna Curnow
candidates.why_elect: I'm experienced in management with both small and large businesses and also not-for-profits. I have significant experience in local government and regional economic development work. I've lived in Kaipara for over 12 years. Both my daughters went to school in Maungaturoto and I live on a dairy farm in Ruawai.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about our beautiful District and the opportunities that exist here. Our land is productive, our people are hard workers, our communities are vibrant and our environment is beautiful. What's more, we are right next door to the biggest city in NZ. Huge potential!

candidates.name: Tony Brljevich
candidates.why_elect: I have a passion to see a community making its own decisions on matters that affect it and I have the experience required to navigate bureaucracy to see these decisions implemented.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for election to ensure the community's wishes are heard in council and implemented as practically as possible.

candidates.name: Neville Cameron
candidates.why_elect: I lave a long history as a small businessman, I know that you should not spend more than your income. I have lived in Coromandel for 44 years my parents ashes are on the Tokotea. My grandparents are buried in Thames. This is my Turangawaewae.
candidates.why_stand: We need to even up the development and infrastructure across the TCDC area and get the rural areas better represented. The TCDC in the past prevented Whangamata from getting an airport! Other areas apart from Thames need to be heard, especially Coromandel/Colville.

candidates.name: Augusta Macassey-Pickard
candidates.why_elect: I am a long term local, I am a mum. I really care about the future of our area. I have engaged extensively with District Plans and RMA processes, have given evidence to community boards and select committees alike, I understand local government, and I believe it is for locals.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council as, having worked within the local government framework for the last 15 years, I can see that we need a range of perspectives, or knowledge in the council to ensure that the decisions we make result in resilient communities into the future.

candidates.name: Martin Rodley
candidates.why_elect: I moved to Thames in 1992 and so I can now almost consider myself a Local! Over the years I have been involved with a number of groups at a governance level and would very much like the opportunity to use this experience for the wider TCDC community.
candidates.why_stand: My motivation for standing for Councillor for the Thames Ward is purely around my local community. I have been privileged to be involved in a number of areas of the Thames community, and I want to be able to give a voice to them at Council level.

candidates.name: Robyn Sinclair
candidates.why_elect: I am a trained scientist and have worked in both applied science and teaching roles, in a people oriented service role and as a convenor of a sustainability organisation. I am already extensively involved in the community through voluntary and community work and could bring these skills to the role.
candidates.why_stand: I believe it is time for leadership in sustainability at our council.

candidates.name: Dave Ryan
candidates.why_elect: I completed over 44 years in NZ Police. In road policing, general policing and domestic violence prevention. I was awarded a QSM for services to the community. I dealt with community relations groups in West Auckland and brought about community working together. I will give this position if elected all time required.
candidates.why_stand: This town is our "forever home." It certainly deserves people to get on board and contribute to its betterment. I believe that working with the resident groups, I can make a change for the better to this ward. I would be working for the community, to ensure accountability of the council.

candidates.name: Josie Anderson
candidates.why_elect: I bring to the table a new voice, fresh approach and representation reflecting the community. My professional skills are broad-based, ranging from governance, executive and finance management, commercial and community development, to resource management, conservation, strategic planning and crown negotiation. I add in my natural instinct, common sense and integrity.
candidates.why_stand: My family has lived here for centuries. Hauraki is my home. I am committed to a thriving sustainable Hauraki future for coming generations. Council faces some key issues for which local solutions from a broader spectrum of voices are required. That's why I'm stepping forward.

candidates.name: Elaine Marie Rattigan
candidates.why_elect: As an accountant I worked for council in the Finance Department from 2012 to 2016. I am now self-employed and believe I have the relevant skills to be an effective representative for our community. I participate in many local activities and have found opportunities to volunteer and help others.
candidates.why_stand: I am fortunate to be a part of the whānau of Paeroa and the District. I love this community and want to serve it well as a councillor with my skills and values. I believe in uplifting Paeroa and its surrounds to continued new heights.

candidates.name: Brian Habberfield
candidates.why_elect: I care, and I listen. I'm a practical problem solver. I have a wide general knowledge, and an ability to apply rational critique to information offered. I relate with a wide range of people, across all walks of life. I have an understanding of te ao Māori.
candidates.why_stand: People wanted me to stand, and I was nominated. I love the area, and have been here a long time. I have strong connections and do a lot of voluntary work in various community organisations, working with great people. This is a chance do contribute more.

candidates.name: Alan Scott
candidates.why_elect: I identify with the struggles and social issues many people face in our community. I want to ensure that our primary focus is the well-being of the people of our district. I will serve the people with integrity and openness to see our community grow to be healthy and vibrant.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived in Waihi a long time, and I see it as a great place to live, work and play. I've made myself available as a candidate to work with others to improve and expand the services, infrastructure and facilities that we already possess.

candidates.name: Duncan Smeaton
candidates.why_elect: The attributes I will bring as a District Councillor, if elected, include management and financial planning, proven ability to get things done, good people and communication skills, ability to work in a team, and a good sense of humour. I will also have experience as a second term candidate.
candidates.why_stand: The Hauraki District has been a good place to live and do business for me and my family. I see standing for council as a way of "giving back."

candidates.name: Bronwyn Main
candidates.why_elect: Because I love my ward, the people in it and the community I live in  They are all unique, magic and special and deserve to be represented and understood and my experience means I am the ideal person to do this and want to do it. It is a privilege.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for re-election because I am passionate about the ward and people I represent. They are unique and truly special and for me it is unfinished business in ensuring they get a better fairer representation and spend of their rating dollar on things that directly effect them.

candidates.name: Elizabeth Goodwin
candidates.why_elect: My work experience includes: Science, business, construction industry and local government. This is supported by the following qualifications: PhD -Marine Biology; MSc honours—Freshwater Biology; MBA—business management. I will bring logical, robust and responsible decision making. I am known for integrity, responsibility, courage, and collaborative problem solving.
candidates.why_stand: The Eureka Ward has been my place of residence for 32 years, and my vision is that by working together we can harness the potential of the Waikato to support business growth and employment while protecting our environment, and creating a desirable place to live and work.

candidates.name: Maxine Moana-Tuwhangai
candidates.why_elect: I offer a range of skills that can support the workings of the council. I'm a chartered accountant and an accredited environmental commissioner. I have approximately 17 years of notable governance experience and am familiar with council processes. I believe I have integrity and listen. I consider myself 'work ready.'
candidates.why_stand: Huntly is on the verge of exciting changes. I'm standing to be part of that change and to made a positive contribution to the community. Supporting my husband's home town also means supporting our families. I live in the adjacent council ward but if elected will fully commit to Huntly.

candidates.name: Bill Rosoman
candidates.why_elect: I have a long history of being involved in communities and involved in local body politics. I belong to several community groups and try to help the community get bigger and better and Huntly to be a great place to live.
candidates.why_stand: I believe if we work together as a community and get the public much more involved in community affairs we can make Huntly and District a better place to live and work. We also need to make the council much more transparent and accountable.

candidates.name: Janet Gibb
candidates.why_elect: I strive to be available and approachable within the community. I speak up in council meetings and communicate well with other elected members and council staff. I know I have made a difference and apply common sense to decision making. I have solid experience across all areas in council.
candidates.why_stand: I have been privileged to serve this community for six years as your local councillor. I have many years of management experience in particular in community and banking areas. This experience has stood me in good stead to continue to make good decisions and add value with governing our district.

candidates.name: Rongo Kirkwood
candidates.why_elect: I bring a strong work ethic, well established networks and an open mind to enhancing what is already in place.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our Ngaruawahia ward is the cultural heritage hub of our district. As a seventh generation resident, I believe it is my responsibility to protect the most significant taonga of our area, which is the people who live here, the environment that surrounds us and sites of significance.

candidates.name: Neil Goodger
candidates.why_elect: I have served nine years on council and the community board prior to that also. This gives me the experience, knowledge and confidence to work with all the community, council and councillors. I listen to all people in our community and value all opinions.
candidates.why_stand: I live in town and work in town selling real estate and every day I get the pleasure of selling the advantages Morrinsville has as a great place to live and work for all. I consider it a privilege to serve on council making this a better place for all.

candidates.name: Heather Morton
candidates.why_elect: Having been involved at a local and national level as a Waikato representative for ECE at NZEI (NZ Educational Institute), the teachers union, I believe that I can bring the experience of advocating for a region at governmental level to council.
candidates.why_stand: I want to give back to the awesome and friendly community that has become home for the last eight years.

candidates.name: James Thomas
candidates.why_elect: I now have 6 years experience on council and have a good understanding on how council is run. It is time to now build on this experience and start achieving our communities goals. I am approachable and will listen to the community to ensure that our district continues to grow.
candidates.why_stand: I am Morrinsville born and bred and have a real passion for our district. I want to see solutions to storm water on our industrial land, the finish of the Morrinsville river walk and a long term plan for sport and recreation. I want to achieve these goals.

candidates.name: Caitlin Casey
candidates.why_elect: Hopefully after 20 years of running a Yoga school and focusing on the wellness of people and walking with all walks of life will enable me to hear the true call of the people of Te Aroha's needs. Then try my best to have them activated.
candidates.why_stand: I love Te Aroha, we chose Te Aroha over many other towns because of its special "vibe". Here the mountain just gives so much Aroha and it is reflected in the kindness of the local people. But the town is not thriving and needs attention, let us all try.

candidates.name: Teena Cornes
candidates.why_elect: I care about the community I live in and I'm the first person to always make sure that everyone gets a say. Advocacy is important and ensures the majority are represented.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that in order for a council to function at a strong governance level, we need to maintain consistency and support around the table. I haven't finished some of the projects that I am involved in and would like the opportunity to do so.

candidates.name: Ken Mahon
candidates.why_elect: I have business experience second to none, been a City Councillor previously and understand what is required at the present time.
candidates.why_stand: Running for election to use my expertise as a Turnaround expert to further the goals and prosperity of Te Aroha by creating new businesses, bringing events to town and filling the empty shops.

candidates.name: Russell Smith
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Te Aroha for 25 years, I spent 15 years in the NZ Army and was also a solo parent for 7 years. I was president of the Te Aroha RSA for 7 years and I am also a life member of the RSA.
candidates.why_stand: I believe with my life experiences and attributes I have what it takes to become an effective councillor. I believe Te Aroha is a great gold mine of a town that just needs to be managed correctly, with tourism and creating a reason for the current generations to stay.

candidates.name: Garry Voogt
candidates.why_elect: I'm used to making things happen and have governance experience on a variety of organisations. I'm good at listening and consider everyone's views. I'm a hard worker and will put 100% effort into serving the community I'm part of.
candidates.why_stand: Matamata-Piako is a great place to live but I think we can make it better and I'm keen to play my part. I would like to see Te Aroha revitalised again to the thriving commercial town it once was.

candidates.name: Judith Hattie
candidates.why_elect: Safe communities—neighborhood support, victim support, civil defence, first aid first responder champions, street patrols. Health and well being—improve health access for the vulnerable, aged care, children, young mothers, unemployed, illiterate, prevention of suicide, community caring for community, community gardens reduce inequity.
candidates.why_stand: I will work with the people and other stakeholders in Waharoa to bring about a positive change and restore a strong sense of pride, leadership, self determination, a full participant in environmental well being, protection, progressive and economic growth and development for the area. Tihei Mauri Ora!

candidates.name: James Sainsbury
candidates.why_elect: I am motivated to serve on council by a desire to make Matamata a great place to live now and in the future. As a father to young children and a scientist I bring a diverse range of views and community connections to the decision making process.
candidates.why_stand: Matamata is my home and the place my wife and I are raising our children. We want Matamata to be the best it can be today, and in the future.

candidates.name: Kevin Tappin
candidates.why_elect: My family has lived in the Matamata district for over 100 years providing me with a wealth of knowledge on the history of Matamata. I now have 5 children, 4 step children, 24 grandchildren and 2 great grandchildren, giving me a huge investment in the future of Matamata.
candidates.why_stand: I maintain that the Matamata community deserves to be thriving, vibrant and alive, with residents living, working, using and playing in well maintained, fit for purpose facilities, with robust infrastructure. I believe our community deserves to be consulted on significant expenditure programmes and significant interest projects, eg The Petersen Fountain.

candidates.name: Angela O'Leary
candidates.why_elect: I have served Hamilton as a dedicated City Councillor for 12 years and have the experience to be the best Mayor. I work hard to promote honesty, integrity and genuine transparency. I've served my apprenticeship and I am asking you to trust me with your vote.
candidates.why_stand: It's time you had a Mayor you can trust. I have the courage and integrity to get council and Hamilton back on track. I am the most experienced candidate in this election and as Mayor will put you and our city above all else.

candidates.name: Shanti Ralm
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community my whole life and have a wealth of experience of volunteering in the community.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about my community and the people that live in it.

candidates.name: Matthew Small
candidates.why_elect: I work as a Disability Support Worker so I have seen two different sides to the world. I'm able to work with and understand both sides of people's positions. Councillors have a different range of views and I will be able to work professionally with whoever else is elected.
candidates.why_stand: Hamilton is a great place to live, but can be a lot better. Thinking big and outside the square on how to improve our city, is what gives me motivation to stand for council this year.

candidates.name: Peter Harry Bos
candidates.why_elect: Over the past 2 decades I have been an active member of Cycle Action Waikato, and over the past decade I have been a supporting member of Living-streets Hamilton.
candidates.why_stand: I want Hamilton to be desirable place for future generations to live and continue into the future.

candidates.name: Sarah Thomson
candidates.why_elect: I bring valuable experience in commercial and community law, and a good understanding of local government issues gained through advocacy work. I am passionate about community well-being and our environment, open minded, have a collaborative leadership style, and value meaningful community engagement.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the council has an important role to play in improving community well-being, and in thinking ahead for future generations. I'm running because we need strong leadership on issues such as climate change and housing, and I haven't seen our current council provide this.

candidates.name: Chris Davis
candidates.why_elect: I grew up on the Westside. I co-own a business with my wife Christine, who recently passed from cancer. I hold: Bachelor Physical Education, Secondary Teaching Diploma, and Bachelor Laws (Waikato). My experience includes both public and private sectors; including teaching, management, governance, law, real estate, sales and tertiary education.
candidates.why_stand: I love Hamilton and I really do want what is best for all of us. I advocate strongly for thorough community consultation to ensure decisions made by council truly reflect what is best for all of us and to work together to unite this awesome city so it thrives.

candidates.name: Rudi Du Plooy
candidates.why_elect: I bring positive change to Hamilton. As a Councillor in Johannesburg for eight years, I worked extensively to improve systems of governance, democracy and transparency. These same values are needed here. I was trained in Political Leadership and governance by the Konrad Adenauer Foundation. I will make a difference.

candidates.name: Ewan Wilson
candidates.why_elect: I have returned from overseas refreshed and reinvigorated after studying in the UK and Canada. I have new ideas and fresh thinking to help make Hamilton even better place to live in. I've been in business including launching Kiwi Air and have 12 years of experience in the city council.
candidates.why_stand: I understand a liveable city is not only about areas of economic excellence, but one with a thriving arts and culture sector. I want Hamilton to lead other NZ cities in its environmental practices. I want to be part of the team that makes it successful, dynamic and vibrant.

candidates.name: Martin Gallagher
candidates.why_elect: I have wide experience in business, education and local government, serving Hamilton as a councillor, Deputy Mayor and Member of Parliament. I have extensive experience as a strong advocate for communities and residents to represent their interests.
candidates.why_stand: I am committed to Hamilton and believe it is a great place to live, work and raise a family.

candidates.name: Louise Hutt
candidates.why_elect: Being the CEO of an electricity company, I understand the responsibility that comes with providing core services. As a board member of Go Eco, I understand the role of governance and the importance of sustainability. I'm passionate about collaboration and ensuring we understand our decisions and how they affect everyone.
candidates.why_stand: I've always been frustrated at how little energy is put into making local body politics understandable for most people (but especially young people) and how few politicians actually centre climate change or wellbeing in their decisions. So kia ora, here I am.

candidates.name: Dave Macpherson
candidates.why_elect: I'm a bulldog; I don't let issues go if I take them up, until they are satisfactorily resolved; I get things done—talking shops bore me. I give value for money! If you want a representative that passes things onto staff, then I'm not your best bet.
candidates.why_stand: At the moment, Hamilton is the fastest growing city in NZ, and my job as a councillor is to ensure we have the infrastructure in place to keep us moving and to provide for residents' and businesses' needs.

candidates.name: Jack Gielen
candidates.why_elect: I stand for family4justice and suicide prevention promoting the preciousness of life.
candidates.why_stand: Because i am a truther and a socialist believing in the jubilee principle of equality and justice.

candidates.name: Brad Hills
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Hamilton for over thirty years and been involved in many aspects of our city, such as sport, school, university, and employment. This involvement has allowed me to build relationships with a diverse range of Hamiltonians and given me insight into what our city needs.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that our city is not living up to its full potential. Our environment and many of our people are suffering, and our rates keep going up with what seems to be little to show for it. It is time for a change. I will help bring that change.

candidates.name: Garry Mallett
candidates.why_elect: I clearly understand what is Council's role and what is not. I've a strong respect for the rights of our citizens. I fully respect that when Council spends money it's spending ratepayers' money. Council must be super, super clear that ratepayers are getting great value when Council spends their money.
candidates.why_stand: I have a clear vision of Hamilton as a city lead by its citizens. Council's responsibility is to: (1) enable critical core infrastructure to develop homes, business and prosperity (2) enact light-handed regulation that maintains civic order but doesn't suppress creativity or ambition (3) always ensures outstanding value for ratepayers.

candidates.name: Kesh Naidoo-Rauf
candidates.why_elect: I can promise to listen, ask questions and word hard. I am a mum, wife, community pharmacist, business owner and charity founder; I am capable, sensible and I care. I can advocate for our communities—the young, elderly, families, businesses, the arts, ethnic groups, the affluent and most vulnerable.
candidates.why_stand: I want to help make Hamilton the best place to live and raise a family. I want to help people, reduce disparities, improve our communities and bring diversity to council. I care deeply for our children's future and the city we leave for them. Help me help you, Hamilton!

candidates.name: Rob Pascoe
candidates.why_elect: I am a good listener and team player, have training and experience, good governance skills, and am a lifelong resident of Hamilton. All or even some of these will help contribute good outcomes for the city.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Hamilton is a fantastic city, can achieve its potential, and I wish to part of a team adding value to achieve this.

candidates.name: Anna Smart
candidates.why_elect: I am a professional communicator and negotiator, and passionate community advocate. In my work as a real estate agent I am in and out of people's homes and neighbourhoods which gives me a unique understanding of the city and how each suburb ticks. I value community, integrity and people.
candidates.why_stand: For a balanced approach to growth, fiscal responsibility and a family-friendly, sustainable future. I love this city and believe Hamilton is the best place in NZ to raise a family, and we owe it to our children, and theirs, to ensure it continues to be.

candidates.name: Meleane Burgess
candidates.why_elect: I'm an accountant, a business woman with strong governance and community experience. I bring with me a diverse background and personal experience that will contribute immensely to robust discussions. I stand for fair and balanced council decision making. The three key principles that drive my priorities are affordable, family, safe.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about our growing city and I strongly believe that Hamilton city council should represent the diversity of the cultures and viewpoint of the people that do live and work in Hamilton.

candidates.name: Maxine van Oosten
candidates.why_elect: I work as an advocate for teachers and education staff at NZEI Te Riu Roa. I have spent the last year fight alongside teachers for a fair pay rise. I've 20 years' experience in the finance sector and that makes me a valuable asset in financial debates.
candidates.why_stand: Fresh Ideas – Wise Head. You deserve better value for money from council and that's what I offer. I'll vote against any increase to the CEO's $440k salary. I'd rather see those on low incomes get a living wage.

candidates.name: Andrew Bydder
candidates.why_elect: I am not a politician. I have 25 years' experience in construction and project management, building things on time and on budget. I organise and supervise large teams of professionals, listening to the experts and making decisions for my clients. The people of Hamilton will be my new clients.
candidates.why_stand: Debt is rising 97% to fund 11% growth. That doesn't add up. Rates are rising 54% in the 10-Year Plan. CEO pay hike, $25 million to replace Founders Theatre, 20% more staff, and no accountability. There is a spending problem! I am worried about our future and housing affordability.

candidates.name: James Casson
candidates.why_elect: 28yrs police (20 in Hamilton) experience makes me a pragmatic thinker and a to the point person. I know injustice when I see it and there are a lot of areas where HCC can improve its service to residents. I am local and I have skin in the game.
candidates.why_stand: I am currently a first term councillor and I believe I have further work to do and continue with. I am passionate about serving Hamilton as I did for 20yrs as a Police Officer.

candidates.name: Tim Young
candidates.why_elect: As the only candidate with a Master of Science degree (and computer programming experience), I bring scientific literacy to help inform debate about fluoridation, climate action, and advances in technology. As the only wheelchair user, I have a lived experience that will improve accessibility for the disabled and aging population.
candidates.why_stand: To increase urgency about preparing for the effects of new technologies on our city. I can see the potential for our lives to be affected negatively if we're not proactive. Also, I don't see anyone else on Council with a physical disability pushing for increased accessibility and inclusion in society.

candidates.name: Margaret Forsyth
candidates.why_elect: I'm a Hamiltonian born and bred—and I'm really proud of that. Since graduating from Waikato University I've taught, policed, coached and taken up governance roles in Hamilton. I've got proven successful track record on Council. Hard work, humility, openness and teamwork are my core values.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for council because I want to continue with the projects I had success with on my last term—Destination playgrounds and the Bike Plan. I want to continue to serve my community. It would be a great honour to be re-elected to council.

candidates.name: Philip Coles
candidates.why_elect: I'm involved in many groups and organisations, this gives me a real opportunity to know what is happening in the community and how best to meet the community's needs and shortfalls.
candidates.why_stand: I've been a community board member for 9 years, along with being a 5th generation resident, this gives me drive and passion to continue delivering to the community, I mix with locals regularly and believe in building strong relationships, I listen to theirs needs and together we make a plan,.

candidates.name: Poto Davies
candidates.why_elect: My commitment is focused on people and communities first; enough food, great education, warm homes for all. My governance roles combined with life experience makes me an ideal candidate. I tackle the problem not the person.
candidates.why_stand: I love for Waipa/Cambridge is seeded from 26 generations: I believe I add value and differing perspectives to the Waipa community through my current representation for iwi on two council committees since 2014. Cambridge is the best place to grow up.

candidates.name: Dennis Finn
candidates.why_elect: I understand the process and the Councillors role in that. I am a strategic thinker with an eye towards future needs and development. I have lived in Cambridge for the past 14 years and have given my time in support of our town. I take pride in this work.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for Council in the belief that I can make a sound contribution. As a previous Councillor I understand how Council works, I can contribute meaningfully and I will represent our community and the district in the best interests of cost effective local government for Waipa.

candidates.name: Roger Gordon
candidates.why_elect: I have the experience of representing Cambridge on the community board for the last three years. I have the time and energy to commit 100% to the job of being a Councillor. I have a strong work ethic. I am approachable and a good listener.
candidates.why_stand: I love Cambridge. I am committed to Cambridge. Cambridge will experience tremendous growth over the next 15 years and I want to contribute to our town being the best it can possibly be. I particularly want to see the special character of Cambridge retained through the pressures of this growth.

candidates.name: Steve Grounds
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in this area most of my life and my wife Kim and I are settled here. I will bring to the council table a wealth of experience in management and governance in private and public sector organisations, a sound understanding of local government operations and good governance practices.
candidates.why_stand: I'm proud to call Cambridge my home. It's a great place to live, raise a family and retire to. However the growth presents a number of challenges. We need leadership and manage this growth carefully, otherwise we risk losing the very special character and things we value about our township.

candidates.name: Don Sanders
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Cambridge most of my life, and can remember the place it used to be. I have no financial interests in any council business, and therefore any decision I make on Council will be in the best interest of this town.
candidates.why_stand: Because like you, I have often wanted a better choice of candidate, one who will not waste public money on redesigning logos, water meters, or overseas trips to sister-cities; while helping this town become what it used to be.

candidates.name: Liz Stolwyk
candidates.why_elect: Having lived in the Waipa District for many years I currently manage Mighty River Domain at Lake Karapiro (15 years). I work constructively with many organisations and have strong interpersonal and organisational skills. I am married to Andrew with three growing school aged boys.
candidates.why_stand: Steady leadership has seen my second term on council finish with a thriving central business district, controlled growth, the Cambridge pool near completion and funding confirmed for the Cambridge Town Hall. Sensible rate increases has seen me act prudently with both the resources and finances to keep Cambridge prosperous.

candidates.name: Bernard Westerbaan
candidates.why_elect: I am a family man living in the District for 39 Years, married 45 years, five children and eight grandchildren. I am involved in the community: Commsafe patrols, fifth term BOT intermediate school, treasurer local GreyPower, Menzshed, six years community board, able to speed read and understand large reports.
candidates.why_stand: This election is for the people of Waipa (Te Awamutu Ward). I am a people's person and promote a Triple A rating being accountable, approachable and being an advocate for residents. I believe in honesty and timely feedback. Not scared to ask the difficult question. I'm sometimes called persistent.

candidates.name: John Wood
candidates.why_elect: I have been involved in the district for over 35 years and would bring a unique mix of skills and experience to council.
candidates.why_stand: I want to champion a practical approach to our evolving community.

candidates.name: Andrew Brown
candidates.why_elect: Apart from nine years studying and working in Wellington, my home has been in Waipa. I grew up here, practiced as an accountant here and own a business here. My knowledge of this community and skill-set make me a good candidate for Waipa District Council.
candidates.why_stand: Waipa is a great place to live. Past councils and council staff have made good decisions meaning Waipa is in a great position to continue providing better infrastructure for future generations.

candidates.name: Lou Brown
candidates.why_elect: I currently represent the Te Awamutu RSA on senior Council and feel that with my experience and local knowledge I will be able to contribute more to an efficient and positive Council management.
candidates.why_stand: I currently represent the Te Awamutu RSA on Senior council and feel that with my experience and local knowledge I will be able to contribute more to an efficient and positive council management.

candidates.name: Michael Emery
candidates.why_elect: My leadership, science, and technology skills are exactly what is needed to move Waipa closer to the vision of a strong, vibrant and sought-after district. My experience of other cities and human geography training, bring a fresh perspective essential to modernising our district and instilling a renewed sense of purpose.
candidates.why_stand: I believe in the limitless potential of the Waipa District and in our ability to propel this region forward. That progress depends on economic and technological innovation, our environment, quality of life, and a more personal sense of community. I am running to set these conditions for success.

candidates.name: Bernhard Fynn
candidates.why_elect: I have a varied background, Prison Officer, motor mechanic, competitive swimmer and swim teacher/coach, 1st dan in Judo and started a judo club in Te Awamutu. Being retired and have the time rate payers concerns. I have lived in Wapa most of my life, Cambridge from 1950 and Te Awamutu from 1989.
candidates.why_stand: The rapid rise in the population has compromised the quality of life in Waipa. We have water restrictions in summer ,roads congested and in need or repair.I want to see our rates money spent on NEED not wants.

candidates.name: Bill Izard
candidates.why_elect: I've been involved in community and service organisations for years locally, from helping the elderly to organizing events for the town. I've owned and operated large multinational companies employing hundreds of people all over the world. I've been involved in business enterprise boards attracting companies into regions.
candidates.why_stand: I have the time and experience to give Te Awamutu-Kihikihi as a councillor. I have lived in the area for many years even married a local girl 38 year married. Being available full time as councillor. Connecting community with council representing the residents with regular meetings.

candidates.name: James Charles Morris Parlane
candidates.why_elect: Because I am able to look at things objectively and review the need for them. I can also question councils traditions and find more efficient ways to operate. There are too many cozy arrangements and the public need to be informed of them.
candidates.why_stand: Because the current council have madness when it comes to borrowing and spending. It is wasteful and has spent too much on "nice to haves" Te Awamutu is not the best place I would like to stop the rot and make it a bit better by making it affordable.

candidates.name: Dennis Pennefather
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in this community for ten years and worked with persons of special needs for most of that period. A background of 25 years as a policeman gave me a sense of humanity and kinship. I have skills which I wish to use to benefit the populace.
candidates.why_stand: I love the friendliness of the district and its people. I see some problems between council and its constituents and I would like to help solve those issues using skills I have obtained over years of police service and on community disability trusts.

candidates.name: Cassidy Temese
candidates.why_elect: I have extensive governance and advocacy experience, with strong established relationships with communities of the Waipā. A young, confident and articulate descendant of the many iwi and hapū of the Waipā, I have the passion and conviction to lead positive transformational change for all.
candidates.why_stand: The Waipā is my ancestral Tūrangawaewae. I have a deep responsibility to ensure that Waipā and the people who call it home are protected and nurtured for future generations to come.

candidates.name: C. E. (Kit) Jeffries
candidates.why_elect: I have a long family association and personal commitment to the Kāwhia area as a permanent resident. I am an experienced professional with an extensive background in finance and administration in both private enterprise and with local government as an elected member and in senior management roles:.
candidates.why_stand: Kawhia/Aotea and surrounding areas are unique to the Otorohanga District being the only ward encompassing not just the magnificent Kawhia Harbour but a diverse rural hinterland and a number of small communities including the Kawhia Township itself. I am passionate about serving the area I call home.

candidates.name: Evan Cowan
candidates.why_elect: I have a background in science which I believe puts me in a good position to analyze issues as they arise. I have also lived in the district all my working life and have a good grasp of practical issues facing the community.
candidates.why_stand: I believe it is very important that voters have a choice. I have the time and I believe, the ability to make a useful contribution if elected.

candidates.name: Roy Johnson
candidates.why_elect: I have 3 terms experience as a councillor and I will be ready when the difficult decisions come around again. This council takes governance. Every decision is money. You have to know that the advantages outweigh the disadvantages. It excites me to represent my community.
candidates.why_stand: I have always enjoyed representing rural people and I love being part of a rural community. Having been Otorohanga Federated Farmers Chair for 4 years submitting against the district plan, it was logical that I stood for my ward and a rural seat at the district council.

candidates.name: Adrienne Bell
candidates.why_elect: I moved to Putāruru 20 years ago with wide experience in the field of Public Relations and Communications—a field which encompasses planning, systems and relationships management. After a period of decline the town is growing again and I believe I can help steer it in the right direction.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that Putāruru has tremendous potential for future growth and prosperity after a period of decline.

candidates.name: Sandra Wallace
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Putaruru most of my life, I have raised a family here and own a business. I have had 25 years in banking and have a financial brain. I have a lot of local knowledge and been involved in many different groups over the years.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the south waikato is an awesome place to live and bring up a family. I have been involved in many organisations and groups over the years and as a business person I believe I can make a difference and be a voice and ear for Putaruru and district.

candidates.affiliation: Love my town, Love my district
candidates.name: Andrew Andersen
Marin James Glucina
candidates.why_elect: I have 39 years of experience of living in Tokoroa and have been in practice as a solicitor I know the problems the town has faced with the huge redundancy issues when the Kinleith pulp and paper mill shed thousands of staff. Those days are behind us and the town now.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that Tokoroa can be NZ's best and most easily liveable small town We have all the necessary facilities for a comfortable stress free lifestyle, especially for the older citizens. We have medical services including a hospital Four major trading banks, police council and social welfare services within a radius of 3km.

candidates.name: Phil Brodie
candidates.why_elect: See above.
candidates.why_stand: I've been part of an elected council that over the last three terms has overcome huge financial and infrastructural challenges and I will be there to help my community benefit from the better position we are in as I have been re-elected unopposed.

candidates.name: Lisa Marshall
candidates.why_elect: I have grown up in this community. I am a business owner which services our community and I work with our children of tomorrow.
candidates.why_stand: Our community is a community of heart. It rally's together in the time of need and it shows our unity.

candidates.name: Jacob Ngarewa
candidates.why_elect: I am born and bread here in Te Kuiti. I am involved with many organisations and I'm all about walking the talk. I am the chairperson of two charitable trusts and coordinator of one of the local foodbanks I know our people.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council to be a strong voice for this community. I believe the current council do not listen to the ratepayers, to our residents. We need the right people in place to run our council.

candidates.name: Kevin Taylor
candidates.why_elect: After 44 plus years with NZ Police I have the governance and management skills combined with people skills to add value to this community. I have volunteered extensively over many years in ventures directly impacting on Taupō. Civil defence, emergency management and traffic safety are my strengths.
candidates.why_stand: Since moving to Taupō 27 years ago my wife Raewyn and I have made Taupō our turangawaewae. We have raised our 5 children here and want to continue investing time and energy in the Taupō community. I have skills, experience and the time to devote to this role.

candidates.name: John Williamson
candidates.why_elect: Taupō has been my home for 56 years,as a current two term Councillor I believe in getting out into the community to listen to the issues that affect our residents and ratepayers.
candidates.why_stand: I stand for sensible progress.

candidates.name: Kathy Guy
candidates.why_elect: I am fresh and future focused and believe in sound planning for the rapidly changing social and economic needs of the district. I bring demonstrated leadership from my role as a CEO and governance from active involvement at national level in tourism and Taupō council boards including Taupō Economic Development.
candidates.why_stand: Taupō is unique in NZ in terms of its tangata whenua, location and natural resources. I know it as a community of caring people. I value the authenticity of what Taupō represents to its residents and its visitors. I want to ensure that Taupō does not lose these values.

candidates.name: Mowenna (Mo) Harding
candidates.why_elect: I am a sincere, intelligent, passionate and practical everyday person who believes council should be representative of all our community including everyday people just like me, not simply those with ties to big business. As a councillor I will be fair and considerate of the district as a whole.
candidates.why_stand: I believe a fundamental breakdown in communication currently exists between council and our community and this needs to change, starting with open and clear conversations. We live in a special place, and we all have a right to be better informed on issues and decisions that affect our home.

candidates.name: Rosanne Jollands
candidates.why_elect: My reputation is as someone who challenges the status quo and someone who listens, is approachable. An RMA Commissioner, trustee for Life Education Trust, a management degree, majoring in economics and 30 years' business and governance experience, I bring to the table a healthy dose of common sense.
candidates.why_stand: We need fresh thinking and a council that is listening to your needs. Our district needs a high-performing council that provides real value for you and our community. We need sound and timely decision-making, not bureaucracy and red tape. That's the kind of leadership I commit to delivering for you.

candidates.name: Anna Park
candidates.why_elect: You can trust me to listen, act and always in the best interests of Taupō. I'm a third-term councillor with a family and a near perfect 100% attendance record. A team player with a strong, independent voice that supports thriving communities, always with honesty and accountability, Positive and well informed.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate and proud of our District. I'm committed to the safety of our communities, the protection of our natural environment, and the intergenerational processes of council in this modern day. I'm a strong advocate for enhancing facilities; economic development; improved transportation including walking and cycling; water quality and infrastructure.

candidates.name: Jan-Marie Quinn
candidates.why_elect: I am a former business owner so I know about management and making important decision so things work for the best. I am a very hard worker and strive for perfection in whatever I do. I have a political background once working for a government organisation.
candidates.why_stand: I love Taupō. Over the years I have been involved in many local ventures that have needed support from council. I became very interested in what makes the community tick and decided I wanted to be part of making important decisions for the better of the community.

candidates.name: Christine Singer
candidates.why_elect: I am a great listener and enjoy finding solutions to problems. My major strength is seeing ideas through to fruition and I am a clear concise decision maker. I relate well with people of all ages and cultures and am passionate about helping young people, reach their potential.
candidates.why_stand: Taupō District is one of the best districts in NZ and I am passionate about keeping it vibrant and attractive to visitors and locals with a pristine Lake for enjoyment of all.

candidates.name: John Mack
candidates.why_elect: I have Lived in Turangi for 26 years working in customer service, I believe I have a good standing within the community and am respected I am known for my dedication, honesty and belief in this town, I can be outspoken but will battle for what i believe is fair.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Turangi and its surrounding villages are stunning, we have a world class ski field on our doorstep,a great lake with world renowned trout fishing and outdoor recreation people around the world can only dream of, we are the jewel of the north island.

candidates.name: Chris Te Whare
candidates.why_elect: I have lived around the Great Lake for the last 13 years (it's a great place to live, work and play) and have lived or taught in Turangi, Mangakino and I now live in Wairakei Village. All my work has been community based and I believe that I can contribute!
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council as I believe that I can contribute to moving Taupō District forward. My background in community work as a teacher, police officer, community board and school board of trustees person has given me skills to allow me to do this.

candidates.name: Neil Candy
candidates.why_elect: My background covers various different industries which I can adapt to quickly. Have been self employed for the last 20 odd years. I would like to see council be less political and concentrate of serving the community that it represents .
candidates.why_stand: I am running because I see the need to rein in council debt and unnecessary spending on projects that are underutilised. I have lived in the BOP since 2003 and have built up a great passion for our part of the world .

candidates.name: John Clements
candidates.why_elect: I have a wealth of business experience to help drive efficiency and the thinking within the community. The experience spans both local and international business. I work well with people to achieve positive outcomes.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I can make a difference and bring about change that the community is seeking. This is a beautiful area with many rich stories to tell and the museum is the story-teller surrounded by other venues. We can be "linked to the past and focused on the future".

candidates.name: James Denyer
candidates.why_elect: I have been active in the Katikati community for ten years in a wide variety of leadership roles, eg I am currently Chairman of Aongatete Forest Project. My background is in science and then corporate finance in London so I have strong skills in analytical and strategic thinking.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see effective planning for the future of Katikati, meeting the challenges of population growth, changing patterns of industry and horticulture. I believe my skills and leadership qualities will benefit the community.

candidates.name: Anne Henry
candidates.why_elect: Born and raised in Katikati. I am passionate about the well-being of our community and environment. I am keen that the needs of the rural sector are not forgotten. I support the agencies that help develop pathways for our young people to gain skills to help them into local employment.
candidates.why_stand: Council's Long Term Plan—"steady as we grow"—has resulted from wide consultation. It is now time to deliver. My message is yes we can and I will!

candidates.name: Christina Humphreys
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the Katikati district for 17 years and have the skills and experience to help force the changes required. I will stand up and be counted, which has been the problem in council for the last three years, the Mayor has called the shots!
candidates.why_stand: My motivation is because of the ever increasing rates in the WBOP, we have highest rates in the country and we have a Mayor who won't listen to the people on this issue and others.'I am not a yes man,but a common sense Woman for the job!

candidates.name: Tangiwai Manihera-Palmer
candidates.why_elect: I live on Matakana Island where my mum Colleen Te Arihi was born. I went to Matua Primary and Otumoetai College. Now I have a business called Mo's Matakana Island Tours and I do storytelling with my husband who was also raised on Matakana Island.
candidates.why_stand: Western Bay is growing daily and I would love to be part of the growing changes for our future because we are in the best part of the world. I am Māori and I can share things Māori and learn from me what it's like to be Māori.

candidates.name: Allan Sole
candidates.why_elect: I have lived here 22 years. I am a businessman, have chaired the Waihi Beach Community Board for six years. My involvement in governance and management are within local trusts, committees, up to regional and national levels. I am very involved with community patrols, the WBOP Heritage Trust and LGNZ CBEC.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the Katikati Waihi Beach Ward is vibrant and diverse in so many ways, from the best beach to a mural town. It is full of history from Tangata whenua to an Ulster settlement and more. I want to represent and lobby for the area and the people.

candidates.lives_in: Te Puke, Western Bay of Plenty
candidates.name: Stephen Fawcett
candidates.why_elect: My fresh perspective and new ideas will be refreshing and welcome change. I have proven time again that I will deliver on promises with action. I have a wide diversity of skills to contribute to this position of advocacy and representation. I am the perfect candidate to represent the community.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion to see WBOP thrive alongside healthy representation and unified strategies. I have held many leadership positions. I am a passionate candidate who truly cares for positive change, constantly advocating, and pushing for inclusion of a diverse range of people in our community.

candidates.name: Monique Lints
candidates.why_elect: I believe I will make a good elected member because I am at grassroots of development and engagement in our community. My experience over the last year in local government has ignited a need to represent our community.
candidates.why_stand: After being an active volunteer and advocating for our community it is essential for our community voice to be heard and diversity within our elected representation, this was not an easy decision but I feel it is the right one.

candidates.before_politics: I continue as a dairy farmer
candidates.name: Kevin Marsh
candidates.why_elect: For me, Te Puke and districts, Maketu and Pongakawa are home. People who know me say that I am strong but fair, my own person. I represent and advocate with honesty, and proven experience, standing strong for our community.
candidates.why_stand: I continue to be absolutely committed to Te Puke and districts, Maketu-Te Puke Ward, ensuring that all communities of our Ward have an effective voice in council.

candidates.name: Mark Dean
candidates.why_elect: I have an extensive background in environmental business. Educated at Waikato University, I taught for ten years before founding Naturally Native NZ Plants in Oropi. I have extensive governance experience, holding directorships, chairmanship of industry bodies, and Environmental Trusts.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the Western Bay is a great place to live and I feel we need to work to maintain this. I have had one term on council and I feel I have much more to offer. I would like to continue to serve the district.

candidates.name: John Evans
