candidates.why_elect: I have lived in and around this community for most of my life. I believe in having conversations to hear as many points of view as possible. Then work through a solution (based in common sense and practicality) for the community.
candidates.why_stand: I am for change. I feel the time is right to elect younger representation, someone who is young enough to have great aspirations for our community and have the drive/energy to see the ideas to fruition.

candidates.name: Margaret Murray-Benge
candidates.why_elect: When people have an issue I like to visit them to understand it first hand, and then work with them to resolve the issue. I work with people and together we have and do make a difference.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because I believe we can do better than we are at the present. With the years of experience I have had in leadership roles in local government in Waimairi District Council, United council, Christchurch City and 15 years in Western Bay as Councillor. I am ready.

candidates.name: John Palmer
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community for 23 years, I am a chartered engineer who has had a career in local government both as an employee and a consultant and I want to continue to bring my experience to the council table and add value to the decision making.
candidates.why_stand: My first term on council has been a learning experience and I am now seeking re-election and a desire to take a greater role in managing the issues of growth and affordability that our fast growing district is facing.

candidates.affiliation: It's time, time to take the trash out
candidates.name: Shona Delaney
candidates.why_elect: My Vision: Our People, free of corruption. My Mission: Speak the Truth, deliver the Whole Truth, providing Nothing but the Truth. My Goal: To accept, ask and offer to help, Solve the Problems, Safely to be most effective and Efficiently. My Challenge: is at no additional cost.
candidates.why_stand: The corruption of processes, misappropriation of laws and bullying evident within our Council, govt organisations and the workplace within our city, has and continue to destroy lives. Behaviours that cause undue pain, long term suffering and suicide among our victims, is unacceptable.

candidates.name: Peter Gregson
candidates.why_elect: I love living in the Mount and believe my skills from working in Operations and Project Management in handling conflicting priorities, engaging stakeholders, prudent financial management and setting priorities will allow me to be an effective councillor dealing with the issues the city currently faces.
candidates.why_stand: I think we live in a little bit of paradise which is being badly affected by inadequate planning for growth and ineffective leadership in council and want to help make a positive change.

candidates.name: Deborah Johnston
candidates.why_elect: I have over 20 years general management experience, strategy planning and future technologies. I am passionate about communities and ensuring what we put in place today, serves not just our needs but the future needs of our children's children.
candidates.why_stand: I love Mount Maunganui/ Papamoa and all it has to offer families and businesses. It's beauty is not only the views, the beaches the lifestyle, it's beauty is also found in the hearts of the people. I'm standing for their voice and for the future of our city.

candidates.name: Dawn Kiddie
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Tauranga for the past 25 years and my husband and I have raised our family here and run our respective businesses. As a justice of the Peace and starting the Mt Ratepayers association I bring community issues some resolution delivered with a smile!
candidates.why_stand: My passion is to "Put the community back into council".To be a voice that not only works for the community but with the community and acts on there various requests. To be straight up and honest and act in the best interests of the community opinion always.

candidates.name: Steve Morris
candidates.why_elect: The Mount and Papamoa need a trusted, proven leader that will stand up for our communities over at Tauranga City Council. Experience: 6 years on TCC; 9 years as a director of BayTrust; 8 years on the BOP Conservation Board; Self employed since the age of 24.
candidates.why_stand: This is my home; the place I love and where my wife and I are choosing to raise our family. I have the energy and experience to ensure our city and its growth are managed in a financially sustainable and successful way.

candidates.name: Jako Abrie
candidates.why_elect: I care about our home and people. With volunteering, infrastructure, and finance experience, I'll work towards making Tauranga a better place to live.
candidates.why_stand: To make a difference. Particularly for our most vulnerable people.

candidates.name: Larry Baldock
candidates.why_elect: I believe I have the experience and skills needed for the role. I have been involved in both local and central government and can work with others to achieve positive outcomes. I am a critical thinker and strong debater to help council make better decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Tauranga is a great place for young people, families and retirees to live. We can be better with good management and clear vision for the kind of city we want to become.

candidates.affiliation: Your choice for your voice - Stop the waste
candidates.name: Murray Guy

candidates.affiliation: A Councillor Who Listens.  Give Me Your One
candidates.name: Anne Pankhurst
Barry Pollett
candidates.why_elect: I have lived here for 25 years and have enjoyed the privilege of being part of this city. Times have changed and so must we. I do not have any ambition for myself personally All I want is to leave this a better place for everyone.
candidates.why_stand: My motivation: Someone has to make a stand for our community. I believe I can contribute with new ideas. If I didn't think I could make a difference I wouldn't be standing for office.

candidates.affiliation: Have your say for your city
candidates.name: Bill Grainger
Anna Larsen
candidates.why_elect: Bringing groups of people together requires skill in collaboration and communication. After six years running the Welcome Bay Community Centre I've learned the importance and logistics of financial management, while exercising compassion, practicality and prioritisation.
candidates.why_stand: This is a beautiful part of the country, with amazing communities and I believe this is what needs to be supported and protected. Working at grassroots level has given me a very clear understanding of the issues and challenges our communities face daily.

candidates.name: Terry Molloy
candidates.why_elect: To quote Max Mason: "Terry brings a lifetime of experience and service to the people of Tauranga there is plenty of energy and drive to finish the job. Unlike some he also serves the community in many other roles above and beyond his role as a elected member."
candidates.why_stand: I was born in Tauranga lived here all my life. I have always been involved in the life of our community and wish to continue to do so. I have had three terms as a councilor and have a very good knowledge of the workings of council.

candidates.name: Rob Poad
candidates.why_elect: I have been a Tauranga resident for 35 years. I am skilled at solving problems. My focus would be on resolving our cities issues, rather than wasting time renaming streets! I have a qualification in business and a desire to see change.
candidates.why_stand: Tauranga residents have been asking for change, we want problems to be addressed. To often candidates promise the world yet deliver so little. We need new people to stand up and and make a difference. Tauranga needs change!

candidates.name: Tina Salisbury
candidates.why_elect: I'm a local, I grew up here. I have been a small business owner for many years and have experienced roles in governance and management in the non-profit sector. I would say I have a head for business and a heart for people.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for city council because I love our city the diverse people who live here. I have been advocating for people in our communities for the past 8 years and believe that we need more diversity, smarter leadership and more collaborative representation in our city council.

candidates.name: Jim Sherlock
candidates.why_elect: In business I have made some good decisions, plus made several bad ones as well. You learn from those experiences to base your judgements on facts, not ego. If elected, I will hold quarterly Ward meetings to hear from the residents their concerns and address them, if I can.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the council needs business people who have common sense, to define the real problems Tauranga is facing with rapid growth, before signing off projects involving major expenditure. Had several letters published and some folks approached me to stand to put those suggestion into practise. So standing for council.

candidates.name: Waitsu Wu
candidates.why_elect: I am passionate about community wellbeing and this value guides my decisions based on what is in the best interests of all. I am highly collaborative and able to work positively with 11 other councillors to achieve positive results. I am hard-working and able to listen to people's concerns.
candidates.why_stand: I am privileged to become an NZ citizen and a Justice of the Peace. In return, I want to offer my skills as a service to NZ and to the community. I want to see our city develop into a happy vibrant and thrive harmonious super city.

candidates.name: Wini Geddes
candidates.why_elect: I was born and raised on the banks of the Rangitaiki river and have worked for the community, for example leading NAVA—Ngati Awa Volunteer Army through the Edgecumbe flooding disaster.
candidates.why_stand: I value the semi-rural lifestyle of the Whakatane district.

candidates.name: Wilson James
candidates.why_elect: I have extensive experience in Governance and Management areas and can listen and make informed judgements on different issues.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about our District and the people who live here.

candidates.name: Pouroto Ngaropo
candidates.why_elect: I bring a diverse skill base with many years of governance and leadership experience and have a solution focused approach to solving problems. I am bilingual, bi cultural and able to confidently and competently engage in both worlds and I have lived my life in service to our community.
candidates.why_stand: I have spent my whole life building and strengthening connections and developing leadership skills that will enable me to lead our communities and make contributions to their future growth and development. I believe in Unity across our communities and the importance of community voice in council. I care about people.

candidates.name: Mel Rangiaho
candidates.why_elect: I was raised here and we are raising our children here. I have worked at the Whakatane RSA for 18 years I believe in a healthy progressive community I have great management skill as I have run big dairy units/staff and have a great eye for detail. People first.
candidates.why_stand: I believe in our community and the people that live here it's time for me to give back. I listen really well and I don't claim to know everything, am a great problem solver what you see is what you get no hidden gender safety in our community.

candidates.name: John Pullar
candidates.why_elect: Because I get things done.
candidates.why_stand: This District has been good to our family over the years so it is time to give something back.

candidates.name: Steve Sopora
candidates.why_elect: I have the skills, experience, and time to make a difference. I'm a young retired engineer with a master's degree in business administration and 30 years of technical, management, and board experience. I've delivered large engineering/construction projects globally, run wastewater treatment technology businesses, championed renewable fuels, and overseen strategic planning.
candidates.why_stand: I want to apply my skills/experience to help Whakatāne District be the best it can be. Our fantastic lifestyle relies on sustainable infrastructure/services and a vibrant business climate that creates employment and investment. These are lofty objectives and only a capable, diverse, and committed council can make them happen.

candidates.name: Nandor Tanczos
candidates.why_elect: I am a strategic thinker with extensive governance experience. I have been an MP, a businessman, a community organiser, educator and strategic planning consultant. I bring a real love for the Eastern Bay and enthusiasm to help us thrive in the 21st century.
candidates.why_stand: Whakatāne is a spectacular place with a great community. Like any community around the country we face serious challenges—but also exciting opportunities. By becoming more sustainable, more resilient and more regenerative we can become a light for the country.

candidates.name: Toni Boynton
candidates.why_elect: I am passionate about developing strong resilient whānau and communities. I offer 15 years' experience working for communities. I'm also an experienced participant in local body politics, and have a strong track record of connecting people and initiating projects that utilise well-built networks and trusting working relationships.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for election because I have skills to connect people and ensure our local government better reflects the diversity of our communities.

candidates.name: Lesley Immink
candidates.why_elect: I'm keen to help effect positive change and employment growth in our community. I am an experienced professional with a demonstrated history of working in the tourism industry and corporate leadership—skilled in strategic business planning, product development and marketing, governance and transformative organisation change.
candidates.why_stand: Whakatane District and I are both ready for a change. I'm not running as Mayor for the money, I'm not running for the title. The right timing has presented itself and I am ready to help navigate the community and its economic development initiatives as we look to the future.

candidates.name: Scott Jarrett
candidates.why_elect: I was born here and spent my working life establishing a wholesale distribution company and operating our own businesses. I'm proud to be a third generation councillor, I guess you could say it's in our blood!
candidates.why_stand: I wish to serve another term on council, retaining some experience in the mix will provide good balance. Sound investment in infrastructure and great service to community is my priority. Elections bring about change and my record proves an ability to adapt into a new team with differing focus.

candidates.name: Julie Jukes
candidates.why_elect: Experience already as a politician. I'm a two term councillor, a local business owner, a Chartered Accountant and I have held senior local government management positions. I am also involved in the community as the Chairperson Pou Whakaaro. I also have a very outgoing personality.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about our unique district, it needs to grow whilst retaining what we love most about our urban and rural towns, our communities, our beautiful natural environment and relaxed lifestyle. I want to lead us through the upcoming exciting challenges and issues.

candidates.name: Neil Larking
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in our community most of my life and have a wealth of experience and knowledge of the area. My drive for applying for council revolves around my Outdoor activities and ensuring the future development and funding in the region is distributed to projects that support the community.
candidates.why_stand: I moved to Whakatane as a 2 year old and I have spent my life in the Whakatane Township. I worked as a Carpenter/Foreman at various Whakatane based building firms over a 40 year career. I am a keen outdoorsman, enjoying fishing, white baiting and hunting.

candidates.name: Victor Luca
candidates.why_elect: I was one of Whakatane High School's top graduates and deputy head boy. I have subsequently excelled in my career of choice which requires creativity, discipline, tenacity, creativity, intellect and ability to work with and lead people. I have been leading scientific research teams for 20 years.
candidates.why_stand: Science is a career that is geared toward working for the public good. I now want to use my competencies do something of benefit to the community in which I was born and raised and with which I have a strong emotional attachment. I want to make it even better!

candidates.name: Jennifer Manning
candidates.why_elect: My personal and professional experiences have given me a unique perspective and an extensive range of skill sets. These experiences fuel my passion to deliver positive outcomes for the district and establish opportunities for everyone within our communities.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about this district and can contribute to its well being by sharing my skills and experiences. I understand the challenges and will be the positive transitional change needed—accountable to the community, transparent in decision-making and assessing development opportunities based on affordability, sustainability and inclusiveness.

candidates.name: Wayne Marriott
candidates.why_elect: For the past decade I have lived and worked in Whakatane, proudly delivering real community outcomes. My national and international professional background, education (BA, MBA), governance roles at a regional and national level equip me with the skills and voice to represent the community and advocate for our future.
candidates.why_stand: We live in a wonderful part of NZ—our climate, our history, the attraction of our natural beauty are all reasons to come and visit the Eastern Bay of Plenty, but most importantly what will get you to return, move or invest here?

candidates.name: Doug Mclean
candidates.why_elect: As a former school principal, I bring a diverse range of experiences and skills. I've worked in education for 45 years and acted as an advisor to the Ministry of Education. These experiences have given me the ability to relate to a diverse range of people, and their needs.
candidates.why_stand: Running for mayor in 2016 reaffirmed my passion to serve my community. By being involved in council, I get to be involved in our community, and be a part of future decision making, as well as have time to enjoy what our district has to offer.

candidates.name: Alison Silcock
candidates.why_elect: The people within our communities know I am willing to roll up my sleeves and work for them and with them.
candidates.why_stand: I enjoy helping shape the future of this diverse community.

candidates.name: Jackie Te Amo
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in the ward most of my life, gained a lot of experience and are supported by my community.
candidates.why_stand: To be the voice for the Galatea-Murupara Ward.

candidates.name: Louis Rāpihana
candidates.why_elect: I am a person who loves communicating with people, I want the people to have more of a voice in local policies and plans moving forward.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing as a candidate at the request of the people, the people want a change and I am honoured to help make that happen.

candidates.name: Ron Findlay
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in the Opotiki district for 16 years spread over 2 occasions. I've a wide experience of working with diverse groups. I'm a skilled communicator.
candidates.why_stand: I became involved with a climate crisis group... Extinction Rebellion and realised that climate change and rising sea levels pose an immense risk to our town,our country, our planet. Act locally... think globally.

candidates.name: Debi Hocart
candidates.why_elect: I have come from life in a big city and have now lived in Opotiki for over 30 years. I bring good communication, many years experience and service to the community in the health sector and in my volunteer roles.
candidates.why_stand: Opotiki is a unique place with stunning beaches and walkways and bush. It is a wonderful place to bring up children, to retire and as a holiday destination. I want to be part of the future of this town to ensure we maintain our uniqueness while developing varied, local industries.

candidates.name: Shona Browne
candidates.why_elect: I was born and raised in Ōpōtiki. I have experience in Business, I set up and operated my own Business, Ōpōtiki Realty for 23 years. I have a Diploma in Business Studies. I am serving my second year as Ōpōtiki Lions Club President, I'm also a Justice of the Peace.
candidates.why_stand: Ōpōtiki is a great little town with so much potential. Our greatest need is employment especially for our Youth. This is why we really need the Government to fund the Harbour Development, and we must continue our energies to achieve this.

candidates.name: Alex Dobie
candidates.why_elect: Having served three terms as an Opotiki District Councillor from 2001-2010. I have the skills and experience necessary to be the next mayor. Married to Kararaina for 38 years, we have successfully raised three children in Opotiki. Community interests and networks and a commitment to engage and consult with all.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about Opotiki, and the people who live here. I see huge potential within our district. Untapped potential the challenge is about making the positive changes to enrich our lives, while ensuring the future is brighter for us all. Making Opotiki a better safer place is my goal.

candidates.name: Frank Murphy
candidates.why_elect: I have been chairman of a 150 member NZ wide tourism association for 25 years. know about meeting procedures and how to get things done. Proved this through a contract with GDC to bring cruise ships into Gisborne successfully achieved, on time and within budget.
candidates.why_stand: Waipaoa ward needs a strong voice.

candidates.name: Sandra Faulkner
candidates.why_elect: I have a well-established business background in agriculture, horticulture and farm forestry while also having a portfolio of charitable and not-for-profit governance. I look forward to the opportunity to bring a high level of strategic thinking, energy and pride in our region, to the council table.
candidates.why_stand: Gisborne is a great place to live, work and raise our families, but distance from the main centres can be debilitating for our small communities. Understanding issues on the ground allows me to better advocate for the regions rural families and businesses."

candidates.name: Alice Kibble
candidates.why_elect: I provide a different set of experiences to others and represent a group of people who are currently not represented.
candidates.why_stand: The biggest passion I have is for my community. Our rangitahi are the future of Tairawhiti, it is important their voices are heard at the council table to ensure the future we are creating is fit for them and future generations.

candidates.name: Mary Liza Manuel
candidates.why_elect: I have had previous lobbying experience with Rail Action Group and Tairawhiti Residents Assn. From there I developed resilience and collaboration being a team player. I contributed my time skills and commitment to the Gigatown comp to see a transformation in our city. I have qualifications incl governance/leadership.
candidates.why_stand: I am ready to be a part of a strong team striving for an economy and environment that will provide long term sustainability with economic development. I will champion greater transparency and ensure all residents and ratepayers have more say over decisions that affect us.

candidates.name: Glenis Philip-Barbara
candidates.why_elect: I've had a decent career so far in education and the public sector and have a huge range of skills to contribute. However, my ability to work respectfully with people from all walks for life and make room for them to realise their aspirations is most important.
candidates.why_stand: I love this place, and I want to contribute as much energy as I can to making Tairāwhiti a place where everyone thrives. For me that will be the ultimate legacy to leave for all our mokopuna (grandchildren).

candidates.name: Tony Robinson
candidates.why_elect: I am Kaiti born and raised. I have 22 years experience as a lawyer; finding solutions and advocating for people. I also have a degree in Japanese, psychology and Māori. I am not afraid to tackle difficult issues. I am intelligent, an excellent communicator and believe in open, accountable governance.
candidates.why_stand: Tairawhiti is an incredible place to live however council's projected spending, rates rises and increased debt threaten our community. We need an open and accountable council that is fiscally prudent, environmentally responsible, culturally strong and supports business development. Our council must be visionary, bold and lead our region with integrity.

candidates.name: Clive Bibby
candidates.why_elect: I understand the cultural differences and aspirations of the people who make up the populace and the economic structure necessary for this region to be self sustainable.
candidates.why_stand: I believe l have the ability and experience to make a meaningful contribution to the well being of all residents of this community.

candidates.name: Ross Chatterton
candidates.why_elect: I'm Gisborne born and raised. I know many of the issues faced by the "Common Gisbornite" first hand. I'm one of the "Have nots" who work very hard just to maintain what little we do have, and believe the decision making process shouldn't be left to the "Haves".
candidates.why_stand: I believe that to have fair representation all groups must be represented on Council. As such, we need more "Noddy Nobodies" like myself to be elected to Council.

candidates.name: Andy Cranston
candidates.why_elect: I am an experienced hardworking councillor with a history of being involved and getting things done. I am available and operate with two ears and one mouth as it is vitally important to hear all sides of our issues and fully understand them before making important decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I am fully focused to ensure Gisborne is a better place for our children and their children. I work hard to understand our opportunities and challenges and will support initiatives which will move or region forward. I will work to see our development is achieved in practical affordable ways.

candidates.name: Lizz Crawford
candidates.why_elect: I've lived and worked in our community with a diverse range of people. My experience is in the not-for-profit sector, NGOs, community development, public health, financial and governance. I've held management and governance positions. I believe in using our gifts, skills and experience to help one another.
candidates.why_stand: Tika, pono, aroha and it's constitutional. I am passionate about creating thriving communities and healthy living spaces where people are living the best life they choose in Tairawhiti. People, planet and prosperity—in that order. We've got the best place in the world, it's called home!

candidates.name: Shane Vermeulen
candidates.why_elect: Born and raised in Gizy, I think I have a good connection with people from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures. Couple that with my experiences in the building, civil, forestry and emergency industries and hopefully I can bring practicality to the table, and represents the whole region.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for council as I want to help increase the regions work and growth opportunities, establish a region that supports and promotes a better work life balance. In turn helping our locals enjoy everyday living in the Tairawhiti.

candidates.name: Courtenay Waikari
candidates.why_elect: I am born and raised in Gisborne, a mother of two hoping to make a difference for the next generation. I am of Ngati Porou/Rongowhakaata decent and my mother's family originally hails from Scotland. I have a degree in Business Studies, majoring in Enterprise Development.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Gisborne is a unique part of the world—it is laid back yet vibrant. Community is a big part of the experience of our region—it is a city unlike any other and definitely something worth fostering.

candidates.name: Amber Dunn
candidates.why_elect: By profession, I am a scientist and hold a PhD degree. Most of my postgraduate research has focussed on Gisborne and shows my commitment and deep understanding of our place. I can ensure there is evidence, and that the evidence takes us to a logical conclusion and good decisions.
candidates.why_stand: To bring a different value set and new thinking and intelligent solutions to the governance table to resolve long-standing issues and problems of our region (eg wastewater, active transport connectivity, water supply). To protect our natural beauty and assets (beaches, rivers, parks, soil, etc) and bring our culture alive.

candidates.name: Larry Foster
candidates.why_elect: I have been a Councillor for the past six years. I have one of the highest attendance rates every year and I am committed to my role. I have owned and operated with wife Leigh numerous businesses, mainly in retailing, manufacturing and accommodation. I am positive, sensible and committed.
candidates.why_stand: It is a real privilege to represent your city and region. I love this place and want to see it prosper. Enabling the growth of our economy and protecting our pristine environment while encouraging more social interaction is a priority for me.

candidates.name: Josh Wharehinga
candidates.why_elect: I've always loved Gizzy. I only ever left to go to uni. Since returning I've only ever worked to make Gizzy a better place to live. Which I am proud to say I have done, with my work in the community, council but mostly as a father.
candidates.why_stand: I'm Gizzy through and through. I have already served two terms as a district councillor, the last couple months as Deputy Mayor and I'd like to serve a third term to ensure delivery on some key projects. I'm built to serve and want to continue doing so.

candidates.name: Debbie Gregory
candidates.why_elect: I was born and bred in Gisborne and I have been a journalist here for 17 years. For the past seven and a half years, chief reporter. I have a deep knowledge of its history and a naturally inquisitive nature alongside a drive to get to the facts.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion for Tairawhiti and want to be part of the decision making process that will help enhance this place and make it somewhere my children and grandchildren want to live.

candidates.name: Murray Olsen
candidates.why_elect: I bring experience and a fresh approach, along with some new ideas. I have shown my abilities as a physicist for 30 years in three different countries. I also did a lot of manual work before university. I have experience in many things, and know how to listen.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because I believe our great town and district are not well represented by an over corporatised and under responsive council. We can do things a lot better.

candidates.name: Tania Kerr
candidates.why_elect: Experience. Knowing each community is so vital in this vast rural ward. Having lived here for 30 years, raised a family and served this community from pre-school president to board of trustees chair, from rural community board member to chairperson, now councillor with the added honour of being Deputy Mayor.
candidates.why_stand: I enjoy serving my community, helping them reach their goals, be it improved roading network and safety, or increased community resilience in time of disaster. We have more to achieve, ie Taihape Road to be funded by NZTA, security camera rollout around the district, rural halls to be earthquake proof.

candidates.name: Stuart Perry
candidates.why_elect: I have 30 years of executive management and governance experience. I've worked at high levels of councils, have been in private enterprise, have lived and worked in rural communities and understand the importance of a strong vibrant agricultural, industrial and business district. And I listen and work with people!
candidates.why_stand: Because I want to make a difference and work for the community. Council needs to be transparent and have councillors who listen to the residents. I put people first and systems second. I don't compromise on my beliefs and will speak out on issues that impact our communities.

candidates.name: Alwyn Corban
candidates.why_elect: I will bring extensive business, governance and community trustee experience to council gained from owning and managing Ngatarawa winery and vineyard at Bridge Pa and serving on a number of not for profit boards.
candidates.why_stand: I know Hawke's Bay is a beautiful place and the Hastings District is an important economic driver of the future. We have tremendous natural advantages which must be managed well for current use and enjoyment while safe-guarding the district's long term economic, productive, environmental, social and cultural value.

candidates.name: Keith Newman
candidates.why_elect: I have worked as an editor, publisher, feature writer and broadcaster and written five history books. I am a passionate community advocate, chairman Walking on Water (WOW Inc) and trustee of Cape Coast Arts and Heritage Trust. I'm interested in business, the environment, modern farming practices and local history.
candidates.why_stand: Hasting is now coming into a major growth phase. I want to be part of a visionary team that helps shape a future that lives up to the catchline 'great things grow here', develops a 'can do' culture, empowers communities and values innovation, creativity, local knowledge and common sense.

candidates.name: Ann Redstone
candidates.why_elect: I have considerable experience in business management in the construction industry and have also had experience in the horticultural sector as a grower. Our environmental well-being and biodiversity are important to me. I was the founder of the Clean Sea Coalition and WOW, lobby groups working to raise awareness.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about the beautiful Hastings District and am currently an elected representative for the Heretaunga Ward. I would love to have an opportunity to continue working on a number of current projects including housing, water, road safety and coastal protection.

candidates.name: Oliver Taylor
candidates.why_elect: As a diverse, young, dynamic and energetic person, I believe I can capably communicate with residents, iwi and businesses, while also having long lasting relationships with locals and full confidence. Living in the area since I was two, I am purely of our community.
candidates.why_stand: As a young person and a member of the LGBT+ community, I believe having a diverse range of local representatives is important especially considering the diversity in people and environment of the Heretaunga Ward. I've seen our area become a place for uniqueness, and I want to expand on that.

candidates.name: Jason Whaitiri
candidates.why_elect: I have been an active contributor to the communities in particular Clive and Whakatu. I am board of trustees at Hastings Girls High, Cape Coast Community Patrol member and also a Referee for the Hawke's Bay Rugby Referee Association. With these skills I believe I would make a good councillor.
candidates.why_stand: Standing as a candidate is a natural progression and I have formed impressive relationship and respectable reputation. My involvement has shown me a huge economic potential right across the ward within the local businesses, industrial, viticulture and tourism. I am mindful of the environment impact as well.

candidates.name: Sayeed Ahmed
candidates.why_stand: I believe Hastings has a lot of potential to improve in near future.

candidates.name: Bayden Barber
candidates.why_elect: I was born in Hastings and my heritage to the area goes back many generations. I have a wealth of experience in governance and am the chair of Health Hawke's Bay. I have enjoyed my first term on council and I work well with others to get the best outcome.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Hastings is the best place in the world to live. I want to ensure our people have good jobs and opportunities. Our want our key infrastructure operating as it should. I want our people in quality housing living in safe communities. I want Hastings to prosper!

candidates.name: Rebecca Burn
candidates.why_elect: I have been on committees and Boards of Trustees for many years and will work collaboratively to get the job done. I have a sensible, pragmatic approach to governance and look forward to continuing the growth that I see in Hastings.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we have to be the change we want to see in the world. I love living in Hastings and see it as an ideal place to raise a family. I am putting myself forward to ensure that it continues to be a safe place for my children.

candidates.name: Rion Roben
candidates.why_elect: As a member of two community committees and as a member of the board of trustees, I have proven experience in both governances and in accountability. I have experiences in management across a number of complex industries and I am currently studying a diploma in agribusiness.
candidates.why_stand: In our family, both I and my wife work full time and we know how hard it can be out there. Sitting around the council table I'll allow me to draw on these experiences and will help shape policy that will improve the lives of everyday mums and dads.

candidates.name: Geraldine Travers
candidates.why_elect: I am conscientious about ensuring I read all documentation, I think carefully about the issues and question where I am unsure. Through my previous working life I am comfortable talking to people right across society and they know that I will listen. I am guided by a strong moral compass.
candidates.why_stand: I like living in Hastings and through my working life I have gathered useful skills in governance and management. My whole life has been one of service and I want to continue to make a strong contribution to my community.

candidates.name: Eileen Lawson
candidates.why_elect: I have wealth of knowledge from my experience of working in a number of industries, including managing two successful businesses over the past 20 plus years. I have drive and passion as well as a good deal of common sense. I am positive and look for solutions and away forward.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council as I want Hastings District to be a place where families can flourish. I know the issues that many families are facing, through my past voluntary work as Chairwoman and Counsellor at the Heretaunga Womens Centre. I'm dedicated to making our community a better place.

candidates.name: Wendy Schollum
candidates.why_elect: After developing my career in Auckland, I came home to run two successful businesses, marry and raise my family. As a business owner in the technology industry, my expertise is looking to the future, anticipating and adapting to change, and harnessing that change with practical, efficient governance.
candidates.why_stand: As a Councillor, I've worked hard to bring passion and fresh ideas to the district raised and educated me. But there is still much to do. As a mum, I want Hastings to be a place where our children will want to live, work and raise their families too.

candidates.name: Gerraldine Kelly Tahere
candidates.why_elect: I have a Bachelor of Arts degree and extensive overseas experience. My leadership skills developed from management roles in business management, hospitality, education, public sector, volunteering and overseas aid work. I'm currently a member on the Hawke's Bay Health Consumers Council and and two other Health Leadership advisory groups.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing because I believe there is a lot of untapped potential for development in the community of Flaxmere and I want to change that. My focus is on improving employment pathways and training, strengthening services for the elderly, encouraging small business development, building healthy affordable homes for families.

candidates.name: Melanie Petrowski
candidates.why_elect: I believe I can be a voice for the community, as I have experienced the same issues. I have experience of being on boards including being the Vice President of Eastern Institute of Technology's (EIT) Student Association and student representative for EIT's Chaplaincy Board. I'm convener for New Conservative Party.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about Pa Harakeke/Flaxmere and the people of Hastings. I was born in Hastings and grew up in Flaxmere. It's beautiful. I'm a proud Flaxmerian. I'm passionate about our health and wellbeing, social issues and housing. We also need to address safety and security of people and property.

candidates.name: Paula Mihaka
candidates.why_elect: Over 18 years I have successfully managed Morgan Educare Centre. I have organised local clean up events and have been involved in numerous tree plantings. I am a successful property investor and provide emergency housing. I actively support minimizing food waste. I have daily personal contact with our community members.
candidates.why_stand: Flaxmere is a place of opportunity. Moving here 40 years ago I attended Flaxmere Primary, raised my daughters and bought a home. Flaxmere has also been a place of challenge, most of which are social. These can be alleviated by encouraging and developing a society of empathy for each other.

candidates.name: Matthew Bonnett
candidates.why_elect: I have the energy and the experience in governance and strategic planning to represent Ahuriri ward and our greater city with sound judgment.
candidates.why_stand: Our city needs compassionate, dynamic councillors who can focus on the core obligations of council in providing sound infrastructure, including clean and unadulterated water, parking, paths and roading, a recycling service with reliability and integrity, improved environmental management, and emergency preparedness.

candidates.name: Hayley Browne (nee Young)
candidates.why_elect: I'm a Process Engineer with a background in water systems, maintenance and risk management. I've advocated for human rights at an international level, I'll use those skills to ensure the voice of Napier is heard. I'm future focused and will push for sustainable, resilient growth of our city.
candidates.why_stand: I've fought for human rights internationally for five years and I'll to use the empathy and strength I've gained to ensure every decision at council has considered the dignity and respect of the people in our community. I want Napier to be the best place to live, work and play.

candidates.name: James Crow
candidates.why_elect: I bring strong governance and perspective to council, sitting on both a company and charitable trust board. I have rallied for issues of homelessness and housing at both council and government level. I will champion our community and ensure the sustainable and economic growth of our city.
candidates.why_stand: A lack of consistent consultation process has caused major projects to be challenged by the public. This as a clear indication council is not listening to residents. We need a council that will work to improve infrastructure like clean water before leaping into large projects like pools and tourism endeavours.

candidates.name: Keith Price
candidates.why_elect: After serving the city for four terms, I have a lot to offer in terms of both experience and future focus. It is important to me to research thoroughly and listen to all contributions in order to make informed decisions. I have a strong voice for my constituents.
candidates.why_stand: Napier is a vibrant and progressive place to live and visit. It is important to me to see the city move ahead, while ensuring that we have the fundamentals right, including and effective and sustainable infrastructure. We have an iconic identity that we need to protect.

candidates.name: Annette Brosnan
candidates.why_elect: I have been raised and am now raising my family in this Ward, I am extremely passionate about our representation. I believe my assertive, well researched and common sense contributions make a positive difference for our Ward. I've also worked in local government for 11 years and hold a Bachelor of Business Studies.
candidates.why_stand: I am running to represent us around the council table because there is work to be done, our water, consultation and environmental impact decisions need work. I love this ward and believe I can make a difference for us. I'm also excited about working with our city's new leadership.

candidates.name: Maxine Boag
candidates.why_elect: My focus in my 12 years on council has always been to tautoko the most vulnerable in our community. I have a track record of ongoing community engagement and action. With five councillors stepping down, my experience and contacts will help provide continuity in representation for the community I serve.
candidates.why_stand: To continue to serve. There is much still to do, such as retaining our public housing, cleaning up our Estuary, finding safe alternatives to chlorination, mentoring two new councillors in our ward and providing support to our new Mayor. Our growing ageing demographic deserves strong representation which I can provide.

candidates.name: Sally Crown
candidates.why_elect: I am strongly committed to listening to the people as well as learning and researching off my own bat to identify solutions to the issues they tell me are the priority. I am not adversarial. Working collaboratively with other representatives, agencies and the community is my approach.
candidates.why_stand: I want to use my skills and my voice to enable and support the communities of Nelson Park Ward and Napier to develop themselves so that they can thrive. I appreciate the grass roots connections I have with many in the ward and feel I can represent them well.

candidates.name: Will Jenkins
candidates.why_elect: I have years of experience working in our local community—this gives me a proven track record. I know how to engage with people/organisations and listen, then develop plans that work. I have good knowledge of the not for profit, mental health, arts and tertiary education sectors.
candidates.why_stand: I have been actively involved in the city for close to 17 years and have come to love and appreciate my beautiful city. I want to see the city to continue to thrive and grow. I am standing for job growth, sustainability and a sensible response to climate change.

candidates.name: Greg (Grego) Mawson
candidates.why_elect: Running a successful business for over 7 years, I have built a solid reputation for having integrity. I listen and help people every day. I love the community and the people in it and can't wait to be able to do more for my community.
candidates.why_stand: With my background in International competition and personal training, I am committed, a good listener and love to help people; qualities of a councillor.

candidates.name: Chris Stewart
candidates.why_elect: I have a broad skill set combined with university qualifications that will be of benefit in decision making and community involvement. I have a Bachelor of Engineering, and a Masters of Business, and bring skills from a wide variety of backgrounds including the military, small business, and manufacturing.
candidates.why_stand: Napier has great opportunities to raise a family. I want to serve on the council so that I can ensure that future generations can experience everything the region has to offer.

candidates.name: (Api) Apiata Tapine
candidates.why_elect: Look at our rivers, streams, estuaries, foreshore and seabed. We see degradation, depletion and conflict, we must adopt new ways of doing things if we are going to change the current direction that our environment and society are trending in. I need your support to continue to represent future needs.
candidates.why_stand: The job is unfinished—I seek the continued representation of our diverse communities. I am grateful for having served these last three years. I need your continued support to push the thinking at the council table, to ensure we are community-centred and future-focused across everything at the council.

candidates.name: Jake Brookie
candidates.why_elect: My career as an educator and business owner is based on learning, sharing what I know and listening. All of these attributes apply to councillors. I have worked with schools, community and business groups as well as government departments. I would be honoured to be your representative.
candidates.why_stand: When I was leading a school tour of our estuary a child asked me why he couldn't swim in the estuary without getting sick. In trying to explain why our estuary was polluted I realised that I could make a difference as a councillor and change things for the better.

candidates.name: Catherine Hawkins
candidates.why_elect: I have volunteered in National Politics for 8 years and sat on 2 different school boards in our ward. I have a clear understanding of the dynamics of our demographics in Taradale and I have an ability to communicate in a clear and concise way.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that I can make a difference advocating for my city and ward around the council table, I am experienced in governance and am a critical thinker. Having recently sold my Taradale based business I view this opportunity as a full time commitment and will be available to constituents.

candidates.name: Nigel Simpson
candidates.why_elect: I love what Napier offers and want to ensure Napier's prosperous future. I am experienced in local government management, at governance level. I will critically analyse reports, recommendations and question experts to ensure decision are the best for Napier. I have a Management Degree and MBA which quantify my capabilities.
candidates.why_stand: Change is necessary to ensure Napier has a positive future. I believe Napier residents deserve councillors that understand what good governance and representation is, and councillors who know how to make good robust decisions. My in-depth knowledge of local government, it's functions and responsibilities mean I can provide change leadership.

candidates.name: Graeme Taylor
candidates.why_elect: Over the past six years I have been contacted by many Taradale residents who have had a matter that has concerned them. I have worked with them to find a solution. Living and working in Taradale connects me with my community. I will represent Taradale with a strong voice.
candidates.why_stand: I would like Taradale to be the most livable suburb is Napier. A place that is safe for all, provides an excellent level of service to all residents, is vibrant, age friendly and receives its fair share of the pie from the council table.

candidates.name: Gary Wise
candidates.why_elect: Wordly but with a 'local' touch is how you would best describe me. I love my Taradale and Napier City and I believe that my wide range of skills learned from business, sports and community involvement over the last 25 years holds me in good stead for the role.
candidates.why_stand: My life skills learned in business, sport and community involvement have groomed me for being an excellent and passionate representative for the Taradale people. Energetic and progressive are words people commonly use when describing me.

candidates.affiliation: Economic Development, Accountability, Long Term Vision
candidates.name: Tim Aitken

candidates.affiliation: Supporting CHB farmers and CHB Rural Communities
candidates.name: Jerry Greer
Hirani Maaka
candidates.why_elect: The success of a Community Monster Garage Sale; Takapau Community Market; Matariki Celebrations ki Takapau and then organizing Tamatea Central Hawke's Bay Matariki 2019; joining the Takapau Connect group; establishing Takapau Heartbeat with Denise Cox—these events have happened through inspired action. I'm inspired by you.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion for our communities. I thoroughly enjoy working with empowered locals for the betterment. I believe that synergy is the key, that, council can work successfully with each community. Water and recycling along with other sustainable practices, plus nurturing positive relationships, lead to healthy communities.

candidates.name: Kate Taylor
candidates.why_elect: I am a freelance rural journalist and author. I am a Kellogg Rural Leadership graduate and on the CHB Consumers Power Trust. I have held positions throughout Young Farmers, playcentre, kindergarten, school PTA, local sports organisations and Takapau Fire Brigade. I am honest and hardworking; I do the right thing.
candidates.why_stand: I have always lived and worked rurally and I want to be a strong rural voice on council. I'm a firm believer in doing basics well to keep the district healthy and prosperous; building on the great work done by the current council, whose communication and consultation has been outstanding.

candidates.affiliation: Eyes and ears for our community on the ground!
candidates.name: Gerard Minehan
Sarah Foy
candidates.why_elect: A former journalist and communications executive, I have wide community networks and understand accountability and transparency. Bringing people together is my strength. I work for genuine consultation and to turn talk into action. I am a long-time volunteer involved in the governance of not-for-profits, as well as a mother.
candidates.why_stand: I am a fresh face with experience in governance and strategic communications, a voice for accountability and fairness. I want to see accessible communities that value people of all ages and cultures, understand housing needs, promote meaningful work and environmental sustainability. Collaboration, commitment and community are what I stand for.

candidates.name: Bruce Gatward-Cook
candidates.why_elect: As a media professional and communications specialist, I am keenly aware of the need to have a Team Taranaki approach for the four district and regional councils. This will enable us to have mutual agendas to work together to improve our region for locals as well as visitors.
candidates.why_stand: I am a community minded, service oriented person and would like to be part of the decision making process going forward to ensure we remain a lifestyle capital.

candidates.name: Deb Tawa
candidates.why_elect: With many years of business and governance experience I'll take a pragmatic approach to decision making. I have had 20 years running a small business which I think gives me the experience needed to make good solid decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing for council elections in 2019 because I'm invested in taking on issues that affect our city, and if you want to make a difference then you need to really be involved. We need to continue to invest in our region as it is an amazing place to live.

candidates.name: Bev Gibson
candidates.why_elect: I'm tangata whenua, born in Taranaki. This is my rohe (district) and I have no-where else I would want to live. The role of kaitiaki (guardian) of Ngāmotu and its constituents is important. I am a person who has a vision, who can be trusted, loads of energy, and passion.
candidates.why_stand: I believe New Plymouth can be a much more vibrant, dynamic, energetic, different and diverse city. I hope to also leave a legacy that will enable the next generation to take this city of New Plymouth to a place where we could only imagine.

candidates.name: Irene Godkin
candidates.why_elect: Building stronger connections. I've lived in Westown in early adult life. Our property was retained 36 years. My early work experiences include hospitality, rural accident insurance, Tegel Poultry process worker, retail, and later, communications call centre, aged care. My 26 year accountancy career spanned NZ and Australia. Passion+Compassion.
candidates.why_stand: Growing up in our progressive and vibrant district community in my early years, I now have the opportunity to take the lead into unchartered waters. It is my privilege and honour. Serving our community into an era of forward thinking to manage our resources and finances. Building stronger connections.

candidates.name: Richard Handley
candidates.why_elect: I have had two terms and have been Chair of both the Finance and the Audit and Risk Committees. I an business trained with an accountancy and economics degree. In business life have been a CEO of a CHE (DHB), and WITT the local polytechnic (Level One academic status).
candidates.why_stand: I want to continue my priority issues of economic development (which is so important now that offshore permits are cancelled), improved waste management as we strive towards zero waste 2040 and tourism where a renewed strategy is needed to refresh our approach.

candidates.name: Colin Bell
candidates.why_elect: From having worked at the Council I have a good understanding and knowledge of Council infrastructure such as water supply and sewage disposal. Combined with my environmentalist perspective I will provide a balance to the commercial interests which traditionally dominate around the Council table.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that the Climate Crisis is both a threat and an opportunity and that Councils throughout NZ have a duty to be proactive in reducing carbon dioxide emissions and to take many other steps to protect the environment for future citizens.

candidates.name: Stacey Hitchcock
candidates.why_elect: With over 18 years leadership and governance experience across local and national organisations, I will provide leadership with values of excellence, integrity and hard work with a passion to see our region and our people succeed. A background in youth/community development, event/venue management and strategy and business case development.
candidates.why_stand: This is a vibrant, unique and growing city that continues to build on its strengths year after year. As a Taranaki local, I want to ensure we continue to build world-class opportunities and our strategies and policies match the ambition, growth and well-being outcomes our community wants for this region.

candidates.name: Louise James
candidates.why_elect: I have a strong belief in sustainability and have represented women and children as an advocate in my paid and voluntary work.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our district needs a more diverse council. I would like to fill the mature female role.

candidates.name: Katherine Blaney
candidates.why_elect: I am a problem solver at heart with a positive attitude. I have skills from 20+ years in the workforce, including running my own business and setting up a non-profit organisation (On the House). I am a good listener and want to work with the community to create positive change.
candidates.why_stand: I would like to be part of something that is truly a collaboration to improve our district and leaves a positive legacy. I have been making small impacts on the community over the last several years and I am excited at the chance to make impact on a larger scale.

candidates.name: Joanne Kuvarji
candidates.why_elect: I have a uniquely genuine, down-to-earth leadership style and a "know who you are, be who you are philosophy" This is demonstrated in my journey as a Māori, Indian and European Mother of fourteen, Musician, Business Owner, Trustee of MCT, TGBCT, Marfell School Board, Pride Taranaki and Active Community Leader.
candidates.why_stand: Our district is one of the most welcoming and vibrant in the world, this comes from our people and I believe our council should be a reflection of our community as a whole.

candidates.name: Gordon Brown
candidates.why_elect: I have always been active in our community and have a long record of service, sa a past president of Pukekura jaycee, New Plymouth Rotary, chairman of Taranaki Safer Centre (formerly New Plymouth Rape Crisis Centre) and am currently chairman of Sport Taranaki.
candidates.why_stand: I know that New Plymouth is a district Like No Other. It needs to ensure we cater for our community in sport and recreation, while keeping council spending at prudent levels.

candidates.name: Greg Mackay
candidates.why_elect: I was born and have lived in our community for all of my life, I bring with me a wealth of experience in business and employment. It is in my beliefs that local people are involved in matters and decisions within our community.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our city is beautiful. Our parks and walkways let us enjoy the outside atmosphere with peace and quiet, I believe being able to go from the mountain to the sea in just minutes makes New Plymouth a very unique place.

candidates.name: David Bublitz
candidates.why_elect: Having been born here, moving away and then returning to bring up a family, my passion for his place is stronger than ever. My work at New Plymouth Boys High and abroad has given me excellent foundation in understanding people and how to get the best out of them.
candidates.why_stand: I believe it is the council's job to provide an environment where locals are happy and active, visitors want to return, the business community can prosper, but most importantly our tamariki feel valued and part of this great community. I am passionate about being part of this process!

candidates.name: Chris Manukonga
candidates.why_elect: I have a background as a chair and member on various committees, and I have served as a business manager, with both public and community service; delivering quality in-home elderly services, and placing people into jobs. I volunteer to entertain for rest-homes and social groups and I maintain great health.
candidates.why_stand: I was born in New Plymouth and I am the President of Grey Power who is standing as the fresh face and strong voice for the baby boomers and seniors of New Plymouth. My vision is, to accentuate the positive and enhance the beauty of our region.

candidates.name: Anneka Carlson
candidates.why_elect: I am open minded, a member of many different communities in New Plymouth and I have had a vast amount of experience in public relations and business. I have experience being part of a board, I have worked frontline as a NZ police officer and have run two successful businesses.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council as I want to give back to an amazing community and city that has shaped who I am. We have a beautiful city and I am driven to be part of making our city, an amazing place the visit and live.

candidates.name: Jonathan Marshall
candidates.why_elect: I love people, I enjoy listening and developing their ideas. I want our people to be successful in their chosen vocation and future. I work for people to become more than they hope. As a Financial Adviser I help people grow their future. I want the same for the city.
candidates.why_stand: I am long term campaigner and lobbyist to council for our communities. I have been successful at it. I believe in our people of New Plymouth and we are in the best area of the world. I volunteer myself to keep this vision alive and growing. 1-2-3 vote for me.

candidates.name: Dinnie Moeahu
candidates.why_elect: I have the leadership, experience, work ethic, dedication, team spirit and communication skills to be an effective councillor on your behalf.
candidates.why_stand: To inspire my generation to serve your generation because we're in this together.

candidates.name: Amanda Clinton-Gohdes
candidates.why_elect: I am a lawyer and a scientist, with a heart for our community. I have experience in governance, research, strategy and equity advice, property and commercial law, and the tertiary and community sectors. I am currently in my second year of learning Te Reo Māori.
candidates.why_stand: Right now we are facing the most significant environmental and economic challenges of our generation. I believe that if we have people on Council with fresh perspectives, big hearts and sharp minds, it really can make a difference—we can turn these challenges into opportunities.

candidates.name: Mike Crow
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in New Plymouth for a good percentage of my life. I believe we could do some things better to make our city the best. I would like to think I will listen to the people.
candidates.why_stand: I love New Plymouth, one can surf and ski all on the one day. Our city has beautiful beaches and a mountain which offer fishing, recreation activities and amazing scenery. The people along our walkway are always friendly and say hi.

candidates.name: Jack Newsome
candidates.why_elect: Born and bred in Taranaki, I have spent many years dairy farming. I hold a Trade Certificate in Building and a National Diploma in Real Estate, Our company name is Town and Country Realty. I have an outgoing personality and good communication skills. I have gained experience over many years.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about the city where I live. New Plymouth people are warm and friendly a natural progression of people moving to New Plymouth they retiring here, they all know each other. Our City has great facilities, parks, landscapes from the sea to the mountain. "Let's keep it a secret."

candidates.name: Harry Duynhoven
candidates.why_elect: My experience as Member of Parliament, then Mayor for New Plymouth, and now councillor, is unique. It gives me a real knowledge and insight into dealings with central government and its agencies, with other councils and our citizens. My focus is people, in my world, no one gets left behind.
candidates.why_stand: Throughout my career I've worked with people "from all walks of life" making a positive difference and "getting the job done." I was born and brought up here, I've spent my life based here; I'm absolutely committed to get the best outcomes possible for New Plymouth and its people.

candidates.name: Phil Quinney
candidates.why_elect: I bring an open mind, no hidden or preconceived agendas and 12 years of previous council experience. I have held senior positions including Chair of the Hearings Commission and believe I have the ability to offer pragmatic and empathetic service to council.
candidates.why_stand: We have been the envy of NZ for many years and I'm determined to keep us in that position. We need sensible, passionate representatives able to promote a positive image for our District not ridiculed for idiotic behaviour.

candidates.name: Dwayne Sherwood
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in NP all my life, I have experienced it as a child, teenager, poor man, a rich man, and I have found it is not equal for all. I would like to fix that, using my sports captain, NZ rep, personal trainer, business owner, loving father skills.
candidates.why_stand: I love this area, but common unity is not good, lets stop arguing and start talking. Let's keep everybody happy, by looking at everybodies side of the story and doing what is best for everyone, people, animal, and planet. Including the poor and not just the very rich.

candidates.name: Chris Hale
candidates.why_elect: I want to develop a way to be a conduit for the public and ratepayers in my ward to deal directly and honestly with council. By being able to interact with them on a regular basis and then take their comments and needs and represent them at council meetings.
candidates.why_stand: It is my desire to make a change for the better for the region and the rate payers. To establish policies for the protection of rate payer funding and to control costs blowing out with no accountability. Rate payers deserve better skill sets and results for their investment.

candidates.name: Richard Jordan
candidates.why_elect: I am down to earth, practical, realistic, with a background that brings a wealth of experience in different disciplines including local government.
candidates.why_stand: I passion and vision for our district. That is fantastic place to live and raise a family, an environment where business can flourish, a place where all people are valued, a place where the outdoors are treasured and cared for and are easily accessible.

candidates.name: Stephen Dravitzki
candidates.why_elect: I tackle issues head on, my experience from the military and as a professional Sports Coach gives me good organisational and people skills. I regard myself as a pragmatic person who sees his glass half full.
candidates.why_stand: To ensure rural voters have a rural voice in the rural community.

candidates.name: Laurie Gooch
candidates.why_elect: Most people know me after 40 years in Stratford and my waste not want not attitude, along with my frugal attitude with expenditure. Also my wide range of engineering experience up to engineering managers position, involving large expensive projects including water treatment. Keep rates at a sustainable level.
candidates.why_stand: After being away for a while I found that there's no place like home, so I returned to raise my family in Stratford. Quiet and peaceful with approachable council and excellent education, sports and youth groups systems. I want this to continue.

candidates.name: Christopher James
candidates.why_elect: I'm a son of Stratford. Since I was a young teen I have been heavily involved in our community. I've owned a business in town and served as Chairman of our Youth Council. I am committed to solving the issues my generation faces and doing my bit for Stratford.
candidates.why_stand: Stratford is my home, it's the safest most beautiful place on earth and I want to improve on that. I'm tired of Stratford being looked down on, either by central govt or pessimistic locals. Stratford has given me so much, time to give some back by being it's greatest champion.

candidates.name: Lee Alexander Hurley
candidates.why_elect: My working life was in transport from driving to management, to training. I have experience running NZ wide events over 25 years, I am Chairperson of Waimate Plains Property Society. I am a member of the Hawera RSA. I organised George's Dog day out to recognise Manaia's own hero dog.
candidates.why_stand: I was born and raised in Auckland, I live in Manaia, South Taranaki by choice, I lived all over NZ and this the best district in the country. I work with youth by running Defensive Driving courses. Manaia have a lot of youth, and lacks facilities for them.

candidates.name: Scott Willson
candidates.why_elect: I do things that benefit my community. My wife Monica and I have opened Kete Aronui Art Gallery in Opunake. I'm a member of the Lions Club and was President for the hugely successful Opunake Beach Carnival in 2019. Recently I co-created a Toddler Play Gym for under 5's.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing to bring energy, ideas and a fresh perspective to council. I can see many opportunities to make our region an even better place to be and the best way to make a difference is to get involved. I have significant experience in marketing, sports, business, and events.

candidates.name: Chris Young
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in the district for many years and have strong links with the rural community. I also have governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that this is a great district in which to raise a family and want to ensure that it remains so for future generations.

candidates.name: Racquel Cleaver
candidates.why_elect: My community involvement to date includes being a part of the current Tawhiti BOT and previously contributing to the Hawera Business Association as an Executive Member. Professionally, for the last seven years I have be working in/on my HR Consultancy business AgriPeople, bringing people solutions to farming and small-business sectors.
candidates.why_stand: South Taranaki has been a place where our family have always lived and so, this community means a lot to me and it's extremely important to me that we continue to strengthen the district so that our next generation can enjoy the same benefits we have.

candidates.name: Celine Filbee
candidates.why_elect: I have a track record of getting things done and am not afraid to say what I think or stand up for what I believe in. I am very familiar with the governance role and what is expected of me at the council table.
candidates.why_stand: I am proud to live in a district with fantastic facilities, I wish to be in a position to influence the ongoing provision of these facilities by council and facilitate new projects benefiting residents.

candidates.name: Frederick Te Rawha Kumeroa
candidates.why_elect: I've lived worked and volunteered my services to many occupations, sporting groups and education sector. The welfare and wellbeing of all people is the most important challenge for me, and I believe I can make a difference. Listening and respecting others view is most important, being honest is paramount.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our whole district has everything and excellent reasons to either visit or more so to live here. We have fantastic gardens, walkways, sporting facilities, medical facilities, job opportunities, museums, along with cultural and sporting activities. council must inject the bulk of our rates revenue back into our local businesses so they can create apprenticeship.

candidates.name: Diana Reid
candidates.why_elect: I am currently an elected member of the Hawera Community Board and have done my "apprenticeship" on the operation of local government. Through this and my job as a teacher I have an in-depth understanding of the people in our community and can represent their range of views and perspectives.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived in Hawera for 25 years and have always contributed to the community through voluntary organisations. I believe that being an elected representative on the South Taranaki District Council is another way that I can make a positive contribution.

candidates.name: Brian Rook
candidates.why_elect: I have spent the last 35 years working in Law Enforcement and have always looked for innovative ways to deal with problem issues. I want to use that experience to make this a safe and happy community. I was born and bred in Patea and know this area well.
candidates.why_stand: I have South Taranaki blood and I believe we have the best recreational opportunities than any other community. I believe that together we can make it one of the best tourist spots.

candidates.name: Adie Doyle
candidates.why_elect: I am a businessman, an investor and a registered valuer. Council accounts form a large part of each council agenda and you need to understand financial accounting to ensure the effective use of ratepayer funds.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that sound governance leads to affordable rates.

candidates.name: Jacques Windell
candidates.why_elect: My dedication fighting the lines issue shows that I am committed to ensuring a better life for our people and helping our businesses get ahead. That flows through to every decision I make, like not voting for the LGFA as it makes us liable for other councils' debt.
candidates.why_stand: I believe there has to be a mix between rich and poor in council, else too many rich councillors could vote for money to be spent on private tourism operator marketing budgets, rather than helping the poor with social housing. Balance is key! Eyes on.

candidates.name: Simon O'Neill
candidates.why_elect: My background is in policy development and implementation, with an information-focussed philosophy: the more people know, the better decisions they make. I'm used to fighting for what's important (like our rescue helicopters) and experienced working in and around government agencies and commercial interest.
candidates.why_stand: Like many of us, I wasn't born or bred in this ward, nor was it part of my plan to end up in National Park. It just happened that way. It's been good to me and local government is one way for me to give back.

candidates.name: Kahurangi Carter
candidates.why_elect: I have a passion for people and public service. I want to use my skills in a way that enriches and improves the Ruapehu district. I am level headed, an effective communicator and dedicated to our community.
candidates.why_stand: The Ruapehu District is a wonderful place to raise a family. I believe a community lead council will be stronger, more united and effective. I want to ensure healthy homes and prosperous jobs, now and for our future generations. Let's make our council look like the people it represents.

candidates.name: Gary Griffin-Chappel
candidates.why_elect: I have a strong background in community involvement currently being Chair of two community committees and siting as a committee member on another. I believe in getting involved and giving back to community. I have sound business experience and previous experience of serving on a town and district council simultaneously.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that our communities need a stronger voice on council that will hold council to task for policies that affect the social, economic and environmental impact on region. We are often promised so much, that takes too long. I will be your voice for our future.

candidates.name: Janelle Hinch
candidates.why_elect: I have experienced Ruapehu as a visitor, a seasonaire and as a full time local. I have worked in hospitality, tourism and now own a manufacturing business, exporting from Ruapehu. I understand the challenges our people face and I will be an open and sincere liaison between council and community.
candidates.why_stand: As a businesswoman and a homeowner, I recognise the importance in council's role in facilitating the lifestyle that those who live here are lucky enough to enjoy. I stand as a fresh voice for our district to ensure decisions that reflect what we want our future to look like.

candidates.name: Vivienne Hoeta
candidates.why_elect: I whakapapa to this community and district and I will continue to ensure my community have a voice.
candidates.why_stand: I want to continue to be a voice for our community at the decision making table.

candidates.name: Elizabeth (Betty) Pakai
candidates.why_elect: I have a long history in education, I have been an active trade unionist at the National level. I am a researcher, writer and speaker at National and International forums. Work easily with people a mentor and negotiator. I affiliate with Ngati Rangi and Uenuku, Irish and Indian.
candidates.why_stand: I was born and nurtured in the Waimarino-Ohakune area. I retired home to give back to the community that nurtured and informed me. Running for council is the best way of doing that.

candidates.name: Elijah Pue
candidates.why_elect: I am born and bred in the Ruapehu area and will call it home forever. I pride myself on personal values of honestly, respect and hard work. I have a wealth of experience in the public service and in central government in Wellington and bring extensive talent and skills.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing because I want to give back to our community, be a voice for the younger generation, and to make our district great to live in and raise a family.

candidates.name: Fiona (Fi) Dalgety
candidates.why_elect: An empathetic listener and pragmatic decision maker, I believe I can be the conduit for the needs of the community. I am a strategic, future focused thinker who enjoys working collaboratively. I can effectively and succinctly communicate my views. I am a committed, caring individual who was born locally.
