candidates.why_stand: Born in the Rangitikei, I am proud of my rural background and passionately advocate for thriving rural communities. I want to future proof our district by ensuring it is family friendly while offering an attractive, vibrant business environment with a fair and transparent rating system that demonstrates value.

candidates.name: Sandra Field
candidates.why_elect: I have grown up in Marton and work serving the community which gives me opportunity to meet people, this has shown me across the board the needs people have. I like to actively work to make solutions happen.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the Rangitikei is under represented Nationally, I would like to see Rangitikei established more as a tourism destination as well as an alternative to City life.

candidates.affiliation: A Stong Voice For Our Community
candidates.name: Brian Carter
Jane Dunn
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Bulls for over 35 years, my husband and I have enjoyed raising our family here. I would like to be a part of making our area a safe, vibrant place for families to work, and play.
candidates.why_stand: I feel the Southern ward of the Rangitikei district is a great place to live. To be involved in helping it to grow and prosper. With good infrastructure and facilities. While ensuring the residents get best value for the rates. As well continue helping find solutions to your concerns.

candidates.name: Bronwyn Meads
candidates.why_elect: I have many connections in the local area with citizens, groups, iwi, sports clubs, business and airforce. I've lived in this community my whole life and have a wealth of experience. I recently started working for a Charity helping disadvantaged families. I really enjoy working with communities.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for election as I believe I can serve the Southern Ward well. I have lived in Bulls all of my life, raised my children here and have many good connections. I have skills and experience to be able to represent the ward extremely well.

candidates.affiliation: For A Unified & Inclusive Southern Ward
candidates.name: Waru Panapa
candidates.why_elect: I have strong consultative and facilitations skills. I relate well to all ages and believe each person has a valuable story to tell and skills to contribute. I love Technology and have worked in schools and business as an IT Manager.
candidates.why_stand: I was born in Rātana Pā, and with its rich history I am confident that I have the skills to represent fairly not only the needs of the Pā, but all the areas in our Ward. I believe the Pā, has much to contribute to the prosperity of our Ward.

candidates.name: Raewyn Persson
candidates.why_elect: Integrity and transparency are values I bring to this role. I respect differing views, seek out appropriate information, and make sound decisions. My willingness to have difficult conversations and be decisive will assist with the challenges MDC faces.
candidates.why_stand: The Manawatu District is a great place to live. I live in the rural south of the Manawatu District which currently has little representation on council. I bring a diverse viewpoint, having been brought up on a farm here and working within the social service sector in a management role.

candidates.name: Alison Short
candidates.why_elect: Having been a councillor for several years now, I enjoy meeting with and working alongside the community to achieve the best possible outcomes. I have the time, energy, knowledge and commitment to fulfill this community role.
candidates.why_stand: I am an experienced councillor that can continue to bring much knowledge and skills to the role. A strong rural voice who is committed and capable and whose work ethic speaks for itself.

candidates.name: Stuart Campbell
candidates.why_elect: I have strong financial, risk and strategic planning experience. These are essential skills required to govern one of our Districts largest entities.
candidates.why_stand: The Manawatu is my home. I enjoy the opportunity to participate in planning for our Districts growth and future development.

candidates.name: Shane Casey
candidates.why_elect: I am born and bred in the Manawatu District. I have over 20 years of experience in the youth development sector and 6 years of local government governance experience. I bring a proven track record of positive public engagement and I get things done.
candidates.why_stand: I have a clear mandate from our community to stand for Mayor/Councilor. Having the best interests of the district is very important to me. Bring fairness and openness to the council governance table is a personal driver.

candidates.name: Amber Dodge
candidates.why_elect: Born and raised in Feilding and now raising my own family here. I am a good listener, open minded, approachable and have the ability to weigh up facts on both sides of an issue. He manu hou ahau he pi karere. I am a fledgling ready to take flight.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that Feilding is an amazing town. With the accessibility to free parking, green spaces and friendly locals. I am standing to represent the voice of those locals. To ensure the council represents what our current and future community looks like.

candidates.before_politics: I am a Real Estate Agent
candidates.name: Michael Ford
candidates.why_elect: I have been Deputy Mayor this current term. I served as a Volunteer as Chair of Feilding Promotion for over 20 years until 2016, initiating huge revitalisation of Feilding. I am a Registered Valuer and Real Estate Agent, bringing 41 years of property knowledge to the table.
candidates.why_stand: I have been working with others since the late 1980's to make Feilding the best country town and agri business centre in the world. We have gone from sad decline to impressive growth and vibrancy, and there is much to do in an affordable managed way.

candidates.name: Hilary Humphrey
candidates.why_elect: As a Chartered Member of the Institute of Directors and appointee to Local Government NZ's National Council, I bring the knowledge, skills and experience needed for local governance.
candidates.why_stand: I continue to be passionate about the Manawatu and driving positive change for our community. Over the last 3 years I have demonstrated I'm not afraid to tackle the hard issues, and have delivered a track record of successes—but there's still much I want to help achieve!

candidates.name: Neil Gibbard
candidates.why_elect: I have worked, lived and embrace life in the Tararuas for the last thirteen years. During my professional life I have gained experience in a number of areas that I believe will be valuable in this role, including project management skills, communication skills and the ability to interpret complex legislation.
candidates.why_stand: I believe in the Tararuas' and want to play a part in making it stronger, enhancing its economy and growth. We have so much untapped potential, we just need to let it out, and the most exciting thing is seeing where once harnessed that takes us.

candidates.name: Michael Francis Long
candidates.why_elect: I am a parent with 4 children all educated in Dannevirke. Our family have supported the Tararua community for over 20 years. I have held governance roles in Ruahine School BOT and Dannevirke High School BOT. I am down-to-earth and practical.
candidates.why_stand: I love living in the Tararua District, which has given our family many fond memories. I would like to represent you, the voters, in decisions being made by the council, concerning our district, in particular, decisions made around climate change.

candidates.name: Paddy Driver
candidates.why_elect: I have an in depth knowledge of how Councils and Government departments operate having worked in a number of them in management positions over the years and I believe this will have a positive impact on how I work as a Councillor.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our rural communities are special however population numbers are reducing through forest planting for carbon credits, new technology etc, therefore. I am running so I can assist in making central government more aware of the issues and to make a difference.

candidates.affiliation: A fresh young voice for the future
candidates.name: Erana Peeti-Webber

candidates.affiliation: New ideas, fresh youthful energy and genuine passion
candidates.name: Raylene Ann Treder
John Girling
candidates.why_elect: I have a wealth of experience internationally as an industrial psychologist, understanding that people are the greatest asset in any organisation but usually are the least supported and maintained. In my opinion communication is a two way exercise, listening and understanding are vital.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that Horowhenua in general and Foxton and Foxton beach in particular have tremendous potential to become one of the most attractive place to live in the country, but it needs community effort with council support and encouragement.

candidates.name: Jenny Lundie
candidates.why_elect: I am active in my community. The job of Kere Kere Ward councillor will be my full time job. I am inclusive.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we need a more community responsive council with less emphasis on population growth and more emphasis on providing for those who already live here and pay the rates.

candidates.name: Brett Russell
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Foxton beach for the past fifteen years. I have witnessed the dysfunction of a divided Council. I am a proven business leader and change agent—I have successfully turned around a badly performing global company. I want to help Council do better.
candidates.why_stand: In the recent past the Council has operated with many Councillors having no faith in our Mayor. It's time to say goodbye to the old and hello to the new; things turned around and respect and integrity restored.

candidates.name: Robert Warrington
candidates.why_elect: A farm boy, turned professional: Government service (IRD), then accountant specializing in taxation. Qualified Environment Commissioner, Muaūpoko Tribal Authority Deputy Chairman, Lake Horowhenua Advisory Trustee and Trustee elect for Lake Horowhenua Trust. Manawatu River Leaders Accord member. In my final semester at Canterbury University—I'm not ready to retire!
candidates.why_stand: I was brought up in a rural community and that rich experience has shaped and guided my entire life, except for a decade or two living in Whanganui a Tara. I want to ensure that Miranui ward residents have the best rural lifestyle on offer. The best in the world.

candidates.name: Leigh (Griffen) McMeeken
candidates.why_elect: Leigh was on numerous council committees and has been known to organise a number of community events. She enjoys meeting and talking to people and considers herself to be a "peoples person". Leigh is very much driven by her strong sense of fairness to others.
candidates.why_stand: Previously a District Councillor for a number of years, I share concern with the community over the local political discord and think that my vast political experience and objectivity will assist council getting back on track.

candidates.name: Terisa Ngobi
candidates.why_elect: I have a massive amount of experience volunteering in a wide range of communities and their initiatives, I understand what difficulties, needs and aspirations our residents have I also have proven skills in developing practical policies and solid advice on strategic direction I have compassion and passion for our community.
candidates.why_stand: I love Levin. I want to be part of the decision making that affects our tamaiki and fanau. I want to ensure all residents are living their best lives and are safe, healthy and happy.

candidates.name: Iraia Peni
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the Horowhenua 30 years, I have been involved with Horowhenua College education and sporting events at various times. Over the past 12 years I have been advocating and promoting better health delivery services that would benefit local communities both on a financial and economic platform.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing for council as I believe that councils have lost sight of their core values those being aroha, giving, integrity, honesty, support and I would like to weave and begin the journey back to our forefathers founding principles.

candidates.name: Kelly Tahiwi
candidates.why_elect: I am a descendant of iwi who have lived here for 1000 years. I am connected, I am active and I am invested in this place. My background is education, I hold various governance roles across iwi, schools, sports and community boards.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because I have a vested interest in this region and I want to make a sustainable contribution so our future generations can enjoy it for years to come. We must ensure our development is consistent with sound environmental impact practices.

candidates.name: Mike Barker
candidates.why_elect: I have been self employed in Levin for the last 32 years and am happily married with adult children. I believe in doing the best I can for my customers and family, and I would like to extend my down-to-earth approach and loyalty to the Horowhenua electorate.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the Horowhenua deserves better representation. Over the last term we have seen infighting and divisive behaviour from people more concerned with their own agendas than the people they were elected to represent. I will change that.

candidates.name: Ginny Williams
candidates.why_elect: I have a 'Blue Sky' outlook. I look at an opportunity from the position of a helicopter rather than from a ground perspective. I choose to see what can be done and what might be added to make the outcome more valuable for the community.
candidates.why_stand: Horowhenua is a great place to live, by and large. I have now retired from employment and I have time to devote to service.

candidates.name: Neville Gimblett
candidates.why_elect: With 9 years experience as an elected representative I understand the need for community and council consensus on major decisions. I can set aside my personal opinions and I have been able to advocate for projects on behalf of the community despite not personally supporting them.
candidates.why_stand: I have a range of skills including good communication, ability to understand finances, and an ability to consider the long term effects of decisions made. I can consider any decision from the perspective of what effect this will have on the community, now and in the future.

candidates.name: Alan Young
candidates.why_elect: I'm a passionate young man looking to add back to the community which has helped me so much. I'm well known within levin and wish to provide levin with a voice at the council table.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council to ensure a diverse and young population is represented and ensuring we all have someone we can approach for council matters.

candidates.name: Nina Hori Te Pa
candidates.why_elect: I am born and bred from Levin. I have worked with some of the most vulnerable people in the community and I believe together we can make a difference and minimise or manage hardship to have a thriving community.
candidates.why_stand: Help the People. I have connections to the land dating 800 years. I'm know investing in people to care and support will provide a cohesive sustainable community.

candidates.name: Sam Jennings
candidates.why_elect: I am problem solver, communicator, and relationship maker. I've been a lawyer, business owner, and a successful international consultant. I'm ready to use my education, experience, passion and my skills to serve you. I bring the right skills and experience to be a responsible and common sense councillor for you.
candidates.why_stand: I want to be on council to help shape a community that reflects your best interests, hopes and aspirations and a build place that our kids can be proud of. Our town and region has so much potential, and I want to help realise it, now and for the future.

candidates.name: Paul King
candidates.why_elect: I been involved in the political environment and the community since arriving in Levin 20 years ago. Family and friends and community, that's the Horowhenua I represent. A vote for me will bring my business and communication skills into the council.
candidates.why_stand: I am fully dedicated to the people of the Horowhenua. This is my home. I work here with my partner Eboney Taylor in our shop, Kings Sound Centre. I always look for ways to improve our community.

candidates.name: Mike Lepper
candidates.why_elect: Having worked 35 years for the Horowhenua District Council I believe I have an excellent understanding of how council's can and should work. My background in civil defence, the regulatory functions, quality systems, auditing, and financial reporting provide the skill set necessary.
candidates.why_stand: Four generations of my family are calling the Horowhenua their home. I would like to ensure they have the same or better opportunity to experience what the Horowhenua District has to offer.

candidates.name: Christine Mitchell
candidates.why_elect: I have worked closely with ratepayer groups in the Waiopehu Ward to facilitate much better communication with council. I have excellent understanding of the issues in these communities and a comprehensive knowledge of the Horowhenua District. I have excellent research and analytical skills and a good knowledge of environmental issues.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that we need a person with a rural perspective to bring balance to council debate and decisions. I am a farmer who lives on a rural lifestyle section. I also think that council needs some experience, knowledge and stability in this coming term.

candidates.name: Judy Webby
candidates.why_elect: I ran a photography business for almost three decades and was a Registered Financial Adviser for another 20 years. My experience will enable me to be an effective representative for Waiopehu, speaking fearlessly and finding common-sense solutions to problems. I am a solution thinker rather than a problem finder.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived in Horowhenua for almost all my life, I live here because I want to. I am standing because I feel the Ward has not had the commitment it deserves, and want to bring my deep knowledge of the community to the council table.

candidates.name: James Cootes
candidates.why_elect: I work well with people and have a reputation of getting things done. I have 12 years experience on council and have developed good relationships and connections. I've worked hard, I'm always available, respond to my community and ask the hard questions. Always championing Ōtaki and Te Horo!
candidates.why_stand: Ōtaki is home to my whānau. I'm proud of what I've achieved over the last three years working hard with proven results inc the $16m shared pathway and 750% increase in social investment funding for Ōtaki. Why? I do it to make a difference for the place I love!

candidates.name: Shelly Warwick
candidates.why_elect: I am honest and loyal to my community. I have done many years of voluntary work within Otaki and i value the people who live here and all that is done by amazing volunteers. I will make sure Otaki is front and centre in discussions and decisions at KCDC, GWRC.
candidates.why_stand: I am Otaki born and bred and love Otaki for the place it is but more for the people who live here. Otaki is a special place and i want to ensure communication is positive with our neighbouring councils to ensure we have great outcomes for our town.

candidates.name: Mark Benton
candidates.why_elect: I'm a realist. Sometimes to have to vote against things you want because you know we can't afford it. I'm very much for progress but at the same time we must be aware of where the money is coming from.
candidates.why_stand: I was elected for the first time at the last elections. I stood then because I believed it was part of giving back to the community. This time I am standing because I want to finish the good work the current council ha started.

candidates.name: Martin Halliday
candidates.why_elect: I have a business background of self employment, business startup and ownership tempered with alot of community activity. This has given me a good understanding of local issues and I believe I have a skill base that will be of use to my community.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that Paraparaumu is an awesome place to live and bring up a family as I just have Over the past 3-4 years I have become more and more involved in community groups and issues and due to frustrations now want to represent on council.

candidates.name: Iride McCloy
candidates.why_elect: I am aware of the continual mismanagement of projects and difficulties being experience by our residents regarding fiscal increases in all social amenities and lack of Health support. Experienced Governance and Advocacy, Former Kāpiti Mayor + NZMInstD, a JP + Kāpiti Health Consumer representative on CCDHB, KHAG,+WHAG Committees.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that Kāpiti is becoming unaffordable for many of our residents to live in their own homes with continual increases in rates and services. A major concern the report stating KCDC is dysfunctional in its culture with fiscal mismanagement being a concern—I wish to make a difference.

candidates.name: Jocelyn Prvanov
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Waikanae for 20 years, with my family. I have have a scientific and regulatory background. I have a wealth of experience, skills and knowledge so understand how our community ticks and how to achieve the best outcomes. I am an enabler and work collaboratively.
candidates.why_stand: I am very passionate about Waikanae and how wonderful it is. Waikanae needs a Ward Councillor who does not lose sight of what is best for Waikanae while having to consider the bigger picture. I have the passion, skills and knowledge to be this strong advocate.

candidates.name: Michael Ferguson Scott
candidates.why_elect: I live in and am part of our community. I maintain a business there employing local people. I bring experience, motivation and an understanding of the governance role.
candidates.why_stand: There is unfinished business for both the district and especially Waikanae—I can bring the leadership our community needs.

candidates.name: Guy P. Burns
candidates.why_elect: I'm a team player, committed to keeping costs down for ratepayers. I have a background in government and community development and have an ability to find efficiencies in organisational structures. I have keen eye regarding best practice for council combined with a strong knowledge of local government.
candidates.why_stand: My focus is on keeping costs down for ratepayers; a goal I have been actively carrying out for the last several years. Recently, I highlighted KCDC plans for borrowing money to invest in the risky financial market; this attention helped council to adopt a more prudent strategy.

candidates.name: Sophie Handford
candidates.why_elect: I was born in our community and lived there ever since. I am one of the national coordinators of the School Strike 4 Climate movement so have done a fair bit of advocacy. I would be a relentless advocate for the Ward.
candidates.why_stand: This is our home and together, we should have the opportunity to create the way it feels to live here. We must continue to build a loving community where rangatahi, our planet and all people are central to decision making.

candidates.name: Bede Laracy
candidates.why_elect: I am heavily embedded and invested in the local community, having raised family here and with four Kāpiti based businesses. I have a proven record of strong advocacy skills, and I have the required intelligence, wisdom, and patience, to work within elected government.
candidates.why_stand: I love Kāpiti and I believe I have the skills and experience to be of service to its people.

candidates.name: Anita Baker
candidates.why_elect: I am born and bred in Porirua I am known for getting things done with a good community profile. I work locally and contribute to the community in a variety of ways and forums. I am experienced in running council committees and have good strategic and financial management skills.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see improved performance from the council and transformation of Porirua into a more attractive and engaging city. We need more progress on improving our natural environment. The city is experiencing solid growth and I want to see our basic services are fit for purpose.

candidates.name: Brett Crombie
candidates.why_elect: As a Chartered Accountant I'll serve our community by running the ruler over council spend and putting forward the tough financial questions on behalf of all ratepayers and residents.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing to serve the hard-working residents of Porirua who are fed up with our council's frivolous attitude to money. With common sense and financial responsibility we can create a vibrant, sustainable, growing city which appeals to families, business owners and retirees.

candidates.name: Rabeea Inayatullah
candidates.why_elect: I am born and raised in Papakowhai and spent my primary and secondary days in Porirua. But, I truly care for our local residents and communities. I have always been genuine, authentic, transparent and teachable. I believe it is these characteristics which will make me a good elected representative.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because I want to represent the Rangatahi of Porirua and provide a platform for them at this decision making level. Also, I want to empower young woman and be a role-model for them as growing up I couldn't relate to many of my inspirations.

candidates.name: Ross Leggett
candidates.why_elect: I grew up in Porirua—4 generations of our family live here. I have a background at senior level in infrastructure management and have contributed strongly to this area during the term of the current council. There are major challenges ahead which I would like the opportunity to address.
candidates.why_stand: Porirua has a jewel in the crown—its harbour which is something we must protect, improve and enjoy more. Our diversity also makes us stronger and unique. This is something to be proud of.

candidates.name: Iain Maclean
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Pukerua Bay for 30 years and have been involved in many community groups here. I've been chair of the Residents Association for the past nine years. I have a record of leadership, influence and community advocacy, and work well with others to find lasting solutions to problems.
candidates.why_stand: Porirua's population is expected to increase by 50% in the next 25-30 years. I want to be a strong, local, independent voice in the area most affected by large residential developments. Growth will create opportunities for Porirua, but we must manage its financial, social and environmental impacts well.

candidates.name: Josh Trlin
candidates.why_elect: I'm a law and commerce graduate working at a leading law firm in Wellington. I hope to use the skills I have gained through my study and work to give back to our community. I'm proud of and passionate about this city—Porirua is, and always will be, home.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing for Porirua's Northern Ward because the issues that face our community are too urgent to wait. Far too often the most difficult problems are set aside in the too-hard basket. Issues like the climate, housing, and mental health crises need meaningful action right now.

candidates.name: Nathan Waddle
candidates.why_elect: As a committee member of the Whitby Residents Association and working full time at New World, I am in front of the people and get a great understanding of what is going on.
candidates.why_stand: As a proud Porirua resident, I want to Provide a fresh balanced voice for the people of the Northern Ward, while working with the ratepayers to better understand what they want their money spent on.

candidates.name: Beverley Anne Wakem
candidates.why_elect: The range of experience I bring to the table is immense. I've held key roles in national and international entities, and managed large enterprises. My whole career has been grounded in service to the public—it's in my DNA. I'm about social justice and fairness for all.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Porirua is rapidly rising above a previously poor image—from "P Town", to "Boomtown." We still have some way to go and I want to be part of that—revitalising the city and having it acknowledged as key player in the region.

candidates.electorate: Western/Titahi Rangituhi Porirua ki te uru
candidates.name: Mark Batten
candidates.why_elect: I believe in family first and have a very close family unit. My wife and I have seven grown children. We live in Takapuwahia and love the City. I am recognised for implementation of consultative community partnering initiatives. 9+ years working in sustainable economic development senior roles inside local government.
candidates.why_stand: My key leadership priority in standing for Council and the District Health Board in 2019 is making sure that there is a critical Council focus on community project deliverables and to work with community to understand what the consensus majority need is and that I serve to implement shared outcomes.

candidates.electorate: Western/Titahi Rangituhi Porirua ki te uru
candidates.name: Mike Duncan
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Porirua for most of my 69 years and been on council for 3 years. I believe I'm approachable and a good listener. I consider I've represented our Western Ward people effectively and our City well and would love the opportunity to do it for another 3 years.
candidates.why_stand: We're losing sight of the unity in community. In 3 years on council listening to people stressing their diversity and differences, I've seldom heard how that diversity is used for the good of all. To truly move forward we must focus more on what binds us together not what separates.

candidates.electorate: Western/Titahi Rangituhi Porirua ki te uru
candidates.name: Geoff Hayward
candidates.why_elect: I've been working hard for this community already through the Titahi Bay Beach Festival, as Secretary of the Titahi Bay Community Group, MC at the Anzac Dawn Service, and working with groups helping local kids be confident on the water, and get better access to digital technology.
candidates.why_stand: When Titahi Bay battled flooding a few years ago, my neighbours and community had my back. I'm proud to have a community that cares for each other. I'm standing for the Western Ward to make sure council backs our community too. I believe in a city that thrives for everyone.

candidates.electorate: Western/Titahi Rangituhi Porirua ki te uru
candidates.name: Jude Pointon
candidates.why_elect: As a councillor I will make a real difference. My life is centered in our city. I was born and raised here. I live and work in Titahi Bay. My children are educated locally. I have volunteered in Porirua for decades. Journalism, teaching and working overseas have broadened my worldview.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about Porirua. Our multicultural, socially-diverse city, underpinned by Ngati Toa, has great potential. However exorbitant rates, about 35% above similar cities, are forcing people out. Our infrastructure is run-down. We MUST prioritise the basics. We must meet the 'needs' of all our people before considering the 'wants'.

WARD_04402.electorate: Western/Titahi Rangituhi Porirua ki te uru

candidates.electorate: Eastern/Pāutahanui ki te uunga mai o te ra
candidates.name: Izzy Ford

candidates.electorate: Eastern/Pāutahanui ki te uunga mai o te ra
candidates.name: Moze Galo

candidates.electorate: Eastern/Pāutahanui ki te uunga mai o te ra
candidates.name: Jimmy Isaako
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Porirua for 43 years. I have been operating businesses in the community for nearly 20 years. The experience and knowledge I have gained from these 2 facts have helped me identify what improvements are required of council to assist with people's Wellbeing.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Porirua offers a comfortable environment to live and raise a family. It has everything a growing family needs but more can be done to make it even better. The regeneration project and TG will have a huge impact on this.

candidates.electorate: Eastern/Pāutahanui ki te uunga mai o te ra
candidates.name: Faafoi Seiuli

candidates.electorate: Eastern/Pāutahanui ki te uunga mai o te ra
candidates.name: Jasmine Taankink
candidates.why_elect: I'm already doing the work. For the last year I have worked alongside my neighbours in Eastern Porirua to advocate for a regeneration that will meet the needs of our people. I want to continue to this work as a councillor.
candidates.why_stand: Big changes are coming to Eastern Porirua. As a member of Housing Action Porirua I am running for council to ensure that no one is left behind in the upcoming regeneration. We need, homes we can afford, wages we can live off and communities we can thrive in.

candidates.electorate: Eastern/Pāutahanui ki te uunga mai o te ra
candidates.name: Mel Thetadig

candidates.electorate: Eastern/Pāutahanui ki te uunga mai o te ra
candidates.name: Kylie Wihapi

WARD_04403.electorate: Eastern/Pāutahanui ki te uunga mai o te ra

candidates.name: Margaret Cousins
candidates.why_elect: As a long time resident and member of a western hill's residents association and a founding member of Friends of Belmont Regional Park I have strong links to communities that make up the ward and directly understand the issues that are of day-to-day concern.
candidates.why_stand: To continue to protect my ward's communities amenity and environmental values as part of the positive contribution they make to the enhancement of our city and to continue to advocate on issues of concern eg Melling interchange, Kennedy-Good intersection which impact on the daily lives of residents.

candidates.name: Chris Milne
candidates.why_elect: I have skills which are in short supply around the council table—legal, accounting, finance, banking and practical business experience, and I've written an environmental law textbook.
candidates.why_stand: I enjoy giving back to the community, meeting people, helping address issues and making the city a better place for everyone.

candidates.name: Chris Parkin
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Lower Hutt for most of my life, the last three years in Kelson with my family. I've been Co-President of Hutt Playcentre Association, as well as on the national team. I've also been President of Rotorua Camera Club and can draw from those experiences.
candidates.why_stand: I want to serve in a council that manages the opportunities and challenges that climate change will bring to Hutt City. I also want to be part of a council that is proactive on consulting the community at the start of projects as well, as throughout the development.

candidates.name: Tui Lewis
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in our city my whole life. I'm experienced in sales and marketing. I have been on council two terms and work collaboratively within our communities to help support their aspirations. I have strong relationships with people through volunteering, organising community groups and belonging to service and sports clubs.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about our Harbour Ward and I value the diversity of culture within the Ward, our unique location and wonderful setting within our city. But, housing shortages plus climate change challenges may affect some of us and only by working together we'll better understand how to implement meaningful solutions.

candidates.name: Simon Monrad
candidates.why_elect: I'm not standing for myself but for my community. I know that change isn't going to come through legislation. So I promise to use my platform to empower where real politics happens—out in the street, in solidarity, together as people. Let's make this our city.
candidates.why_stand: The Hutt can be great to live in, but things have changed recently. Rents are high, inequality has widened, we're working hard but wages are low, and over 1,000 are homeless. I'm standing because the city is right now run for the few, not the many. We can change it.

candidates.name: Casey Diver
candidates.why_elect: I have a background in the not-for-profit sector and also the private sector in finance. I am highly educated and experienced in organising, leading, communicating and delivering community outcomes. Through my work I have developed a core belief that to serve the community is to put service above self.
candidates.why_stand: I would one day like to have a family to grow up in the Hutt City. To do that I feel that we need voices around the council table that are working for community first and foremost. That put service above self in the pursuit of community development.

candidates.name: Andy Mitchell
candidates.why_elect: I'm an active citizen who is well connected and respected in my community. I have broad governance experience across community groups, early childhood centres and schools. I'm a good listener, have empathy for others and can accurately represent the varied views and experiences of my fellow residents.
candidates.why_stand: I love Lower Hutt but I'm running for change in council because I feel that communities should be empowered to determine their own future, not have it delivered by council. I want our city to protect and promote its rich diversity and natural beauty, and the wellbeing of all residents.

candidates.name: Keri Brown
candidates.why_elect: I'm ready for council. I've got the right mix of experience working in the public sector in advisory and senior policy roles, and community where I've rolled up my sleeves and got work done. I've made progress for Wainuiomata for seniors, housing and waste but would love to do more.
candidates.why_stand: Wainuiomata is home, a place to call home. It's an exciting time, with multiple developments, but this opportunity isn't without risk. As we embrace the new, it's important we hold onto the things that make Wainuiomata special, to the spirit and values we all share.

candidates.name: Anania Randall
candidates.why_elect: I'm a long standing Wainuiomata resident with governance and business experience, positive energy, diversity, mana , committed to our community. I have served on many boards locally. My previous work with the community in wainuiomata and my whakapapa gives me the ability to connect with a wide range of people.
candidates.why_stand: Wainuiomata is a special community. I believe I can make a difference on council for our suburb and the city. I am an active advocate for Wainuiomata and our people here. I get things done. Improvements in family well being, housing, health services and education are my priorities.

candidates.name: Malcolm Sparrow
candidates.why_elect: I have been very much involved in community life for the past 15 years, including six years as councillor. I liaise closely with local councillors and residents to get things done. As a 'moderate' independent who strives for balance, I believe I bring common sense and sound decision-making to council.
candidates.why_stand: My desire is to serve my community, the ward I represent, as best I possibly can. On a wider level I wish to play my part in ensuring that Wellington, one of "the world's most liveable cities", continues to be a great place to live.

candidates.name: John Peters
candidates.why_elect: I have lived and worked in this community in all capacity from night fill assistant to property developer.
candidates.why_stand: Time to give back to the community which has given me so much.

candidates.name: Tracy Hurst-Porter
candidates.why_elect: I have taken an active interest in council process over the years. I have seen the impact of both good and bad decisions first hand while working in the community for over 30 years. I would be a good elected representative because I come from the community.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council and Hutt Mana Charitable Trust because I care about the impact local government and funders' decisions make on the lives of people in my community. I want to be part of the decision making process to represent your views at the table.

candidates.affiliation: Political Parties have NO PLACE in Local Government
candidates.name: Graeme Sawyer
candidates.why_elect: Customer focus is #1. Incumbents are positively bad at representing my community well at WCC; rather than being vacuous followers of a misguided mayor, I have passion, ideas and serious technical capability from career as policy analyst (environment, water, waste, labour) plus serious credibility from years leading Johnsonville's Residents Association.
candidates.why_stand: As an outspoken community advocate of long-standing I have proven experience interfacing between my community and often idiotic policies of WCC. With technical expertise in 3 Waters, waste and planning I'll prioritise infrastructural deficit that is crushing Northern communities amid badly planned urban intensification that damages our suburbia unnecessarily.

candidates.name: Jill Day
candidates.why_elect: I've lived and worked as a teacher in the northern suburbs for most of my life. I value diversity, community participation and working collaboratively with people to support their aspirations. It's been an honour to serve the Northern Ward for the past three years as City Councillor and Deputy Mayor.
candidates.why_stand: I love living in the northern suburbs and want to continue to make our community a great place for everyone. By re-electing me as your councillor, I will continue to work to make our city a vibrant, enjoyable and safe place for everyone.

candidates.name: John Apanowicz
candidates.why_elect: I graduated from Victoria University with degrees in economics, commerce and administration. I work locally running a successful consultancy firm specialising in finance and corporate governance. I'm also a Chartered Accountant, a Chartered Member of the Institute of Directors, and work across many diverse entities. I have experience.
candidates.why_stand: I'm a Wellingtonian, born and educated here, and I'm proud to call the northern suburbs my home. Our community needs a local champion with a strong voice. We desperately need competent, experienced people on our Council who can make the hard decisions. That is why I am standing for Council.

candidates.name: Jenny Condie
candidates.why_elect: We need a mayor with the skills to future proof Wellington. I have a PhD in accounting and entrepreneurship. I worked at The Treasury and taught at Victoria University. I'm on the boards of Tawa School and Maanaki Montessori Education Trust. I'm a member of the Institute of Directors.
candidates.why_stand: 2100 is not science fiction—my boys will be in their 80s. I'm standing for mayor to future proof Wellington so that our kids will have a fair chance to succeed as they grow up. I'm determined to deliver climate action for Wellington, not just promises.

candidates.name: Peter Gilberd
candidates.why_elect: I have strong links with the community. My career in science shapes my approach to gathering evidence and making decisions, and I take a calm and considered approach. I work closely with my fellow Ward councillors and have constructive relationships with elected representatives across the city and the Wellington region.
candidates.why_stand: I am a born and bred Wellingtonian with a commitment to my community. I would like people to have the opportunities that I have enjoyed, and will work hard for an inclusive society in which all people flourish. I love nature, and will do my best to protect it.

candidates.name: Richard McIntosh
candidates.why_elect: Representing Onslow-Western in the era of climate change will take creativity, compassion, fearlessness and life experience. I can supply these: business owner, civil celebrant, union delegate, parent of two. I've studied NZ history, sailed the Pacific, lived overseas and learnt Māori. I'm proud to stand for council out west.
candidates.why_stand: In my view people living in Onslow-Western haven't had the option of supporting creative, caring, green, future-focused policies to grow Wellington. That's why I stood for council out west. I believe all individuals, families, and communities in our city need opportunities to live, contribute, and prosper.

candidates.name: Ray Chung
candidates.why_elect: I've been selling NZ's products and services internationally for over two decades and always assess the business viability and the social impact of decisions that I made. I believe that council wastes too much ratepayers money on ill-conceived things that offer little value to most of us.
candidates.why_stand: I was born and grew up here in Wellington and even though I've worked and lived in many other countries, it's home to me and I want to make it the very best place that it can be. The cost of living here needs to be more affordable.

candidates.name: Simon Woolf
candidates.why_elect: I have an enquiring mind. I like to work in a cohesive and collaborative manner. I am not afraid to make difficult decisions, and stand up! I am tremendously community minded, am a good listener, who is able to mediate most issues successfully.
candidates.why_stand: I have extensive governance, business and organisational experience. Wellington needs a diversity of experience on Council. I bring that to the table in truckloads. Wellington is a great city of immense potential. I know I can aid and assist much of that potential being realised.

candidates.name: Michelle Rush
candidates.why_elect: Service to the community is core: I'm currently Chair of Onslow College Board. I'll bring to council governance experience plus a unique skill set: a 25-year career working as a facilitator with groups dealing with complex issues—many about planning and resource use. Skills WCC needs at the table.
candidates.why_stand: I am a mother, wife, business owner and long-time Ngaio resident. I am passionate about Wellington and its future. I am inspired by the energy and foresight in our young people. I want to help make this city a great place to live and work in for our future generations. .

candidates.name: Andy Foster
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Wellington most of my life. I'm deeply involved in our community and have an extensive track record of getting things done. I will fight for what is right even when the going is tough. I know how council/the city work, I have a clear integrated vision.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing for Mayor because I believe our beautiful city has lost its way under current leadership. We need clearer vision, restoration of a sense of energy and pride, a focus on the things that matter, and willingness to engage with the community.

candidates.name: Diane Calvert
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in and raised my family in my local community for the past 19 years. After over 25 years in senior leadership roles and acting for my community, I have the proven governance experience, skills and pragmatism to continue to serve you as your local representative.
candidates.why_stand: After 3 years as a city councillor, I have improved how the Council engages and advocated strongly for you on local issues. There is much more to do and I would like the chance to continue to build on what I have achieved to date.

candidates.name: Rebecca Matthews
candidates.why_elect: I've helped lead community campaigns—to increase paid parental leave for young families, and to make Wellington City Council a living wage employer. I know how to work together with others to achieve change. I'll be a councillor who gets things done.
candidates.why_stand: I want to be a new progressive voice for fairness in our ward. I'm a renter with a young family who understands the issues people in our community face. I don't drive and rely on public transport—I'm determined to be part of a people-focussed solution.

candidates.name: Rohan Biggs
candidates.why_elect: I have degrees in both public policy and accounting and have made a career helping senior leadership teams work out how to deliver their strategies without breaking the bank. I translate financial issues for non-accountants and frame the choices and trade-offs they face. These skills are missing from the Council.
candidates.why_stand: This year's rates increase is the lowest you'll get for ten years if the incumbents are voted back in. Based on current plans and known financial issues, the Council needs to almost double its operating budget and exhaust its debt capacity within ten years. The Council lacks financial discipline.

candidates.name: Conor Hill
candidates.why_elect: I work well with a wide range of people, and I know I can make more of a difference than many of the people on the current council. I am young enough to have the energy required for the job.
candidates.why_stand: I love Wellington and want it to be the best city in the world. I'm running because there is a housing crisis Wellington, our transport system is broken and because climate change is real. Our leaders are not moving fast enough to fix the issues facing Wellington.

candidates.name: Harry Smith
candidates.why_elect: I am an experienced student of public policy, and bring this to the fore as the only candidate in the Lambton Ward who offers a comprehensive policy manifesto with included costings. You know exactly what I will advocate for unlike any other candidate.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for election because Wellingtonians deserve better than mere value statements, they deserve genuine and thorough policy proposals and need a council with a true mandate to act in the interest of residents. We share a wonderful city, yet our elected representatives so often let us down.

candidates.name: Tamatha Paul
candidates.why_elect: I'm bringing the kind of future facing leadership our city council needs, with progressive ideas and policy to back it up. I'm able to not engage with my generation as a young person, but I also have a track record of working with people from all over in Wellington.
candidates.why_stand: Wellington is a city that is ready for the future, and I'm running to make sure that this is reflected on a city council with planet and people at its heart.

candidates.affiliation: Your interests are my interests - Ngati Porou - Independent
candidates.name: Lee Orchard
candidates.why_elect: I'll act with honesty, integrity, transparency, and with your interests at the forefront of all that I do. I have experience working in government, I have a wide range of interests, which see me involved in the community, and because your interests are my interests.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running because I want to make a difference for my community, alongside my community.

candidates.name: Iona Pannett
candidates.why_elect: I was raised in Pukehīnau Lambton and love this area and want to continue to represent it. I am an infrastructure and policy leader, a passionate advocate for the city, a skilled communicator, an experienced governor, a hard worker and I get things done!
candidates.why_stand: Wellington is thriving but there are significant challenges to meet in terms of climate change and earthquakes. We will need to be hopeful and ambitious in meeting these challenges. With iwi, business, community groups all in partnership with council, we will be able to meet these challenges.

candidates.name: Nicola Young
candidates.why_elect: I'm an independent, liberal councillor who works across the political spectrum to champion projects and issues that deliver value for Wellingtonians. I've had decades of commercial experience in Wellington and London; I'm consistent, clear, decisive and love getting things done!
candidates.why_stand: I'm a strong voice for affordable rates, core services delivered well, and common sense when making vital decisions around Let's Get Wellington Moving and Civic Square. I was born and raised in Wellington, but I live here by choice and want the best for my city.

candidates.name: Brian Dawson
candidates.why_elect: I've spent more than 25 years working with communities focused on positive change. I believe Wellington is a fantastic and fair minded city. We can be both the coolest and fairest little capital in the world. That's at the heart of why I'm here.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we have made significant progress in the social and housing areas over the past three years and I want to see that work through.

candidates.name: Shan Ng
candidates.why_elect: For vital conversations to mature and be inclusive, our representatives must reflect the diverse people that we serve. Being an Asian, middle-aged mum with background in commercial, legal and procurement across public and private companies equipped me to speak and act on a wide-ranging decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that our political representation should be every bit as diverse as our society. This is why I choose to put myself forward to serve as your elected representative; to effectively represent those who may feel that they may not have enjoyed effective representation in the past.

candidates.name: Chris Calvi-Freeman
candidates.why_elect: Wellington is in my blood—I was born here and have lived in the eastern suburbs for most of my life. I have extensive international experience in transport planning, coupled with a practical, no-nonsense communication style and a genuine desire to improve the city.
candidates.why_stand: Wellington is a great place to live and work but faces significant economic and environmental challenges including increasing traffic congestion and a dysfunctional bus service. I believe it's essential that progress is made to resolve these issues in the next 1-3 years.

candidates.name: Teri O'Neill
candidates.why_elect: I'm a renter, I sit at the age of 21,LGBT and a huge supporter for my family. I'm looking toward the future, and we need someone to get things done. I work supporting those with mental health issues and currently advise on transport, govt mental health policy, and environmental policy.
candidates.why_stand: I grew up in my ward, reliant on this councils services but never saw representation at my door. People that govern our everyday lives should represent our experiences. I love my ward in the East, though we can do better having someone with community compassion at the table.

candidates.name: Ajay Rathod
candidates.why_elect: Despite this being a problem since the 1930s, no one has ever done anything about the constraints. How many years has argument been going on, and things have just got worse. How about some leadership and lets get it done.
candidates.why_stand: The wait is over for me and i want to make change to this city "Let's do this."

candidates.name: Bernard O'Shaughnessy
candidates.why_elect: Lived across all Wards for 50 years mainly in Southern and Eastern Wards. 25 years in Education, Justice DSIR/MAF gave me overview of city and NZ. 10 years Primary school teaching gives insight into communities. I have been engaged with local body issues for 15 years with successes.
candidates.why_stand: Our city is the coolest but we have to progress it. Let's do better to celebrate our music, our food, of cultural diversity. We need excitement as councillors and welcome tourists more.

candidates.name: Steph Edlin
candidates.why_elect: I'm a third generation Miramarian, with real experience in our city from working, going to school, and making the most of Wellington. I have leadership experience from my role as Head Prefect at St Catherine's College, and I have a good grip on the needs of my community.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running because I love this city and I believe Wellington's diversity needs to be represented on the city council. I'm a third generation Miramarian, and I believe that the Eastern Suburbs bring a lot more value to Wellington than the City Council seems to recognise.

candidates.name: Sarah Free
candidates.why_elect: An engineering degree and Masters in Public Health equip me to see the big picture and to analyse and assess options, while experience as a teacher, energy advisor and six years on Council provide insights into issues facing residents and businesses. I'm good at finding solutions and seeing projects through.
candidates.why_stand: I've lived in Wellington most of my life and seen it become a vibrant, exciting place. However, there are resilience and climate challenges. I've worked collaboratively for good results- cycleways, walkways and other infrastructure. I want to continue as a Councillor to make Wellington a livable city for the future.

candidates.name: Sean Rush
candidates.why_elect: I have been involved in major infrastructure projects around the world—including light rail and tunnels. I can add some rigour and common sense.
candidates.why_stand: I am worried that our city is becoming divided. I hope to bring some old fashioned values and uniting spirit.

candidates.name: Humphrey Hanley
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in the Southern Ward my entire life, and know first hand the difficulties faced by our many diverse communities. I have a strong voice and want to use that to help make sure that these issues are represented.
candidates.why_stand: I want to make Wellington accessible for everyone to enjoy! Whether disabled, suffering an injury, or just fortunate enough to live long enough to have age related mobility issues, we all need to be able to access and enjoy everything the city has to offer.

candidates.name: Laurie Foon
candidates.why_elect: I've proud to have raised my family for the last 20 years in this diverse vibrant community. I've helped build a values-driven business movement, first with my ethical clothing label Starfish, and then with the Sustainable Business Network. My strengths are connecting people and developing creative solutions together.
candidates.why_stand: I have two daughters who are strong advocates for the environment. Their passion and resolve were what inspired me to stand for council. If I'm in a position to make a change then I should do it—not just for my family but for my community and our future.

candidates.name: Fleur Fitzsimons
candidates.why_elect: I have been politically active my whole adult life and always look to focus on how to ensure better and fairer outcomes for people. I was involved in campaigns against user pays education, for paid parental leave and more recently as a union lawyer.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing because I love Wellington and want it to be the best city in the world for children to grow up in and the most inclusive, progressive city in the world.

candidates.name: Thomas Morgan
candidates.why_elect: Global thinker yet realistically focused; Legalistic; Managerial; Determined; Communicative; Team player; Effective; Representational; Inherently local.
candidates.why_stand: It's an old habit and despite having spent 25 years looking into the area the votes are yet to arrive. I know too much about the reality and refuse to buy into the irrelevant electioneering non-sense that seems to keep people happy.

candidates.name: Alistair Plimmer
candidates.why_elect: I believe in investing in modern facilities and opportunities for all our residents, equitably, across our district.  My experience in a range of community organisations, focused on the wellbeing of others includes 6 years as Chair, Greytown School Board, President of the Greytown RSA and  Branch Manager Oldfields Wairarapa Ltd.
candidates.why_stand: I am a local Greytown resident, and see a need for a voice on council that represents our young people, families and our changing demographic: a voice that shows an understanding of the development challenges facing us as we grow, while respecting our rich history and loyal older generations.

candidates.name: Warren Woodgyer
candidates.why_elect: I am a good listener, can see both sides of an argument. I have 25 years of experience in the field of soil water management as Director of the Massey University Drainage Extension Service, in the Department of Soil Science. Farmed for 30 years strong affinity with rural ratepayers.
candidates.why_stand: I aim to invigorate the Greytown Community Board. I believe the community board should have financial control of rates collected in Greytown and spent on issues decided by the Greytown people. The SWDC would become a service centre only. I believe that Greytown ratepayers are not getting value for money.

candidates.name: Daphne Geisler
candidates.why_elect: I will focus on building trust by influencing sound decisions based on effective processes and will be responsive to community views and insist on sound financial management. I have proven analytical, financial, strategic and presentation skills and understand the responsibilities of Councillor. I have the time and attitude to succeed.
candidates.why_stand: I am lucky to have lived in the Wairarapa for 20 years. I'm continuously inspired by local innovative and creative small businesses, the productive rural land, green hills, rugged coastline, caring community and diverse environment. I will work to protect it and improve how the Council delivers services.

candidates.name: Kaya Blown
candidates.why_elect: I work as Operations Manager of a small seafood factory processing cockles. What I do basically is organise everything so it works together for the whole teams success. I'd love a chance to do this for the region I call home.
candidates.why_stand: I love Golden Bay and I have been unhappy with how our council has implemented some policies in our area. There seems to be a real lack of caring of how these policies affect the people the council represents, so I decided to do something about it.

candidates.name: Celia Butler
candidates.why_elect: As a home visiting health professional I have got to know a broad cross section of the community, especially families and the practical challenges such as roading of more remote areas. I am a small business owner, have national and local governance experience and am involved in conservation work.
candidates.why_stand: Because Golden Bay needs a councillor who will listen to all sectors of the community, build relationships, understand the issues and act through the council process to get solutions.

candidates.name: Reg Turner
candidates.why_elect: Having the history of my professional and political history to date and living in Golden Bay for 12 years, witnessing the loss of power and control of our community by the bureaucracy, I wish to restore the control of our future with your support.
candidates.why_stand: Having travelled the world and experienced many careers from RAF officer to flying instructor, to tourist pioneer in the hospitality industry, I have settled in Golden Bay which is God's gift to NZ and I wish to keep it that way.

candidates.name: Richard Johns
candidates.why_elect: I have an logical ability in problem solving to match my inquisitive nature and ability to understand and create common sense solutions.
candidates.why_stand: I have found serious deficiency in staff competence and the unbalanced rating system that is forcing people out of their homes.

candidates.name: Dean McNamara
candidates.why_elect: I have many generations of working class history in Tasman. I would like to see us return to the "good old days" when anyone prepared to work hard could make a go of it. My background in running my own businesses gives me good understanding of how every dollar counts.
candidates.why_stand: I think Tasman is terrific! And everyone wants to live here. But, unfortunately, the Tasman lifestyle is out of most people's budgets. Wages are too low and the cost of living is too high for most young families and retirees. You deserve better representation to address the inequality in Tasman.

candidates.name: Don Everitt
candidates.why_elect: I have a business background and a degree in economics and marketing. I have been involved in local and corporate businesses for 30 years at an international level and assisting local companies grow. For more than 10 years I have been volunteering and leading the Fifeshire Foundation. I am independent.
candidates.why_stand: My wife and I chose to live here thirty years ago when we were in a lucky position to choose almost anywhere in the world. We returned to a beautiful region in the country in which we grew up. It's time to give back and pay forward.

candidates.name: Hayden Stevenson
candidates.why_elect: I have been self employed for 18 years in various roles. I am a employer so understand the risks of business. I have a degree in Commerce with a double major in Management and Market plus a degree in Theology. I have lead the Wakefield Youth Group for 5+ years.
candidates.why_stand: I am running as I feel I have the skills needed to make strong logical decisions and understanding the wider implication of these decisions on ratepayers and our current debt levels. I am concerned at the potential cost of a financial blow of the dam and the impact.

candidates.name: Christeen Mackenzie
candidates.why_elect: I have experience in financial and business management and governance after a 25 year in central government. I have been the Chief Financial Officer of a $500m pa organisation and have a proven track record of performance. I can bring this to the council table.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for the Tasman District Council because I believe I have the relevant skills and experience, and connection to the community to provide the critical thinking and input to council decisions. I also have the time, passion and commitment to carry out the role.

candidates.name: Anne Turley
candidates.why_elect: My council experience and knowledge of issues, having worked at Nelson Hospital and as a Specialist District Nurse in Tasman. I am committed to improving your well-being by advocating for your needs, finding affordable solutions and caring for our infrastructure and environment to provide a good lifestyle for everyone.
candidates.why_stand: Because I believe Tasman deserves better outcomes. By working together with our communities we can ensure we find the best solutions to achieve this for the future.

candidates.name: Julie Nevin
candidates.why_elect: As a graduate in psychology, education and (almost!) environmental studies with social policy, I bring a wealth of understanding of change—the complex changes we are facing and how we respond to them. I am a planner and holistic systems-thinker by nature, a former teacher, creative, empathetic and curious.
candidates.why_stand: I have two small children and I feel strongly that they deserve more of an environmental legacy than we are leaving them. Council has a critical role to play in our response to environmental issues. I am offering to be a strong environmental voice in the Tasman District Council chamber.

candidates.name: Paul Dixon-Didier
candidates.why_elect: I will get results for the community. I have a strong leadership and management background in both public and private sectors and I am highly motivated to give back to this amazing region which has provided me and my family with such a great quality of life.
candidates.why_stand: I can make a positive difference for the people and businesses of the Tasman region by applying a pragmatic approach to conservation and sustainability issues, I have a strong social and moral conscience, good financial literacy and I have vast experience in public entity corporate governance roles.

candidates.name: David Ogilvie
candidates.why_elect: I've lived locally for more than 50 years. My local body experience is extensive and in different roles. I have strong connections within our community through family and friends and involvement in local groups. I was awarded Member of the NZ Order of Merit in 2005 for community services.
candidates.why_stand: I enjoy the involvement in the community, the challenges and the commitment that local body services and community activities require. There are always new issues and concerns arising, at various levels of importance. Improving the lifestyle of the district is important to me.

candidates.name: Claire Hutt
candidates.why_elect: Living in Motueka for 18 years and having been a committee member on over 20 organisations I have the skills, compassion and governance to be a leader for our community around the council table.
candidates.why_stand: A New Energy... Being an effective advocate for our ward is a role I am already embracing, I now want to be officially at the table to make your vote count.

candidates.name: Barry Dowler
candidates.why_elect: I previously held positions of Deputy Chair Engineering Services and Deputy Chair Regional Land Transport Committee, Joint Waste Management Committee and other roles on council. I have the experience to help the area to move forward. I am also a current RMA Commissioner. Also on several local Committees.
candidates.why_stand: Motueka is an important town within the Tasman District. I believe I can make sound decisions to help progress both Motueka and the Tasman District. Having nine years of previous experience as a councillor and also a Motueka Community Board member I feel I still have a lot to give.

candidates.name: Mark Greening
candidates.why_elect: I bring integrity and sensible decision making and provide an honest, friendly and approachable manner. I have no pet projects or hidden spending agenda, other than ensuring that Tasman is an affordable place to live, work and play.
candidates.why_stand: I continue to fight for honest ethical decision making. Ensuring Tasman is an affordable place to live, work and play. And that council listens to what you have to say, and does something about it. Let me continue to speak up for you.

candidates.name: Gary Watson
candidates.why_elect: My wife and I have lived in the region for over 40 years, we operate 5 companies that are all debt free so I have the skills and experience to provide a major contribution to our region.
candidates.why_stand: I believe there is to much unnecessary red tape that is affecting our whole community and keeping rate increases and debt to high.

candidates.name: Peter Lynch
candidates.why_elect: I have both NZ wide and international personal and business experience, having travelled in 60 countries and worked in six. I subscribe to newsletters from National, Labour, Greens, and NZ First, with an open mind interest in NZ/world politics, but its local government for me—a good elected Councillor.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for TDC Councillor, because I am ready willing and very able now in my life, to make an excellent contribution of good combined governance as a young person, with considerable experience, a wise head, and I am not driving specific personal agendas to divide the Council.

candidates.name: Dana Wensley
candidates.why_elect: I have worked hard for the last three years for this community as Deputy Chair of Community Development. I love this region and am committed to the people who live here. I will drive strategic change for the benefit of Richmond and bring the community voice to council.
candidates.why_stand: I want to make a positive difference. Everything we do at Council affects the people who live here, whether it be water quality, road safety, air quality, urban design, or environmental management. Every decision I make comes from talking to the community to bring their voice to the Council table.

candidates.name: Kit Maling
candidates.why_elect: My family moved to Richmond in 1960s. My wife and I returned to Richmond 21 years ago after serving in NZ Police for 24 years to a senior level. I have a very good understanding of both central and local government processes to enable projects to be completed.
candidates.why_stand: I passionately believe in the potential of our district and want to make a positive and proactive contribution to the people of Richmond and our district.

candidates.name: Stan Holland
candidates.why_elect: I have developed a lot of skills in different roles through my career to date that will allow me to view the big picture and make sound decisions. As the current chair of Tahuna Beach Camp, I have successfully lead the board in addressing governance and management issues.
candidates.why_stand: I love this region and want to bring a voice of reason and logic with sound decision making through looking at the big picture to the Council.

candidates.name: Rebecca Woledge
candidates.why_elect: I have strong connections to the community. My family has been in the Picton/Marlborough Sounds area since 1855. I attended school in Picton before attending University in Christchurch. I then returned to raise my family here. I have extensive experience with a variety of community organisations.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about the wider Picton and Marlborough Sounds Communities. I believe we live in an iconic environment. As I am younger, I will bring diversity as well as the wider views of the community to the Council decision-making process.

candidates.name: Barbara Faulls
candidates.why_elect: Having grown up on a farm and as a long term resident of the Marlborough Sounds I believe that I have a good knowledge of the local issues. I have had considerable governance experience and can make decisions based on the well being of all. I am committed and motivated.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that there is huge potential to continue to improve Marlborough's lifestyle for the benefit of all residents. I am proud of all that has been achieved and of our international reputation. We have a destination that is world class and must be protected.

candidates.name: Jane Briggs
candidates.why_elect: I am been a business owner and employer in Picton CBD for 15 years and am well known in the local community. I have volunteered in many roles helping with school, sports clubs and organising social events. I am past president of Picton Early Learning Centre and Picton Little Theatre.
candidates.why_stand: I love the natural, diverse beauty of Marlborough and I feel privileged to have worked, lived in and reared my children in such a great community. I would like to see sustainable future and growth that balances the needs of the business community with the needs of the residents.

candidates.name: Carmen Gimpl
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Picton since 2001 and raised my daughter here. I was a senior manager at the Port for 14 years and gained valuable insight into the issues facing the industries of the Sounds Ward and the aspirations of our local community. I believe we can prosper sustainably.
candidates.why_stand: I want to make a positive contribution to the community and see our economy thrive while we ensure the environment is protected for future generations.

candidates.name: Francis Maher
candidates.why_elect: I've built a reputation for practical, hands on, down-to-earth leadership. I believe in working with people to find practical solutions to often conflicting needs and demands. I have previously demonstrated my ability to effectively represent the people of the Wairau-Awatere ward.
candidates.why_stand: I believe in a sustainable social and economic future for all residents. I have the practical—get things done experience need to be an effective representative balancing social, environmental and economic considerations. I have a life long commitment to improving all parts of our district.

candidates.name: Sally Arbuckle
candidates.why_elect: I have a broad understanding of how Marlborough works. I am a good listener and will take your issues to Council for resolution.
candidates.why_stand: I am a Marlborough girl, I grew up in Picton then moved to Blenheim and now reside in Renwick. I have been evolved in the community as my four children have grown up and I would like to have a voice for the changes required for our sustainable future.

candidates.name: Philip Vink
candidates.why_elect: Many years of business experience as a financial manager, employer as a commercial owner/operator. Strong communication, listening, negotiating, analytical and planning skills.
candidates.why_stand: I have always been interested in our community and how it operates at the higher level. This is an opportunity to go to that level and engage positively with our people and the managing body of our district to get the most out of our region.

candidates.name: Mark Peters
candidates.why_elect: My grandfather came here 125 years ago, I was born here and have always enjoyed living here. I want to give back to Marlborough so that present and future generations also enjoy living here. Facilities are nice to have but people and their well-being are our future.
candidates.why_stand: To use my many years of financial governance experience for the benefit of all Marlborough people. This is an amazing region and we must make sure we provide the facilities with appropriate affordability to ensure all who live here are happy and proud of Marlborough and their part in it.

candidates.name: Gerry Roodakker
candidates.why_elect: I have lived here for 19 years and never get tired of our beautiful surroundings and the people that make up community. I a strong business background and have good leadership experience and feel I could contribute positively to the position of councillor.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for council to repay Marlborough for the support I have had with my two housewash and water blasting businesses both domestic and commercial. I have a passion for our beautiful district and want to be involved in looking after our assets.

candidates.name: Matt Flight
candidates.why_elect: With the skill of being on several school and sporting boards I learnt several keys elements that will help our community. This is also backed up by being a very hands on front line person. With skills in most trades as a contract manager for a very large housing group.
candidates.why_stand: I enjoy helping and giving, I have have been and still on sporting committees, school boards and coaching. In 20 minutes you can be on the beach in the sounds or drinking Pinot with a friend in a vineyard, and I for one would like to help keep it that way.

candidates.name: Jamie Arbuckle
candidates.why_elect: I have nine years experience across every facet of Council as a constructive member on a range of committees. I am accessible and believe constituents should be treated equally, listened to and valued. I will be your voice around the Council table.
candidates.why_stand: It is time for decisive action on key issues from climate change, infrastructure, the Bypass and affordability of rates. I will work with Councillors to implement meaningful policy before it is too late.

candidates.name: Meg Martin
candidates.why_elect: I stand for the hardworking people who are the heart of our region. I want to be a younger, fresher, and more positive voice for the people working for transparency and prudent management of Council resources. I've always been engaged with the community and now can do more.
candidates.why_stand: Marlborough is my adopted home of 10 years and I want to contribute in a positive and productive way to the region. I'm incredibly proud of Marlborough and I'm prepared to put in the work to make it the best it can be.

candidates.name: Michael Fitzpatrick
