candidates.why_elect: I come from a large family that have been involved in a number of different sports and businesses in Marlborough for three generations. Through my business and my leisure activities I associate with the whole community and feel I can talk for the whole community.
candidates.why_stand: Marlborough is a great place to live but hasn't reached its potential yet, we need to ensure that our children have a career path in Marlborough.

candidates.name: Deborah Dalliessi
candidates.why_elect: I believe in transparent, open and engaged community decision making. I project managed training Disability, Youth and Pacific Island communities to sit on boards and steering committees. Having served on boards and committees and worked in University project funding, I assure you I will commit time and fresh perspectives needed.
candidates.why_stand: I'm proud to be from Marlborough. I feel a deep sense of responsibility in preserving and developing our social, economic, environmental and cultural balance, so people and land thrive. I want to see a new joined up energy flow in the region reflecting the diversity of who and what we offer.

candidates.name: Robin Sutherland
candidates.why_elect: Apart from some time overseas, my career has been in Marlborough. Partner in major accounting firms, contractor to the District Council, manager of a CBD property company, trustee and advisor to two theatre campaigns. My heart is here, and my experience qualifies me to now contribute as a Councillor.
candidates.why_stand: As a long-term resident of Marlborough I am delighted by the considerable advances that the province has made. However, there are some black spots which I believe must be addressed with urgency—including the continuing decline of our CBD, and the environmental degradation of our rivers and the Marlborough Sounds.

candidates.name: Phil Skinner
candidates.why_elect: With a background in meteorology I feel it's important now more than ever we are prepared for the up and coming issues that will affect our town. From flooding to drought potential marlborough needs to have a panel ready for such issues.
candidates.why_stand: As a local Marlburian growing up in our beautiful town since I was 11 I feel it's important to have fresh views and a new generation involved in our council, I want to provide the best I can as a voice for our people.

candidates.name: Jenny Andrews
candidates.why_elect: Marlborough is part of my heart, I value working for those who have limited voice to express their concerns, but am equally proud of those who achieve their goals. I enjoy working with all sectors of our community, grass roots up.
candidates.why_stand: My passion for our outstanding province has not wavered, the progress and amenities we provide bring value to us all. Our residents have a special quality and resilience. It is a privilege to work with all sectors of this caring community.

candidates.name: Brian Dawson
candidates.why_elect: I've spent more than 25 years working with communities focused on positive change. I believe Wellington is a fantastic and fair minded city. We can be both the coolest and fairest little capital in the world. That's at the heart of why I'm here.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we have made significant progress in the social and housing areas over the past three years and I want to see that work through.

candidates.name: Margaret Montgomery
candidates.why_elect: I have lived and owned a business here for 25 years and believe that I have realistic ideas, common sense and will make informed decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for council to offer a progressive, honest and realistic approach to current community issues.

candidates.name: Peter Howard
candidates.why_elect: I bring a strong sense of passion for Kawatiri, our people, environment, and community. I've been involved in supporting its development both professionally and voluntarily over the years. I will bring to council: long-term thinking, vision, innovation, leadership, community engagement, business development, skills, sound governance and community government partnerships/collaboration.
candidates.why_stand: I believe it's important that we have an intergenerational perspective on council, who will fight for our future generations. I want to see enhanced community engagement and participation in council decision-making, while developing stronger partnerships to achieve our common desires.

candidates.name: Robyn Nahr
candidates.why_elect: I want Buller to continue to be a great place.I have served two terms on the council and have common sense and am not afraid of working hard.
candidates.why_stand: The Buller area is a great place to live and play. We need positive and forward looking people on our council.

candidates.name: Joanne Howard
candidates.why_elect: I volunteer for many organisations. I'm also a forum member of the Interagency and Health-Streams groups—understanding our region's social and health priorities. A Bachelor of Business Studies, extensive business and governance experience, economic and community development knowledge; a farming background, building/property management experience—I offer many attributes.
candidates.why_stand: I have been actively involved within the district for 40 years. I'm passionate about the community, it's wellbeing and future. I care about people, their visions and the sustainability of our region. I believe in: Working collaboratively to bring positive change. I'm committed to our community.

candidates.name: Coraleen White
candidates.why_elect: I am a born and bred Bullerite and seek to use my knowledge and skills gained from of lifetime of advocating for our District and Region for the benefit our Kawatiri district. I value transparent process and inclusive decision-making. "Mahi tahi mo te Kawatiri"—"Working together for Buller."
candidates.why_stand: Because I believe strong, capable representation is required on our council, now more so than ever! I am really concerned about the regional council-led "One District Plan" process, which will disadvantage the Buller—we want Buller to lead the Buller, not have Greymouth decide our futures.

candidates.before_politics: Still a Tutor and Bar Person
candidates.name: Kay Costley
candidates.why_elect: I've lived on the Coast with 4 generations of extended family for 20 years, mostly in the Northern Ward. I've always worked in changing environments, focused on supporting and empowering people, worked with legislation and skillfully problem solved. I believe strongly in equity, fairness and self -determination for all.
candidates.why_stand: I want something different for Grey District and I want to be part of making that happen. It is time for a change. A change that sees new ideas and opportunities, fresh eyes on existing challenges and meaningful and transparent consultation processes before decisions are made.

candidates.name: Richard Osmaston
candidates.why_elect: I am a farmer, an engineer, a pilot and a father. I have dedicated the last ten years to researching and promoting alternative socioeconomic solutions for humanity. This is my vocation. We have the opportunity today to achieve win-win outcomes that simply were not possible in the past.
candidates.why_stand: We have the potential here in Grey District to lead NZ into a new era of prosperity, equality and sustainability. We have the resources, the people, the innovation and the energy and social capital to achieve at an unprecedented level.

candidates.name: Karen Hamilton
candidates.why_elect: Having previously spent 9 years on the Grey District Council, I have experience in governance and local government. I was a founding committee member for the Aquatic Centre project. I work hard and want to make things happen for the good of the community.
candidates.why_stand: I love living on the West Coast. I also want voters to have choices when they are selecting their candidates for council.

candidates.name: Timothy Mora
candidates.why_elect: I have served twenty years as a community leader in our town and know the district well. I have served on numerous local trusts, boards and committees as a member and chair regionally and nationally. So I understand governance. I believe I have what it takes to work alongside others.
candidates.why_stand: Greymouth is my home and my wife Nicky and I are here to stay. We love this place and its people and so we talked about how we can best serve the community going forward and decided standing for Council was a good way.

candidates.name: Tania Gibson
candidates.why_elect: My energy and enthusiasm for this role is endless I know I can build and lead a team that can work together for the benefit of our town and it would be a privilege to do so. A fresh new change in leadership.
candidates.why_stand: I have been brought up in Cobden and lived and travelled overseas. From this I have realised how lucky we are to live where we do. Since I have been on council I have found my passion is working with my community.

candidates.name: Karen Grant
candidates.why_elect: I keep active in local groups including LandSAR, Cave Rescue, West Coast Alpine Club, Te Puawai Cooperative and an advisory group. I've had a career as a scientist in medical research, manufacturing, and waste management; then ten years with our local polytech, and now self-employed. I'm an analytical problem solver.
candidates.why_stand: I've enjoyed twelve years now on my lifestyle block in Kaiata; this is my home and I love the Coast, love its rugged bush and friendly communities. It's time now for me to find ways to help us stay strong in the face of change.

candidates.name: Allan Gibson
candidates.why_elect: Having been in business here for the last 35 years I have met a lot of people, I have been involved in many community projects which I have really enjoyed and wish to be involved more in the future.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for the third time I am passionate about our district and I believe I can contribute to make it a better place so that more people would want to live here as well.

candidates.name: Jackie Farrelly
candidates.why_elect: I ran a retail business in town for 15 years. I know many of the people having been involved with Guides, ATC, the local church, school, athletics, politics and other community groups.
candidates.why_stand: I love the Coast, its people and living in the Grey Valley.

candidates.name: Kim Judd
candidates.why_elect: I have had a broad involvement with community activities over the years, and was deeply affected by the Wombles when I was a child and strongly believe in " maximum use of available resources." For example instead of building a single court gymnasium I proposed a 4 court canopy system.
candidates.why_stand: I chose to live in Westland above all other regions in NZ and am running for council to ensure that our council is community focused first for the betterment of all that live here. A place that our children's children will be proud to call home.

candidates.name: Jane Neale
candidates.why_elect: Living in all three wards of Westland, working in tourism, education, and disability sectors and involvement in sport-clubs, art-groups and festivals has given me an understanding and appreciation of our community. School-boards, national board for RDA and being on council for the past three years has given useful governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see a more balanced, more diverse viewpoint around our council table. Having been in council for the past three years I will push for discussions and decisions to be better informed and more transparent. I want to ensure rate-payers aren't saddled with unnecessary liabilities, such as baled-waste.

candidates.name: Ange Cowan (Nee Murtha)
candidates.why_elect: I left Hokitika when I was 21 and came back home to live when I was 31. I have been working since I was a child. I am committed, punctual, approachable and give things all ive got.
candidates.why_stand: I love Hokitika and want to make it more of a place to be proud of. I want to be a voice for the voiceless.

candidates.name: Flow In
candidates.why_elect: Most of us want to make a positive contribution to our communities. I think that my particular scientific skill set, ability to process lots of information, and lack of vested interests means that I'd be able to do a really good job as a councillor.
candidates.why_stand: I've watched politicians and elected representatives make decisions that I really didn't agree with. Writing letters to the paper is one way of speaking out, but actually having a seat at the council table would be the most effective way of helping those decisions be ones I agree with.

candidates.name: Latham Martin
candidates.why_elect: I am awake at the Council table and speak out for what I believe. I research issues in depth and strive to ensure that Council decisions are made in the best interests of the community. I debate the issues and not the personalities around the Council table.
candidates.why_stand: I want to work with a hard-working, team based and inclusive council that listens, responds respectfully and is accountable to the community. I can help move this district forward working together with councillors and you.

candidates.name: Gray Eatwell
candidates.why_elect: I have a clear vision that council must return to basics, so by engaging my proven background of leading people to be cohesive, under extreme conditions, I am confident that a functional honest council is realistically achievable.
candidates.why_stand: As a sitting councillor, observing the underlying culture that is corrupting due process, a pathway has become obvious to me to bring council back into line with community expectations. To be effective the strength of all elected members must be engaged to serve Westland, through inclusive governance and fair practices.

candidates.name: Toka Te Taua
candidates.why_elect: I'm motivated, passionate and enthusiastic about life and my community. I call Hurunui home and I am willing to hear from our communities to support connections between our Eastern ward and Hurunui District to strengthen and understand our relationships and needs.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about community and believe I can connect our communities to support our many compositions. I want to bring a new perspective and address common public issues.

candidates.name: Stephen Carr
candidates.why_elect: I am a local small business owner in the transport industry, am involved with Civil Defence as Glenmark area coordinator and am also a trustee on both the Hurunui Trails Trust and the Christchurch Heroes LGBTI+ Sports Teams Charitable Trust.
candidates.why_stand: I would like to give a voice to our less populated areas within our district to ensure we are not forgotten and put on the shelf, while our more populated areas get all the attention.

candidates.name: Pauline White
candidates.why_elect: I offer enthusiasm, positivity, forward thinking, parental outlook, small business management, 25 years varied educational experience, involvement mentoring qualified and training teachers, effective communication ability, time management, prioritisation and organisational ability, empathy, resilience, willingness to listen to and appreciate others' viewpoints and a passion for youth—our leaders of tomorrow.
candidates.why_stand: I aspire to be able to play a more active part in promoting the further connecting of people and shaping our diverse growing, developing and changing community into the future to meet the needs of our residents while maintaining the unique and pristine nature of our environment.

candidates.name: Robbie Bruerton
candidates.why_elect: I have spent my working career, engaging with people and working with them to find solutions to their challenging situations.
candidates.why_stand: I was privileged to be raised in Greta Valley, a wonderful rural environment, among friendly people with many diverse skills, always ready to assist wherever they could to school, sports clubs, neighbours and community. I would like to think I could make a difference here.

candidates.name: Jason Goldsworthy
candidates.why_elect: I have a passion for our community and seeing it work towards a brighter future. I have experience in management, great at seeing the bigger picture and good people skills. Being a volunteer firefighter and st John youth leader gives me a unique perspectives and experience to offer.
candidates.why_stand: I want to continue the hard work of previous councils and feel that having a younger perspective on the board and council will be beneficial for decisions on the future. our world is changing and the more we discuss and plan now the better our future community will be.

candidates.name: Jay Webb
candidates.why_elect: I have a varied and extensive set of skills that I've obtained over a very long career in project,operations and recruitment management throughout the construction,demolition and civil industries. This means I have the experience and knowledge in many core council functions and can quickly identify problems and cost saving measures.
candidates.why_stand: I've experienced the total disregard for local residents and businesses by current councillors who seem to go about their own agendas without council or community notification. It's simply not good enough. The residents of the Waimakariri district deserve an honest and cost effective council with important environmental and social issues ahead.

candidates.name: Paul Williams
candidates.why_elect: I have owned successful businesses all of my adult life, I know that I bring a good financial background, and I am not afraid to speak out for what is right.
candidates.why_stand: I was born in Kaiapoi and come from a long standing family of council involvement. I know that the whole of Waimakariri is amazing but am afraid that rates are becoming unaffordable for the average household. My plan is to address the financial issues that face our council.

candidates.name: Kirstyn Barnett
candidates.why_elect: I am highly accessible to residents, and attend as many community meetings and events as possible. I am well educated, well travelled and offer extensive experience in project management and public speaking. I have also worked in travel, electronics, communications and town promotion, including running my own marketing business.
candidates.why_stand: I love living in Waimakariri and want to see the consistent, community-led decision-making since the 2010 earthquake continue, to ensure a strong future for our district. Having lived in both urban and rural locations, and raising a family here, I offer a real-life perspective at the council table.

candidates.name: Robbie Brine
candidates.why_elect: My 38 year professional career has involved crisis management, problem solving and dispute resolution. I am a very good negotiator and believe I supply a strong voice for our district.
candidates.why_stand: At 21 years as Councillor I believe I have the experience and skills to lead our council, by extension our staff and community through the challenges faced not only in our district but across the region. Water quality, natural hazards, climate change to name a few.

candidates.name: Brent Cairns
candidates.why_elect: I have strong links with businesses and residents in the town due to setting up the website directory https://kaiapoi.info and creating the Kaiapoi food forest. I am someone that gets things done.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about Kaiapoi and the district. Ever since I moved here I wanted to be involved to make it the best river town. I have and continue to volunteer for many organisations and want to make the next step in being a councillor.

candidates.name: Martin Pinkham
candidates.why_elect: I am a professional engineer, with senior engineering and management roles in the private sector and am experienced in reviewing and monitoring expenditure of multimillion projects. I am passionate about the development of our district, but improvements need to be good value for money.
candidates.why_stand: We need an exciting, and sustainable, Kaiapoi Town Centre, a clean river, improved public transport, and the Woodend bypass. Fresh thinking, along with my skills and experience in infrastructure development and asset management are vital to ensure that ratepayers get improved performance, and lower costs, from the council.

candidates.name: Shona Powell
candidates.why_elect: The last three years as a community board chair were a great apprenticeship for council. I have a proven track record of standing up for the interests of the communities I serve. I am well equipped to handle council governance with my background in management and leadership. Focus on solutions.
candidates.why_stand: I have used the phrase "Expect More." and I think that sums up my motivation. I love this area and when I have to head into the city I smile when coming back over the Waimakariri river as I am back in this wonderful place that is our home.

candidates.name: Philip Redmond
candidates.why_elect: I first became involved in local government in 1980 when I was elected to the Kaiapoi Borough Council at the age of 26. I practiced law in Kaiapoi for almost 40 years and elected to the KTCB in 2016. Extensive community involvement led to receiving a Queens Service Medal in June 2019.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about north Canterbury, its lifestyle and community well being. I am a sitting board member and very much community focussed. I like to give back to the community that supported me in my law practice for almost 40 years. A good place to raise a family.

candidates.name: Michael Joseph Bate
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community my whole life and i am a keen outdoors person, fisherman and hunter. I am saddened and disappointed with the authorities attitude towards our environment and our basic wellbeing. I have the benefit of being tied to no political party.
candidates.why_stand: I can see that our district has severe environmental issues that have been ignored or pushed into the background in past years. I would like our district to be environmentally clean to the benefit of our residents and wildlife.

candidates.name: Scott Franicevic
candidates.why_elect: My extensive experience in Customer Relations roles makes me a people person who enjoys nothing more than having a good chat. With that in mind I believe I have the skills and experience to connect with and represent the views of the People of Harewood.
candidates.why_stand: Because like many people in our City I believe it is time to see some fresh faces and change around the council table. I believe that I can be a strong and vocal advocate for my community.

candidates.name: Zahra Hussaini
candidates.why_elect: Christchurch has been my home for the past 15 years and I work on different events that bring communities together to create positive change. I believe I can carry my organisational abilities to bring people together through to local government in a council environment.
candidates.why_stand: My name is Zahra Hussaini, and I'm standing for council here in Waimairi. I come from a big Afghan family and Christchurch has been my home for the past 15 years. My goal is to bring diverse communities together. I believe climate change should be our number one priority.

candidates.name: Sam MacDonald
candidates.why_elect: I'm a Chartered Accountant, and currently Chair our community board. I know our area, and our city well and have a vision for the role council should place. We should be an enabler, not the barrier to sensible and sustainable development and investment in our city.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing for council because I am well placed to serve our community. We have a range of issues facing our City and we need local, competent representation at council. I live and pay rates in my Ward, and understand the challenges the residents face.

candidates.name: Mike Davidson
candidates.why_elect: Living locally and representing my community for the last six years I've been approachable and available to the community. My governance experience coupled with my managerial background with qualifications in insurance and environmental management makes me ideally suited to the needs of Christchurch residents and the future needs of our city.
candidates.why_stand: Christchurch has amazing potential to be a truly modern and sustainable city. I want to make a difference and help shape the future while still ensuring the city still works for the people of today, by focusing on strong communities, resilient infrastructure and a healthy natural environment.

candidates.name: Nathan McCluskey
candidates.why_elect: I am someone who knows how to build bridges rather than walls. I am committed to fostering compassionate communities and as a small business owner, I also understand bottom lines. For years I have been involved in youth leadership and that has kept me young at heart. I'm not boring!
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for election because Christchurch is my city and Papanui is my place in it. It is the location where I was born and have been formed. I love it in spite of its scars and I want to give back to it. I also have the necessary skill set.

candidates.name: Peter McDougall
candidates.why_elect: I have worked in central and local government for over twenty years. I understand how it functions and I know the right questions to ask and where we can make things better. I understand how we can save on rates without compromising levels of service.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Christchurch can have everything or at least do I significant amount more. There was such hope and optimism for a better Christchurch immediately after the earthquakes. Unfortunately our politicians both local and national have let us down. I am standing because I believe we can do better.

candidates.name: David Benson
candidates.why_elect: Listen to the community and individuals problems and work to solve them. I am a communicator preferably on a face to face basis. I will not fail to communicate with the people of the ward.
candidates.why_stand: I have had 12 years previous experience as a councillor, 9 years Chair of Hearings Committee, I have management skills, run our own business for over 40 years. Accounting and planning experience. Better practical solutions are badly needed in this council. Current council lurches from 1 problem to the next.

candidates.name: James Gough
candidates.why_elect: I bring a business lens with a people-focus that puts you and our city's future at the heart of decision making. It has been a privilege and a pleasure to represent you and I am seeking your backing once again.
candidates.why_stand: You have backed me as your city councillor for the past nine years. What sets me apart is I am not interested in why things can't happen; I am committed to finding ways they can.

candidates.name: Peter Wakeman
candidates.why_elect: Grew up on a farm and have appreciation of nature and business with common sense.
candidates.why_stand: The Government only response to public pressure through elections in order to address issues. So unless the public supports my solutions of the use of debt free money to combat the climate change we will not achieve anything significant.

candidates.name: Cam Parsonson
candidates.why_elect: I am a scientist, a builder, own businesses, own rental property, deal with government compliance and invest in my community. I am an ideas person and am capable of getting things done. I am also keen on low pollution strategies and green building. Know how-Can do!
candidates.why_stand: I see Christchurch growing and developing into a very livable city over the next 20 years. I don't want to see chlorine in our waters and am willing to stand up to try to ensure it won't happen.

candidates.name: Mark Wilson
candidates.why_elect: I'm not a bureaucrat, I'm a practical person who has had many jobs that required many skills, from cycle messenger, managing english conversation schools, to geologist. I've just finished rebuilding our home (with help) and now want to make a significant contribution to the my community and Innes Ward.
candidates.why_stand: I've helped coordinate a well publicised fight by residents against a motorway coming through our community. Engaging with many agencies involved, we went with suggestions and solutions, all we got were excuses. I want honest genuine advocacy and engagement for my community, and Christchurch.

candidates.name: Lindon (Boycey) Boyce
candidates.why_elect: As a business owner I know the struggles just to survive, I resent the way CCC is now operated Having worked within CCC I know the systems and why they are so broken, I will fix these and will introduce Common sense for the majority not pander to a minority.
candidates.why_stand: I'm Lindon Boyce you can call me Boycey. A born and bred Cantabrian I represent the small business and homeowners with over 30 years experience owning security, transport, construction, contracting and emergency service companies our current council consists of ex-politicians, academics, media personalities: I will bring experience without agenda.

candidates.name: Pauline Cotter
candidates.why_elect: I believe I have the skills to engage closely with the community and to work well with other councillors in order to achieve results.
candidates.why_stand: I am seeking re election as a city councillor because I want the city continue the journey to becoming the best city in NZ. Christchurch can become the Eco capital. I want to see the completion of the 13 separated cycleways.

candidates.name: Glenn Livingstone
candidates.why_elect: I have been with the east of Christchurch since the earthquakes. My track record includes the promotion of an Insurance Tribunal, which has now been brought into law.
candidates.why_stand: My entire working life has been and is vocational—as a Presbyterian Minister and now as a City Councillor. Neither have been jobs for me. I am here to serve the community.

candidates.name: Phil Mauger
candidates.why_elect: I can bring business and common sense to the council. I have run a successful family business in Civil Construction in Christchurch for decades. With my background I know exactly what needs to be done to fix the state of the roads and land in the East.
candidates.why_stand: I have been thinking of standing for council for 12 years. I have talked about it long enough and it is time for action. I have lived and worked in this ward for 55 years and know it like the back of my hand.

candidates.name: James Daniels
candidates.why_elect: I have extensive experience in this form of governance having spent 21 years at Te Runanga o Ngai Tahu plus commercial nous through being a director of one of the country's foremost property investment and development companies. I am also trusted, being a director on the board of Te Pāpā.
candidates.why_stand: I grew up here, will grow old here; things should be better. Our community has been neglected and disrespected over the last nine years so we need vigorous, visible and vocal representation. I will establish positive relationships with other councillors, staff and entities to ensure we get what we deserve.

candidates.name: Jimmy Chen
candidates.why_elect: I am an experienced incumbent councillor for three terms, and always putting people at the heart of my decision-making. And I secured the budget for new Hornby Library, Service Centre and South West Leisure Centre and ensured Kyle Park became the preferred location for this new facility.
candidates.why_stand: I'll follow up the new Hornby Library, Service Centre and South West Leisure Centre to be built up as quickly as possible within the next three years to meet the people's urgent needs. I'll monitor the Christchurch City Council's Multicultural Strategy to be implement effectively and efficiently.

candidates.name: Mark Peters
candidates.why_elect: Having led a strong group of local supporters and sports clubs to Save Denton Park, and then having assisted in forming the Greater Hornby Residents Association at the conclusion of that campaign my passion for our local communities is undeniable, I want to see our Hornby communities thrive!
candidates.why_stand: I believe our Hornby Ward needs a good strong understandable representation with our Hornby communities as their focus and passion. We need to ensure we get the new Hornby Library, Pool, and Southwest Leisure Centre on Kyle Park completed in a safe and timely manner with maximum inclusion of facility.

candidates.name: Paul Lonsdale
candidates.why_elect: I have proven ability of getting things done and many years of management and governance experience. I have been a Christchurch City councillor and was involved in all aspects of the council and its subsidiaries. I carry a large amount of knowledge to ensure our community's voice is effectively heard.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council because I believe we can do better. Much better. As a resident of Halswell I have seen our traffic become more congested, flooding challenges increase and water quality decrease. I will not be swayed by Wellington politics and believe we need better local representation.

candidates.name: Anthony Rimell
candidates.why_elect: I have lived and worked in Riccarton for much of my life. As a Pastor and a community organiser, I have constantly focused on empowering our communities, especially the most vulnerable.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Christchurch is about the people, not just the infrastructure. I love the many various ethnicities and cultures that call Riccarton home. I want to make sure they all have a voice in shaping our future.

candidates.name: Luke Chandler
candidates.why_elect: Listen. Our community board and Councillors have not been listening to the people. I will hold regular in person meetings to ensure the people are being heard.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our community needs solutions, independence and action from a new generation of public representation. I am Best for Riccarton, ready to offer a rejuvenated approach.

candidates.name: Catherine Chu
candidates.why_elect: I'm an Authorised Financial Adviser, an Executive Member of Keep Christchurch Beautiful and passionate about keeping our Garden City clean and green. I was born in Christchurch and lived in Riccarton my whole life. I have also served on our community board and have a deep understanding of our community.
candidates.why_stand: It's now time for a new face and a new perspective on our City Council. I'm standing to take action on; reviewing council spending and ensuring rates are affordable; on restoring basic infrastructure and services to our city; and keeping our water chlorine-free.

candidates.name: John Connelly
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the Riccarton Ward for 45 years and aware of the issues and needs. I experienced, take practical and common sense approach to business and community organisations I will be an effective communicator for the silent majority of ratepayers.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about our city, and have been approached by a large number of ratepayers both home and business owners.

candidates.name: Melanie Coker
candidates.why_elect: I have a PhD in biochemistry, and worked as a research scientist for 10 years, so have academic skills and determination. I am the director of my own successful education company, so have business experience and financial nous. I have firsthand understanding of the issues of the Spreydon Ward community.
candidates.why_stand: I've lived in Christchurch my whole life and feel committed to our city. I've worked in the Spreydon community on the community board for the past six years. I want to continue to serve the people of Christchurch as, for me, this is the best city in the world.

candidates.name: Scott Esdaile
candidates.why_elect: I place great importance on acting quickly on things that matter. Working for a local contracting roading company gives me a down to earth, practical hands on approach. I believe I bring to Council a fresh approach including strong communication skills, leadership, integrity, accountability and a great deal of positivity.
candidates.why_stand: Born and bred in Christchurch I'm a passionate advocate of this city and its people. I want to be the voice of my local electorate and work hard to affect change.

candidates.name: Clive Antony
candidates.why_elect: As an entrepreneur in marketing, I will bring fresh and creative thinking to the council table to help solve our problems. I'm a huge believer in servant leadership. As an employer I also know the power in listening so I will actively seek to learn, listen and represent residents.
candidates.why_stand: I am incredibly passionate about Christchurch and our future to be the most attractive city to live in NZ. The Central Ward is unique because of the relationship residents have with the CBD. I am passionate about building a culture and vibrant city that's loved by residents and business.

candidates.name: Jake McLellan
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in this community for the last 17 years, grew up here and went to school here. During my time on the community board I've gained a complex understanding of the issues affecting our community and I know how council can be used to address them.
candidates.why_stand: Because our community faces some big issues, and not enough has happened over the past three years to address them. I'm concerned about the deteriorating state of the Linwood Village and how poorly designed developments have started to impact amenity values while bully-boy developers leave bad feelings in communities.

candidates.name: Deon Swiggs
candidates.why_elect: I love my city and am honoured to represent many amazing communities. I am visible, accountable and accessible. I offer experience, sound economic judgement and a commitment to getting things done.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our city is on the cusp of being the best city in NZ and one of the best places to be in the world. But we still face some very unique challenges and I have the experience and energy to tackle these head on.

candidates.name: Lee Sampson
candidates.why_elect: I've spent 20+ years managing large public and private sector projects and I'm confident that by making sounder decisions and getting the basics right, we can deliver more for our communities and within our financial constraints.
candidates.why_stand: I'm ensuring Christchurch realises it's potential as one of the most liveable, vibrant, sustainable cities in the world—for all our communities. I'm standing to safeguard this future knowing I have a track record of collaboratively getting things done—and can tackle big issues in a positive way.

candidates.name: Tim Scandrett
candidates.why_elect: I am an experienced City Councillor who knows how to get the job done. I am a strong independent advocate who will continue to keep our community's voice at the core of council decision making.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for Council again as I believe we are making great progress in rebuilding our city. But there is still a lot to do. My Cashmere ward has a wonderful natural environment which we all love and I want to protect.

candidates.name: Joe Sullivan
candidates.why_elect: I have lived and worked in Christchurch most of my life and I believe I have the core values and experience to make a very solid and dependable contribution to the council and the people of our city.
candidates.why_stand: I think we have a very special city with a unique heritage and an even greater future ahead of us. We have the opportunity in acting for the people of Christchurch to make this our city, the city of choice for NZ. We can do better.

candidates.name: Yani Johanson
candidates.why_elect: I live locally and am committed to improving the quality of life for residents in the Linwood ward by putting people at the heart of decision making.
candidates.why_stand: I offer you an experienced city councillor dedicated to standing up for social justice, environmental sustainability, and transparent decision-making. I am a strong voice for Linwood standing up for the local community around the council table.

candidates.affiliation: For Strong Communities and a Healthy Environment
candidates.name: Sara Templeton
candidates.why_elect: As an experienced councillor I've been active, open and accessible in the community. I've been effective around the Council table and transparent in my decision making. I have the skills needed to represent the views of my community and make decisions in the best interests of current and future generations.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing as it's a crucial time in the regeneration of Christchurch, with a once in a lifetime opportunity to rebuild a 21st century, sustainable city. We need more focus on our changing environment and adaptive planning for our low lying city, putting people at the heart of decisions.

candidates.name: Kerry Pauling
candidates.why_elect: I have lived and worked in Malvern for thirty years. Working as a shearer in my youth I Have seen much of the area and met a lot of people. I have also been a police officer and met all kinds. I will listen and communicate for you as your councillor.
candidates.why_stand: We live in a Beautiful clean environment. It is largely unspoiled and I would like to keep it that way. Under the Southern Alps we enjoy Fishing, Hunting, Skiing, Boating at our Doorstep. An increasing Number of Visitors means we need to keep building more facilities. I can help with that.

candidates.name: Sophie McInnes
candidates.why_elect: I love big challenges, and my experience ranges from small business to education and local government. I am passionate about representing young families, youth, immigrants, and the rural-urban mix, because we comprise a large sector of the population. I actually enjoy analysing data and matching it to how we live.
candidates.why_stand: I love how Selwyn is becoming somewhere that we can truly live, work, play, and learn without heading into Christchurch everyday. I want to continue the development of local facilities, businesses, and infrastructure, but also ensure that council listens to the community and fully considers the environmental impacts of decisions.

candidates.name: Calvin Payne
candidates.why_elect: In particular I have 37 years experience in the Construction Industry and Selwyn District has the challenge to complete a number of large projects in a short time frame. I believe I can bring my knowledge and experience to support these projects to successful completion. and operation.
candidates.why_stand: I have been in NZ for 12 years a citizen for 7 years and lived in Selwyn for 5 years. I want to learn more about our young and expanding community and use this information to support our future development in a sustainable way within our rapidly changing climate.

candidates.name: Nicole Reid
candidates.why_elect: I have a background in environmental engineering and planning therefore I have the technical knowledge to understand and question technical reports. I believe in advocating for my community to ensure that we provide for as wide range of needs as possible across the district.
candidates.why_stand: I love living here and have done so for nine years; and was honoured to be elected to council in 2016. I am passionate about the Selwyn District. I truly want our district to the best it can be with healthy, sustainable communities that all ages and abilities enjoy.

candidates.name: Mark Alexander
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Selwyn for 25 years and have the experience of 3 terms of council to draw on. I can consider every issue on its merits as I am not a member of any political or lobby group. I'm not afraid to ask the hard questions.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about the people and communities of our Selwyn Central Ward and the Selwyn District. councillor I am a strong and experienced advocate for our communities. I've worked for improved public transport, footpaths, new and expanded schools, new community facilities, new sports grounds and reserves. There's more to do.

candidates.name: Jeff Bland
candidates.why_elect: I was a police officer for 38 years. The last 4 years of my career were here at Selwyn. I know the issues and problems that our fast developing community has.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for election as I care deeply about the community of Selwyn. I have lived here for more than 20 years. My children have attended local schools and now their children are doing the same. I have served the community as a councillor for nine years.

candidates.name: Michelle Jones
candidates.why_elect: I am someone who can mix in diverse circles. I have built my business up myself and have gained many practical skills through this. I am approachable and friendly and hardworking.
candidates.why_stand: I have committed to raising my family in Selwyn and have enjoyed what the district has to offer. I feel that we have a real opportunity to make Selwyn the best place in New Zealand to live. I am a self starter who believes that the future is bright.

candidates.name: Shane Epiha
candidates.why_elect: I love my family, and having a safe, caring prosperous community for all our local families to grow up in is my commitment. I am an executive committee member for the Road Transport Association of NZ and volunteer my time to give motivational discussions to young people in our region.
candidates.why_stand: I care about people, "he tangata" that is the most important part of any community. What I have found is that by giving you receive 10 times back and more. I want to contribute by being a voice for the community.

candidates.name: Riki Rolleston
candidates.why_elect: A great representative listens and sees more than talking. My previous business experience and personality lead me to display these skills. I cannot make informed decisions without consultation with key stakeholders and these attributes have held me in good stead. I will be a strong voice when I understand.
candidates.why_stand: To ensure decisions made are for the benefit of everyone in the district. The fastest growing district in NZ deserves a focused and energetic council that I want to be a part of. Selwyn District is a large and diverse area requiring different needs and wants.

candidates.name: Debra Hasson
candidates.why_elect: As a long term resident of Springston and current elected councillor I have local government experience and education in public policy and planning. I am a Resource Management Act commissioner; hold NZ Institute of Directors membership, Deputy Chair of Canterbury Neighbourhood Support and a committee member of Springs RSA.
candidates.why_stand: I have a proven track record of working alongside local community groups, understanding the local issues. I enjoy the challenge Selwyn's growth has to offer from District Planning through to infrastructure management.

candidates.name: Malcolm Lyall
candidates.why_elect: I have been actively representing the people of Selwyn District for many years and am presently Deputy Mayor.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about preserving the very best of the lifestyle the district offers, while embracing the opportunities created by growth for its people.

candidates.name: Lynette Lovett
candidates.why_elect: I'm proud to be living on our family farm of four generations in the Eiffelton district which gives me a good grounding on the agricultural industry and rural communities. I have many interests in the agricultural sector and do a lot of volunteering in the community.
candidates.why_stand: A rural voice working for town and country. I have the ability, energy, and will work collaboratively for the best outcome for the district, to grow and excel to be a desirable place to live work and play.

candidates.name: John Falloon
candidates.why_elect: For over 40 years I've run a successful business employing people in our town, helping local businesses and community groups succeed. I have extensive governance and financial experience serving on the board of IHC, one of NZ's largest charities, and held national roles with the Institute of Chartered Accountants.
candidates.why_stand: It's important the Ashburton District continues to grow and prosper. That requires a council that shows responsible leadership and someone around the council table to ensure they get the basics right.

candidates.name: Selwyn Price
candidates.why_elect: I've been described as someone who gets the bigger picture and is not afraid to stand up and be counted. I come to council meetings well prepared, and ready to do my bit. I am a keen advocate of listening to the community, and always make myself available to them.
candidates.why_stand: My motivation to run for re-election is to ensure that all decision-making by council continues to be open and transparent, follows due process, and takes into account the will of the people of our district. I will continue to make myself available in the community, as I have this term.

candidates.name: Diane Rawlinson
candidates.why_elect: Having lived here since 1967 I have always been involved in many community groups and organisations. I have worked in senior positions within Ashburton and believe that I know the community quite well. I am open minded and will look well at both sides of a discussion/idea.
candidates.why_stand: I think we have a great district, and I am passionate about providing good governance for the whole community. I hope to be able to continue into a second term, and have learnt such a lot about the operations of council in this 2016-2019 term.

candidates.name: Kerry Stevens
candidates.why_elect: My connection to Geraldine spans 18 years in three very different roles (Principal, Manager and councillor), but all are leadership positions serving our community in some way. I enjoy the complexity of the councillor's role which involves a mixture of supporting local people/groups and developing council plans, strategies and policies.
candidates.why_stand: I'm proud to call Geraldine home because it's a special and unique community. I have the time, energy, persistence and skills needed to perform the councillor's role; and I'm strongly motivated to making a positive difference for our community because I find this personally very satisfying.

candidates.name: Charles Scarsbrook
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Temuka most of my life and am involved in many voluntary community areas, I feel my business experience and my strong sense of social justice within my community will be of benefit to my local area.
candidates.why_stand: I enjoy being involved in my community and would like the opportunity to use the skills I have to make my community even better.

candidates.name: Anthony Brien
candidates.why_elect: I and my family have lived in Timaru for 35 years and have been actively involved in our community. I will bring management/governance experience/skills (MSc. and PhD in Business Management) and common-sense to the council table.
candidates.why_stand: Timaru is a great place to live and work but faces many challenges, for example an increasing council debt an ageing population and reducing youth numbers. Timaru's way of balancing the challenges is to 'economically grow'. But, we must focus on ensuring the basics are sorted, primarily good infrastructure.

candidates.name: Barbara Gilchrist
candidates.why_elect: I offer a fresh, female voice, young enough to be optimistic but old enough to be realistic. With a background in health and experience in local government, I'm standing for both. I believe good health and good business will make Timaru district the best place to live, work and thrive.
candidates.why_stand: We all want to live in a town that's vibrant and good for everyone, young or old. An ageing population and financial pressures require innovative thinking, and I want to be involved in that. Climate change, infrastructure and the CBD require tough decisions today to ensure our wellbeing tomorrow.

candidates.name: Stu Jackson
candidates.why_elect: I lived overseas for 10 years but returned to Timaru to settle. I've now lived in the south end of Timaru's main street, Stafford Street, for 23 years. Walk the main street every day so understand the inner city well. Run own Photography business for last 33 years.
candidates.why_stand: I've been on different groups and boards all my working life but believe to actually get something done, you need to be on the inside. On the CBD group since its inception nearly three years ago. Regular submitter to Long Term Plans. Former regular writer of letters to the editor.

candidates.name: Hugh Perry
candidates.why_elect: I have over 35 years as a lawyer in South Canterbury. I have a reputation of impeccable integrity and honest opinion. I will bring experience and my reputation. I will be hard-working, strong and effective. I am skilled in gaining consensus from groups, to enable positive action to be taken.
candidates.why_stand: I wish to give back to our community. I love South Canterbury. The district deserves the very best council representation. I am committed to being a strong and compassionate advocate. I do not consider in recent times some of the decisions made by the council have been the best.

candidates.name: Karl Te Raki
candidates.why_elect: I was born and raised in Timaru and have run my own local business for 22 years. I have held numerous positions on boards, which means I will bring with me my extensive experience in governance and leadership.
candidates.why_stand: I will be a strong advocate and voice for our community. I want to give back to a community that has supported me on my path to running a successful local business. I will have a fresh approach with new ideas.

candidates.name: Jock Anderson
candidates.why_elect: As a lifelong journalist I listen to people and understand what they need and want. I will be accountable to the voters, not the bureaucratic system. I speak my mind and am not afraid to go against the grain.
candidates.why_stand: Timaru is a well serviced small city but requires constant injection of new blood thinking outside the square to ensure it progresses at an affordable and manageable pace. I am that new blood.

candidates.name: Emily Bradbury
candidates.why_elect: In my short time spent living in Twizel, I have never been so sure about living there. I have a fresh set of eyes and ideas that I believe will be a great addition to the local council and the planning and development that lies ahead.
candidates.why_stand: My family and I thoroughly enjoy the Mackenzie Country for its natural tranquility and outlook. It has so much to offer, with it's lakes, mountains and so many more outdoor activities. I am motivated because there is so much opportunity in this region, we just need to unlock it.

candidates.name: Mike Downes
candidates.why_elect: I am highly experienced in leadership and management and used to working in committees to come to consensus decisions. I have an inclusive manner and the ability to see all sides of an argument.
candidates.why_stand: I would like to offer something back to the community which has been welcoming, friendly and inclusive. I also want to be involved in helping to foster the emerging vibrancy and regeneration of the town.

candidates.name: Fabia Fox
candidates.why_elect: My experience providing strategic advice to councils means I am well placed represent the Waimate community at the council table. I have the energy and knowledge of local government processes and the Waimate community to make a real and positive difference to local decision making.
candidates.why_stand: I am so lucky to have grown up and now live in such a supportive, welcoming community. However, Waimate, like other small, rural councils is facing many challenges. I have the skill set, the knowledge and the passion to help our wonderful community through these challenges.

candidates.name: Miriam Morton
candidates.why_elect: My background is in education, administration and small business, and raising a family. I am committed to listening to people, reading documents and researching background details, in order to make wise decisions for the district. The past 6 years as an elected council representative give me ideal skills and experience.
candidates.why_stand: Waimate is a great place to live and I believe that in these changing times my contribution to council can help to keep it that way. I am keen to continue working towards bringing the Economic Development Strategy through to fruition for the benefit of residents and visitors alike.

candidates.name: John Begg
candidates.why_elect: I am part of numerous strategic and governance leadership groups, and have a diverse knowledge of recreational, educational and social issues related to Waimate. As an ambulance officer, I see the health and social challenges facing our community. With my science background I appreciate the importance of research and information.
candidates.why_stand: After being in involved in the community for 26 years, I feel that I have gained a good amount of knowledge about the weaker and stronger points of our community. This is an ideal time for me to stand and support our community through this period of progressive development.

candidates.name: Devin Familton
candidates.why_elect: I would make an excellent representative for the people of Oamaru as I am driven, highly motivated, practical and knowledgeable. I have achieved a lot from a young age which shows what I am capable of and have my head screwed on and know how to work hard.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that there should be a younger voice on council to represent younger generations. The decisions council are making now are going to affect my age group and my kids in years to come so I want to make sure we are making the right decisions.

candidates.name: Derek Golding
candidates.why_elect: I believe that the council needs to regain some community trust by being more open and approachable. I'm a trained facilitator and communicator thanks to my previous career as a nurse and would put those skills to good use in negotiating positive outcomes for the community.
candidates.why_stand: My partner and I moved to Oamaru to raise our family. She's from Oamaru and we wanted our children to grow up in the amazing community she did as a child. I'd like to actively participate in helping our community grow and develop into the future.

candidates.name: Hana Melania Halalele
candidates.why_elect: I have a passion for community empowerment. I will serve with integrity and compassion by advocating, inspiring and empowering for social change for the betterment of our community. I have good governance experience and serve on a number of Boards and Committees. I specialise in community development and organisational analysis.
candidates.why_stand: I care about the Waitaki region and the growing, diverse needs and views of our community. It's important to foster meaningful connections and relationships with our community. I believe we should invest in the well being of our people and community.

candidates.name: Jim Hopkins
candidates.why_elect: I offer experience and I understand local government. I'm an accredited Resource Management Commissioner, committed to delivering high quality, affordable core services. Promises are easy. But other people pay for them. It's easy to spend other people's money. Better to save, especially in tighter times when belt-tightening will be needed.
candidates.why_stand: Because councils matter. Think how our day starts: Wake, use loo, fill jug, shower, go for run/walk, drive to work; thanks to council water supplies, sewer systems, treatment plants, footpaths, parks, roads—and it's only 9am. Modern lives depend on council services. Keeping them affordable is a privilege.

candidates.name: Peter McLellan
candidates.why_elect: Being an Oamaru resident for 15 years, I have had much experience in education and sports administration in and outside of schools in NZ and overseas. I would have the time commitment and I would come in as an independent offering a fresh set of eyes to council matters.
candidates.why_stand: I support small town NZ and recognise the contribution that small towns and their associated industries make for the wellbeing of the country. Oamaru is one such example and has much to offer in what it already has and its potential for further development.

candidates.name: Kelli Milmine
candidates.why_elect: Many generations of my family have called North Otago home, hailing from both sheep farming and local business backgrounds. I have always been planning to run for council, and the time is finally right personally for me to stand for election and support our town moving forward.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about North Otago and it's people, and I want to be part of the team that helps take us further towards our bright future.

candidates.name: John Shaw
candidates.why_elect: I have always been in business, manager in the travel industry, senior grocery sales and marketing management, real estate and property management. I have been treasurer for the Friends of the Forrester Gallery, currently a committee member of Mountain Biking North Otago and on the 'Town Square' development group.
candidates.why_stand: Council must be accountable and ensure that the rate payers get fair value for their rates. An independent voice gains greater transparency. Gain greater trust by improving communication to the community. Planning and prioritizing needs improvement to focus on what will provide the most additional value for the local community.

candidates.name: Melanie Jeanne Tavendale
candidates.why_elect: I am Deputy Mayor and second term councillor, with a background in journalism and community relations. I was selected from across NZ as a governance development representative on Local Government's National Council. I am a strong, positive leader, and believe I have earned respect from those I have worked alongside.
candidates.why_stand: Waitaki is unique and charming, and people are moving here to raise their children. However we have our issues, and need to recognise that government isn't going to fix them all. These include housing, crime, ageing demographics and general affordability. I want to be part of the solution to these.

candidates.name: Colin Wollstein
candidates.why_elect: I have a very wide experience in both business and personal life in Oamaru, having lived here for most of my life. I have been involved in local organisations and have a wide circle of friends and contacts to ensure that I am well informed on local matters of interest.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for re-election, as I believe that my business experience, professional training and 6 years on council place me in a great position to continue to contribute to council discussions and thus ensure that council makes the best decisions for all residents of the Waitaki District.

candidates.name: Eden Bradfield
candidates.why_elect: As a fifth generation Oamaruvian, the Waitaki runs through my veins—there's no better place in all of NZ. I'm standing for council because I believe the time has come for common-sense solutions and action.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about Oamaru and its people, and I stand to speak for the people of the Waitaki.

candidates.name: Liz Cadogan
candidates.why_elect: I've worked in various community-focused roles in Oamaru for the past twenty years, a Waikouaiti Community Board member (2001), and a passionate advocate for the health and well being of people and their environment. Life experience and lateral thinking will ensure I make positive, responsible contributions for the Waitaki area.
candidates.why_stand: The Waitaki district is, without question a magnificent area to raise children, work and eventually retire. My background in community work/health and a deep sense of social justice, combined with years of promoting the area photographically ensures I know Waitaki with a passion. People and the environment matter to me!

candidates.name: Iain Clark
candidates.why_elect: I have a commitment to working with people to find solutions and outcomes. I work well with groups and am involved at a number of levels in the community, giving me experience and tolerance, along with maturity to achieve outcomes in challenging situations.
candidates.why_stand: Through Steampunk I have contributed to the reason people are attracted to this town, which takes on the world. My ability to consider options and find creative solutions that aren't immediately obvious will help greatly with much needed diversity in council.

candidates.name: Peter Newton
candidates.why_elect: I have over 20 years experience in professional services industries including law, IT and accountancy and willingly volunteer my time for worthy causes. I believe in having a council that is strong in transparency, accountability and what's right for its communities through proactive community involvement in decision-making and open communication.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for council to be the voice for Waihemo, listening to and understanding our people's collective needs regarding council services and amenities to proactively make the region prosper, and be a place we and future generations are proud of, whilst negotiating and advocating on their behalf for tangible outcomes.

candidates.name: Jan Wheeler
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community for approx 38 years and have been involved in many community ventures over the years. I have many skills I bring to the job. I will be a strong voice on council for ratepayers. I want good process followed.
candidates.why_stand: Our district is beautiful ,historic and unique and I wish to see it grow in this special character. We have passionate volunteers in Oamaru, Palmerston, Duntroon, Kurow, Maheno, Omarama, Weston, Kakanui, Herbert, Dunback, Moeraki, Hampden, Macraes, Papakaio, Waitaki Bridge—absolutely everywhere and they deserve fair, consultative, decision making from WDC.

candidates.name: Eugen Dupu
candidates.why_elect: I lead with integrity, make a difference and bring a positive perspective. I have been involved in governance locally, nationally and internationally and is a strength of mine—I can bring a different perspective to the table and a unique skill set.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that the Waitaki district is one of the best places to live in our country and have seen the tremendous change and growth in our district. My passion are the people and people make the district.

candidates.name: Cheryl Laws
candidates.why_elect: That's for others to judge: I have practical life and commercial budget advisory experience, am a director of an advocacy/public relations company, and work also in Central's wonderful and collegial wine industry. I'm the stepmum of three school aged Cromwell kids. I am a peacemaker, honest and work hard.
candidates.why_stand: Cromwell and Central need a Council that communicates with, listens to, and involves our community in all its decision-making. In addition, we require family friendly policies that aim to improve the lives of all residents. Finally, let's get the council's appetite for our rates under control.

candidates.name: Shirley Calvert
candidates.why_elect: I have the experience, leadership, community involvement and motivation needed to make positive progress for our District. I understand the issues and am well connected to the community. I will continue to work hard and be an active advocate for my community.
candidates.why_stand: To advocate on behalf of my region for the many challenges ahead: Better access to health services, caring for our precious environment, retaining our unique lifestyle while allowing well-considered growth to happen, affordable housing and managing tourism growth are key issues that require good understanding, good governance and good decisions.

candidates.name: Neil Gillespie
candidates.why_elect: I've been your councillor since 2001 (currently Deputy Mayor) and a member of the Cromwell Community Board since 1998 (Chairman since 2001). I bring significant knowledge and experience around the council and Board tables—knowing where we have come from is a great asset in helping guide the future.
candidates.why_stand: In the future I want my children and their children to be able to live in a Cromwell that will give them the same or better experiences and opportunities that they had growing up here!

candidates.name: Jocelyn Johnstone
candidates.why_elect: After a lifetime of positive memories, I'd like to offer back time, skills and experience to the team. I have served extensively as a volunteer, along with years of business, and management experience in the health and social sector. This encompasses prudent financial management, governance, and communication and negotiation skills.
candidates.why_stand: After a lifetime involvement in the authentic town of Cromwell, Im looking to be part of a team ensuring this place grows well for family, work, and fun for the next generation. My personal family values are family, faith and community, work hard, serve others, don't moan but find solutions.

candidates.name: Ian Cooney
candidates.why_stand: I would be a good representative for many areas of our community. I have been involved in our business, sporting, cultural, disabled and elderly community and have a wide ranging view point.

candidates.name: Tony Hammington
candidates.why_elect: I bring a fresh perspective to the council table which will prompt me to ask questions to delve into fundamental drivers for Council activities. My approach is very collaborative rather than confrontational, to work with teams to achieve agreed outcomes, and commit to achieving a shared vision.
candidates.why_stand: My career has been spent making a difference in communities for fellow NZers and aspire to do the same for our unique region by applying my commercial experience and collaborative approach.

candidates.name: Martin R McPherson
candidates.why_elect: My back ground and engagement with this district brings me into contact with many the young and the not so young. I pride myself on my ability to engage across the district I will always listen and act in your best interests.
candidates.why_stand: I have had the support of the Vincent community for many years and will continue to be a voice for all on matters that are important in our region. I will actively promote this district as a great place to live work and play.

candidates.name: Tracy Paterson
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Central Otago for nearly 20 years. I am a business owner and employ staff. I am involved and have been involved with community organisations and charitable trusts such as Central Otago Health Incorporated, Board of Trustees and Central Otago A & P Association.
candidates.why_stand: Central Otago is a diverse region which can boast not only breathtaking scenery but also innovation and leaders in agriculture and science.

candidates.name: Bruce Potter
candidates.why_elect: I have a broad experience in many areas of community life and have served on many committees in the arts and culture as well as science and sport. I have served with the Lions and run my own karate dojo helping the young and old alike to better themselves.
candidates.why_stand: I am a very community oriented person and have been heavily involved in our community in musical theatre, art, sport and in services to the community since arriving here 5 years ago. I see getting elected as a service to my community.

candidates.name: Tamah Alley
candidates.why_elect: As a serving Police officer, I bring superior communication and mediation skills, with a friendly and approachable demeanor. I am engaged with multiple community agencies and bring a wealth of knowledge about priorities for all our residents, not just one demographic.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the incumbent Council does not adequately reflect the diversity of our region or the interests of young families. I am stepping up for the next generation to help shape our future, and grow in a way that maintains the value of why we live here.

candidates.name: Victoria Bonham
candidates.why_elect: Have lived in Central Otago most of my life, I have a rural background. Was among the first bunch of woman jockeys to ride in NZ. Business management 30 +yrs. Tourism, film, marketing, animal charity coordinator, District Councillor, community board member.
candidates.why_stand: Central Otago is unique, picturesque, rugged with incredible history. Our communities are close knit knowledgeable, resourceful and innovative and self sufficient. We very much live and celebrate a very true and rural kiwi culture. I very much want to preserve and celebrate this.

candidates.name: Niki Gladding
candidates.why_elect: I've spent the last five years working to get better outcomes out of council decision-making. I understand what goes on, I understand council processes and I understand how vital it can be to have a councillor who will take your concerns further.
candidates.why_stand: We are running out of time to take action on climate change and to protect our water and natural systems. Our leaders continue to pay lip service to environmental issues and that has to stop now or our children don't have a future.

candidates.name: John Glover
candidates.why_elect: Because I have a good knowledge of the issues, how governance works, am able to ask the right questions and am a great team worker.
candidates.why_stand: Because council is focused on growth for growth's sake and it does not have the mandate to do this. Rapid growth is destroying our communities and our amenity.

candidates.name: Glyn Lewers
candidates.why_elect: I am the chair of the Frankton Community Association, board member of Destination Queenstown and a structural engineer. I am well placed to hear a variety of community views. With my technical background and experience in managing infrastructure assets, I have the skills to make thoughtful decisions on your behalf.
candidates.why_stand: My partner and two boys made Queenstown our home to be with our family, and to enjoy the lifestyle that Queenstown has to offer. I am putting myself forward as a candidate as I am committed to protecting this way of life for all residents, now and into the future.

candidates.name: John MacDonald
candidates.why_elect: I am Pragmatic and outcomes focused, I believe I have a good connection and can represent current and future residents of the district.
candidates.why_stand: We are only part way through the work we started 3 years ago and need to continue with this excellent progress. To Make a difference.

candidates.name: AJ Mason
candidates.why_elect: I have been connected to this place my whole life, but enough global experience to appreciate how truly exceptional it is and the possibilities that lie before us. I have been deeply involved with and led a range of community activities, including as community representative to council planning and strategies.
candidates.why_stand: Nothing is ordinary about the Queenstown Lakes District: we have exceptional community and extraordinary potential, but also unique challenges. Our challenge of low value, high impact economy, is matched by extraordinary potential to transition to high value, low impact. I want to continue championing our community in making that transition.

candidates.before_politics: Was and still am a GP Doctor
candidates.name: Valerie Miller
candidates.why_elect: I have lived and worked in this community for 35 years.I encounter people of all walks of life everyday and I see the problems they are experiencing at a community level. I have traveled and seen how these things have been managed elsewhere and I can think outside the square.
candidates.why_stand: This beautiful region has given me a wonderful life and opportunities, I want to help protect this for future generations and give a little back. I do not want to see it destroyed by excess, we need to protect its integrity but also look to the future.

candidates.name: Penny Clark
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Queenstown for 10 years and previously for 3 back in 1991. I have always been involved in the community, managing hotels, involved in tourism committees and bringing up my son in the early nineties.
candidates.why_stand: I have nearly completed 3 years in my current position as councillor and am very keen to follow through on some of the major projects we have initiated or have underway. Our community deserves some action.

candidates.name: Niamh Shaw
candidates.why_elect: I am passionate, reliable and driven—and take action to effect change. Over the past few years, I have volunteered extensively for various community groups. Now that my children are older, I feel that running for council is the most effective way to give back and make an impact.
candidates.why_stand: My family moved to Wanaka for its charm and stunning natural surrounds, and then fell in love with this friendly, supportive and inclusive community. I'm standing for council to actively address the challenging and specific issues we face in this amazing place we are privileged to call home.

candidates.name: Cherilyn Walthew
candidates.why_elect: I grew up in Wanaka and returned here after my world adventures, to bring up my family. My background is largely corporate, latterly as a Human Resource Business Partner. My experience involves working with large teams across multiple departments to deliver strategic plans and programmes for the greater good.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing because, the fast-paced development in the district that we've been seeing in the last few years, seems greatly at odds with the wishes of the community. Rates have skyrocketed and amenities seem to be visitor focused. We need to be listened to not just heard.

candidates.name: Lincoln Haworth
candidates.why_elect: I have experience in the tourism industry and a good academic grounding in science and law. I think these are key areas an elected representative needs to be versed in, and by getting involved at a young age, I intend to learn how to be Good at Government.
candidates.why_stand: I love Wanaka and have lived here all my life. I felt strongly that there needed to be a voice for younger people in the area, as this is a tough place to gain a foothold.

candidates.name: Calum MacLeod
candidates.why_elect: I have served Wanaka for six years as Councillor, three as Deputy Mayor. In this time I have established many positive working relationships. I am a qualified commissioner. My most enduring qualities are persistence and enthusiasm. These, along with a strong community and business background, gives me an excellent skill-set!
candidates.why_stand: My wife and I first arrived in wonderful Wanaka in 1989. Since then we have witnessed so many changes in the Upper Clutha. I have lived in Wanaka longer than anywhere else on Earth and I am truly passionate about the Upper Clutha as an environment for families to thrive.

candidates.name: Heath Copland
candidates.why_elect: Through my life experiences, travel and professional career I have developed an open mind and skill set the allows me to approach situations with empathy and logic.
