I have an affinity to Arrowtown and surrounds, this is my home. I understand what makes our district so special and why.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the Lakes District is the most spectacular part on NZ and I want my ensure it remains that way for the future generations. The challenges facing our district are unique and I want to be part of finding the best solution for those challenges.

candidates.name: Paul Hanlon
candidates.why_elect: I have extensive management experience covering man management, change management and project management. As a military engineer I built roads installed water treatment plants built hostels. I will stand on the side of our farmers those who feed us and oppose those who attack them.
candidates.why_stand: I care more for others than myself. I have always served, in the Armed forces then JCI, Lions, and NZRSA. Set up a community computing centre as a free service and gladly donated my time helping others. I now wish to Serve You in the Bruce Ward.

candidates.name: Rob Scott
candidates.why_elect: Having been involved with the council at a local level, I have seen the good, the bad, and the ugly. I can see what is broken, and I can see what works. I have been involved in many community organisations as well as being self employed for 15 years.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate about Southland and feel that we need to have strong representation and good leadership as Southland faces some upcoming challenges. I have been chairman of the Lumsden Community Board and CDA for the last decade and would love to represent the district with a seat at the council.

candidates.name: Brian Dillon
candidates.why_elect: I have lived and farmed in the area all my life, and together with my family we have built a very strong and successful farming business. I have been involved with schools and community groups for many years, and have had twenty-one years experience as a councillor.
candidates.why_stand: My reason for standing for council again is twofold. Firstly the desire to serve the people of this great province and make it a better place. Secondly there are some very important things happening which I have been very involved with and would like to see to fruition.

candidates.name: John Douglas
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Southland for 42 years. During that time June and I have raised two adult children Laura and Michael, developed a farm and taken an active role in sporting and community groups. A local is not defined by the number of years but by what they contribute.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Southland is a special place to live work and raise a family. People care for one another, crime is low, housing is affordable and there are plenty of opportunities with those with an eye to the future. Farming and Tourism will provide the backbone to Southlands future.

candidates.name: Michael Marron
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in three different countries before moving to New Zealand, I have served in the Irish Army, Irish Police force, this has given me an insight into the difficulties faced by our communities. I can apply a different view when resolving these issues.
candidates.why_stand: I worked for the council for 14 years and I am passionate about the Southland District Council and representing the people who reside in the ward I am asking to represent.

candidates.name: Karyn Owen
candidates.why_elect: I'm intelligent and can offer fresh thinking to our council. I am passionate about enabling businesses and community groups to achieve their goals—always looking for win-win solutions. I've spent two years managing Te Hikoi Museum, and previously worked in tourism and economic development.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing because I want to see more diversity on council that truly reflects our population. I believe this will result in planning that better reflects our communities' needs.

candidates.name: Nick Perham
candidates.why_elect: I believe in accountability. With over 15 years in public sector management, I am well versed in policy and planning and how these get transferred into actions. I am well connected with the community, through Church, Lions Club, and trustee of Borland Lodge. I also bring significant applicable international experience.
candidates.why_stand: Community is everything to me. Which is why I am running for a second term on Council. I strongly believe in the concept of "small council, big communities." I want to empower our communities to achieve their own goals; supporting and enabling people, without the hitches of needless bureaucracy.

candidates.name: Don Byars
candidates.why_elect: I have generally been self-employed and appreciate the need to be competitive. A keen interest in economics and marketing has helped in this regard. A good strategic thinker, I'm quite comfortable considering solutions that lie outside the norm. My family and I are fortunate to live in Riverton.
candidates.why_stand: I am motivated by helping our community adapt and change so we able to face the future from a position of security. I would like to help create opportunities for our young people. I believe the council exists to empower the community rather than to direct it.

candidates.name: George Harpur
candidates.why_elect: born in Tuatapere and have been involved in our community ever since, transport, business management, many of our sporting clubs and a few other interests. currently on my 5th term as your councillor. I am familiar with farming and forestry and most things that make our region function. thank you.
candidates.why_stand: With the advent of the Great Walk upgrade to the Hump Ridge track, Tuatapere and all areas adjacent to the Southern Scenic Route may well be on the verge of a major increase in tourist traffic flow. We must compete for our market share. For us and our children.

candidates.before_politics: Retired operate a small B n B
candidates.name: Ron Hibbs
candidates.why_elect: In the past I have been involved with many community groups, including Boards of Trustees, I have managed a disabilities trust that provided day services. I have been involved in retail including owning my own successful business. I know the difference between management and governance.
candidates.why_stand: When looking for an area to retire in I chose Tuatapere because of its small town vibe. Tuatapere has so much going for it, it has a moderate climate, great access to the outdoors and friendly and helpful people. Tuatapere is only an hours drive from a big urban centre.

candidates.name: Christine Menzies
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the Lochiel and Winton communities for 40 years raising my family here. I have been employed for 20 years in management positions across health, welfare and education where I have used my qualifications in law, social work and business management to make a difference.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I can make a contribution to local body governance in an informed way. I want to use my knowledge, skills and attributes to help keep Southland a great place to live and to help create opportunities for young people to take advantage of and make Southland their home.

candidates.name: Darren Frazer
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Winton for close to 20 years, having worked most of that time in the community with young people, I know the area and the people. I'm a father with young children, this keeps me grounded but also makes the future important to me.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing because I care for my community and want to see it be the best place it can be to work, live and play for my kids in the future.

candidates.name: Paul Duffy
candidates.why_elect: I have lived,farmed and my wife and I raised our family in this area my whole life. I have been involved in many community organisations and had eighteen years experience as local representative. I understand the commitment required and have the time to do the work.
candidates.why_stand: There is so much about the Waihopai Toetoe Ward that makes it special.The productive farmland, the Catlins coastal area,Waituna Wetlands, our rivers and the people that work hard in our communities. I have been privileged to have represented the area as Councillor and offer myself for a further term.

candidates.name: Julie Keast
candidates.why_elect: I am involved in the community and enjoy hearing individual stories and understanding their issues. I believe that everyone has a contribution to make and together great things happen.
candidates.why_stand: Southland is a very special place that is home for me. I wish to see it protected and enhanced to ensure it is still a great place for future generations—a community that is active and engaged will make this happen.

candidates.name: Amanda Nally
candidates.why_elect: I'm good at asking questions and communicating the answers. Waihopai-Toetoe is a big area with a blend of small town and rural residents—if elected it will be my job to ensure I liaise widely to ensure I'm bringing the views of the wider district to the council table.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running so all Waihopai-Toetoe residents get to vote this election. I'm a self-employed writer and publisher, who enjoys kayaking with baby sea lions. Born in Wanganui, I got here as soon as I could, moving to Southland in 1987 and to Waikawa in 2003.

candidates.name: Rakiura Herzhoff
candidates.why_elect: I have had the opportunity to both live here and other places throughout NZ and overseas. My love for this Island and passion to keep getting to know our people means I am receptive to different ideas and value that which makes Stewart Island our cherished home.
candidates.why_stand: Stewart Island first and foremost for Stewart Islanders! We are coming into ever bigger changes as Stewart Island becomes more and more a desired destination for both national and international travel. This increases attention from external businesses and organisations who are looking to capitalise on this.

candidates.name: Glenys Dickson
candidates.why_elect: I entered council at the last election with broad experience and a people first approach. Since then I've worked hard to learn about the areas where council can make a real impact, the needs of residents and how best to help enhance our district and environment.
candidates.why_stand: Gore is home and is a special place to live and bring up a family or reside. I stood for council at the last election because I firmly believe Gore has the potential to become a leading small rural town providing a safe, secure and diverse environment for residents.

candidates.name: Nick Grant
candidates.why_elect: I believe my knowledge of infrastructure, practical skills and the ability to connect and work with people from all areas of the community will be an asset to our council.
candidates.why_stand: I am a strong believer in a community working together and in my line of work I meet so many talented and hard working people from all walks of life, I would be privileged to represent them all on council.

candidates.name: Alezix Heneti
candidates.why_elect: I have served community and business 38 years.
candidates.why_stand: I know Albany Ward is the best area to live in.

candidates.name: Julia Parfitt
candidates.why_elect: I believe my experience as the Chairperson of the Hibiscus and Bays Local Board and a former North Shore City councillor representing the Albany ward, has given me an excellent understanding of the issues we face. I am hardworking and effective at ensuring our needs are recognised and met.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing because I believe it's time for change. After 9 years I am extremely disappointed to see what little focus our ward, Auckland's fastest growing, has within council and council budgets. I will work collaboratively within council to resolve issues rather than just highlighting them.

candidates.name: Danielle Grant
candidates.why_elect: As the only woman standing as your Councillor, I offer a unique perspective and set of values. For the last six years I have served on the Kaipatiki Local Board. I draw on my experience of successfully managing my own business and extensive governance knowledge to lead our community.
candidates.why_stand: The North Shore is my home. I want our community to be a vibrant place to live. I have a vision for our community where our children can grow and our families prosper. Our community wants More For The Shore and, as a results based leader, I will deliver that.

candidates.affiliation: A Positive Voice for the Shore
candidates.name: Richard Hills
candidates.why_elect: I have lived on the Shore my whole life, I know my community, I listen and I get things done. I work positively with others and I don't stop until I get positive outcomes. I dedicate every day and almost every hour to getting results with our community.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing to be a Positive Voice for the Shore on Council, to get awesome things done for our city. I want a better future for our community. I will secure better transport options, the upgrades we need and a cleaner, greener city for our residents.

candidates.name: Chris Darby
candidates.why_elect: I am an experienced, effective and forward-thinking councillor with business experience and strong community connections that gets results. I continuously challenge spending and demand an accountable, public-facing council that listens to local communities.
candidates.why_stand: I want the North Shore and Auckland to be a place where people come first; where communities flourish in thriving centres with access to affordable public transport, safe cycling, quality parks and swimmable beaches. I will continue to provide big-picture vision and tackle the issues to take Auckland forward.

candidates.name: Grant Gillon
candidates.why_elect: A lifelong resident of the Shore, a local businessman, former firefighter, local board member and former councillor I have a wealth of experience for the community. I went to school on the Shore as has my family. I have used my PhD (Public Policy) to work constructively with our communities.
candidates.why_stand: North Shore is the most wonderful community I know. Yet our lifestyle is threatened by erosion of our environment and facilities. I grew up, worked and raised my family here. I love the beaches, bush and the Maunga, and especially the people of the Shore.

candidates.name: Shane Henderson
candidates.why_elect: I grew up here, and live here in with my young family. I have served as chair of the Henderson-Massey Local Board, worked with charities and community groups as a lawyer here, and led in projects to make the West a better place to live.
candidates.why_stand: I love the West, and I am standing to make this a place where every young Westie gets fair opportunities to thrive. I have a new vision for West Auckland, where housing opportunities link with local high-quality jobs and excellent public transport for modern town centres.

candidates.name: Greg Presland
candidates.why_elect: I have been a westie for 30 years, a lawyer for even longer and I have worked with many people out west doing such things as environmental protection and construction of Lopdell and Te Uru. I have also served four terms as a politician. I know how the system works.
candidates.why_stand: The west is special, Westies are great people and the Waitakere Ranges are beautiful. But our environment is fragile and I want to help protect them as well as enhance our way of live. And Council is where the really important decisions are made which is why I am running.

candidates.name: Paul Talyancich
candidates.why_elect: I have a Bachelor of Design and background in infrastructure builds throughout Auckland, auditing, quality assurance, business experience locally and internationally and I am a local business owner in Waitakere. My most valuable personal asset, is a strong moral compass, to support and back my decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I want to be an advocate and voice for the people of Waitakere who are as passionate about their area as I am. I wish to bringing a simple strategic focus to shape and develop Waitakere which is well overdue.

candidates.name: Tricia Cheel
candidates.why_elect: I love the wild west coast since I grew up with the sound of the crashing waves. My grandmother's brother was in charge of the dams, and from visits there I came to appreciate the special nature of the bush, and the importance of keeping the water fresh and pure.
candidates.why_stand: The Waitakeres are an important water source for Auckland, and the catchment needs people who will protect it from all harm such as the proposed drops of 1080 poisons, and the incursion of a totally unnecessary fluoridation plant, and champion an ecologically-sound blueprint for Auckland.

candidates.name: Linda Cooper
candidates.why_elect: I'm a proud West Aucklander who works closely with my community. I'm always available to listen and act on ideas and concerns. I have solid experience in local government and have huge energy to make our lives better. Never afraid to speak up on your behalf.
candidates.why_stand: I'm an Aucklander born and bred. I love my city and am driven to make it the best possible place to raise families. To have a well paying jobs, be able to move around easily and affordably to work and wherever we want to play. It's a privilege to serve.

candidates.name: Will Maxwell-Steele
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in the Waitemata and Gulf Ward for almost all of my adult life. I have seen far too much waste and poor planning. Being self employed, I know the value of a dollar and will question things that don't seem right.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Auckland is an amazing city and that we need to keep it that way!

candidates.name: Pippa Coom
candidates.why_elect: I will build on my extensive experience in governance, a network of community relationships and an understanding of the issues that matter to Aucklanders. I will bring to the role of Councillor valuable experience I have gained leading a local board and getting things done.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing to be a fresh voice at the council table and to make a positive contribution to Auckland's progress. I am passionate and completely committed to serving on the governing body, fulfilling the aspirations of all Aucklanders and representing Waitematā and Gulf ward.

candidates.name: Mike Lee
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the Waitemata and Gulf area for most of my life. I offer my knowledge, experience and familiarity with major issues like transport and my firm conviction than an elected representative's primary role is to represent the public to the council—not the other way round.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing again for council because Auckland is facing both a crisis of leadership and a looming financial/debt crisis. Whoever wins the mayoralty, the council's governing body needs to step up and start governing. I believe my experience, independence is needed at this time.

candidates.name: Allan Matson
candidates.why_elect: I've spent years trying to protect heritage buildings, and I think there is a need amongst elected officials for greater understanding of the built environment. Having been on various elected bodies before, I am familiar with getting items on agendas, gathering the necessary information and helping to make informed decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I don't want Auckland's future growth to be characterised by ugly development, and so I'm running because I think an elected position would provide the opportunity to bring a greater sensibility to issues around the built environment, in particular the retention of some of the city's architectural heritage and character.

candidates.name: Jessamine Fraser
candidates.why_elect: As an architect with my own practice, and an architectural design tutor, I have an expert understanding of urban and housing issues, and experience working with diverse groups and leading interdisciplinary teams solving complex problems.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see Auckland become an equitable, resilient, sustainable city, where we can all thrive in our changing world.

candidates.name: Ross Clow
candidates.why_elect: I am an experience and able community advocate with a proven record of achievement in West Auckland and Greater Auckland affairs.
candidates.why_stand: I want to ensure the delivery of key Whau projects—Avondale Library/Community Centre, New Lynn Central park and Whau Swimming Pool/Recreation Centre. As a regional councillor continue the work in delivering a sophisticated, celebrated world city of note.

candidates.name: Anne Degia-Pala
candidates.why_elect: I am a local in the Ward I wish to represent. I have lived here for over 30 years and operate a business in the local area. I know the community and I engage with all diversity. I am known through my work in injury prevention in West Auckland.
candidates.why_stand: I love the diversity that our population in Auckland reflects with over 200 ethnic groups speaking 180 languages. I believe that we need representation and inclusive leadership for all and as a strategic governance practitioner and a community engagements collaborator, I am standing to be of service in council.

candidates.name: Mark Thomas
candidates.why_elect: I have a 25 year connection with our area. I spent two terms as a member of a local board which the NZ Herald called one of the most effective. I understand Auckland Council and know how to work with whomever the mayor is to make better change.
candidates.why_stand: I know life in Auckland can be easier. I've spent the last ten years growing an international business solving tough city problems. Based in Singapore recently, I've worked on difficult transport and growth challenges in some of Asia's fast growing cities. I want to help Auckland make greater progress.

candidates.name: Cathy Casey
candidates.why_elect: I am honoured to serve you as your councillor. I am hard-working and know how to get things done. I am accessible. I have lived in Mt Albert for the last 12 years and am out and about daily with my two small dogs enjoying our great open spaces.
candidates.why_stand: It is a privilege to be your councillor currently. I love my job and the challenge of the role. I work hard to make myself available and represent you fairly. We are a very diverse area and I constantly seek ways to ensure that everyone gets their voice heard.

candidates.name: Mark Graham
candidates.why_elect: I bring the experience of running my own small business, a lifetime of community activism and advocacy, a forward-looking intellect, an ability to collaborate and innovate and a deep knowledge of my Ward and Auckland generally.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Auckland is the best city in the world—almost. I want to see it become the absolute best. But we need to plan for unprecedented challenges for climate change, housing and transport, and we need to push for a faster response.

candidates.name: Alan Barraclough
candidates.why_elect: I have a Bachelor of Science and MBA from Massey, and have worked in a variety of industries such construction, logistics and information technology. This wide experience allows me to empathise and engage with all our residents to ensure an improvement in council services for everyone.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I live in a beautiful city, which is however becoming increasingly dangerous for our children. I believe in protecting our children and future generations by providing them a safer and more liveable city in the future.

candidates.name: Mike Padfield
candidates.why_elect: I have Lived in the Eastern suburbs all my adult life. 20 years of active involvement with Council 40 years experience as a small business owner. Father of three Grandfather of 8 Anxious as our lovely City is being torn apart by Auckland Council. Passionate about our future.
candidates.why_stand: I stand to serve this community because for too long our beautiful area has been ignored by its current representatives. Too much of politics and too little of real progress has occurred for too long. I will listen—then act on behalf of all.

candidates.name: Patrick O'Meara
candidates.why_elect: I have a wealth of knowledge about Panmure, as I have grown up and worked here. I have used my management skills in local organisation that I belong to such as President of Panmure Historical Society, Chair for Panmure Basin Advisory Committee. This is my passion.
candidates.why_stand: I was asked to put my name forward because I like living here in Auckland as it is a vibrant and go ahead city. Panmure has been my family home and I have strong links with my community being involved with organisation that I work with.

candidates.name: Josephine Bartley
candidates.why_elect: I love this community and am committed to getting the best outcomes for our area. My years of experience on the local board, legal qualification, skills, relationships, community action is what I bring with me as your representative on council.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for election because our area is undergoing a lot of change and we need someone who knows this community, knows the issues and knows council in order to make sure change happens in a way that works for everyone.

candidates.name: Carmel Claridge
candidates.why_elect: I am Chair of ecological groups Friends of Pourewa Valley and the Tamaki Estuary Environment Forum. Transport Lead on the Orakei Local Board I have also help lead the team as Deputy Chair. A lawyer by profession I have been involved with schools, community groups, residents' associations for three decades.
candidates.why_stand: Community is at the heart of everything I do. I stand proudly as a person who have never joined a political party—someone who believes in policies for progress for community well-being instead of divisive party politics. I want a better Auckland for my grandchildren.

candidates.name: Damian Light
candidates.why_elect: For over a decade I've worked as a problem solver for large organisations, helping them improve outcomes for customers, staff and shareholders. I have the business and governance experience, combined with strong community connections to deliver positive change for our city.
candidates.why_stand: I'm proud to have lived and worked in Auckland my entire life. Our city is a great place to live but we need more passion, ambition and leadership to make it everything it could be. I can see the potential but I'm frustrated by slow progress and lack of engagement.

candidates.name: Faanana Efeso Collins
candidates.why_elect: Committed to social inclusion, harmony and justice, I want people of all backgrounds and leanings to feel a deep sense of belonging. I'm seeking a second term as councillor because there is still much work to do in achieving excellent local outcomes.
candidates.why_stand: Growing up in Otara and being aware of the challenges facing our communities, I want to offer a style of leadership and advocacy that is bold, informed and passionate. Manukau is an amazing place with wonderful people and huge potential. This is my home.

candidates.name: Karin Kerr
candidates.why_elect: I have lived here for over fifty years and have noticed the downgrading in our community. I have run my own business for over twelve years and held many top management jobs which have required my personal dedication to succeed with goal setting. Getting us right is my next challenge.
candidates.why_stand: I am a proud Papakura bred resident I want to see both Papakura and Manurewa become the proud towns they were. I don't want our community to be classified as the ''deprived South Auckland." Get rid of the Status Quo and give me your vote to start the necessary changes.

candidates.name: Bill Cashmore
candidates.why_elect: I have nine years experience in local government, past term as Deputy Mayor of Auckland. Prior to this I was involved in agriculture, exporting and supporting business.
candidates.why_stand: Franklin is a unique area that needs to be able to protect it's coastal environments, rural settlements and bigger towns. At the same time we need to create more opportunity in employment and quality living.
